original: khong khro ma gtogs pa phra rgyas bcu bzhi'i gnyen por gyur pa /
analyzed: khong khro ma gtogs pa phra rgyas bcu bzhi'i gnyen por gyur pa /
translated: The antidote to the fourteen negative tendencies except for anger.

original: bar chad med pa'i lam gyi mtshan nyid can /
analyzed: bar chad med pa'i lam gyi mtshan nyid can /
translated: It is characterized as the uninterrupted path.

original: lam la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa'i skad cig ma ni gsum pa ste /
analyzed: lam la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa'i skad cig ma ni gsum pa ste /
translated: The moment of perseverance for subsequent knowledge of the truth of the path is the third moment.

original: skad cig ma bco lnga po de dag ni /
analyzed: skad cig ma bco lnga po de dag ni /
translated: These fifteen moments

original: mthong ba'i lam zhes bya bar gyur to //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam zhes bya bar gyur to //
translated: are called the path of seeing.🔽Noble beings who abide in those moments are called enterers

original: de dag la rnam par gnas pa'i 'phags pa ni rgyun zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir /🔽zhugs par zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de dag la rnam par gnas pa'i 'phags pa ni rgyun zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir / zhugs par zhes bya ba la /
translated: because they enter to manifest the result of stream entry.

original: bcu drug pa lam la rjes su shes pa la gnas pa de dag rgyun du zhugs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bcu drug pa lam la rjes su shes pa la gnas pa de dag rgyun du zhugs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Those abiding in the sixteenth moment, subsequent knowledge of the truth of the path, are called abiders in the result of stream entry.

original: phra rgyas brgyad cu rtsa brgyad po de dag ni /🔽sgom pa la ltos pa med par bden pa rnams mthong ba tsam gyis spong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: phra rgyas brgyad cu rtsa brgyad po de dag ni / sgom pa la ltos pa med par bden pa rnams mthong ba tsam gyis spong ba'i phyir /
translated: Those eighty-eight negative tendencies

original: mthong bas spang ba zhes bya bar brjod do //
analyzed: mthong bas spang ba zhes bya bar brjod do //
translated: are called objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing because they are abandoned merely by seeing the four truths without relying on meditation.

original: gang dag bden pa'i rnam pa ji ltar mthong ba bzhin /
analyzed: gang dag bden pa'i rnam pa ji ltar mthong ba bzhin /
translated: Those who see the four truths as they are

original: phyis bsgom pas spong bar 'gyur ba de dag ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba ste /
analyzed: phyis bsgom pas spong bar 'gyur ba de dag ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba ste /
translated: Those abandoned by the path of meditation are the ten proclivities that are not abandoned by seeing.

original: de dag ni phra rgyas bcur 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag ni phra rgyas bcur 'gyur te /
translated: They are the ten proclivities:

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa dag dang / gzugs na spyod pa khong khro spangs pa gsum po de dag nyid dang / gzugs med pa na spyod pa gsum po de dag nyid de bcur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa dag dang / gzugs na spyod pa khong khro spangs pa gsum po de dag nyid dang / gzugs med pa na spyod pa gsum po de dag nyid de bcur 'gyur ro //
translated: attachment, anger, pride, and ignorance that occur in the desire realm, the three except for anger that occur in the form realm, and the three that occur in the formless realm.

original: de dag ni ji skad bshad pa'i tshul gyis sa dang sa las rnam pa dgur phye ba yin te /
analyzed: de dag ni ji skad bshad pa'i tshul gyis sa dang sa las rnam pa dgur phye ba yin te /
translated: They are classified as nine degrees for each realm in the manner that has been explained.

original: 'dod pa'i khams dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang / gzugs med pa bzhi de dag tu'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang / gzugs med pa bzhi de dag tu'o //
translated: They are in the desire realm, the four absorptions and the four formless states.

original: nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa re re spang bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa re re spang bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: For each degree of affliction to be abandoned,

original: bar chad med pa dang / rnam par grol ba'i dbye bas shes pa'i skad cig ma gnyis gnyis nyon mongs pa'i skad cig las bzlog nas rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: bar chad med pa dang / rnam par grol ba'i dbye bas shes pa'i skad cig ma gnyis gnyis nyon mongs pa'i skad cig las bzlog nas rnam par gzhag go //
translated: two moments of knowledge are posited, one uninterrupted and one liberated, that stop the moments of affliction.

original: 'di ltar nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa chen po'i chen po ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa chen po'i chen po ni /
translated: Thus, the great of the great afflictions is the great of the great afflictions.🔽

original: bar chad med pa dang rnam par grol ba'i lam chung ngu'i chung ngu dag gis spong ba nas nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa chung ngu'i chung ngu ni shes pa'i skad cig ma chen po'i chen po'i bar dag gis spong ste /
analyzed: bar chad med pa dang rnam par grol ba'i lam chung ngu'i chung ngu dag gis spong ba nas nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa chung ngu'i chung ngu ni shes pa'i skad cig ma chen po'i chen po'i bar dag gis spong ste /
translated: Thus, the great of the great aspect of affliction is abandoned by the small of the small uninterrupted and liberated paths, up to the small of the small aspect of affliction is abandoned by the great of the great moment of knowledge.

original: dri ma rags pa ni @160b 'bad pa chung dus bsgrub par bya la /
analyzed: dri ma rags pa ni @160b 'bad pa chung dus bsgrub par bya la /
translated: The coarse stains are accomplished with little effort,

original: phra mo ni 'bad pa chen pos bsgrub par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: phra mo ni 'bad pa chen pos bsgrub par bya ba yin te /
translated: but the subtle ones are accomplished with great effort.

original: khrus mkhan gos 'khru ba dang chos mtshungs par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: khrus mkhan gos 'khru ba dang chos mtshungs par shes par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood to be similar to a washerman washing clothes.

original: de la mthong ba'i lam gyi 'og rol du /
analyzed: de la mthong ba'i lam gyi 'og rol du /
translated: After the path of seeing,

original: 'phags pa 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa na bsgom pas spang bar bya ba rnam pa drug po'i gnyen po /
analyzed: 'phags pa 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa na bsgom pas spang bar bya ba rnam pa drug po'i gnyen po /
translated: the antidote to the six aspects of affliction to be abandoned by the path of meditation in the desire realm

original: rnam par grol ba'i lam zhes bya ba'i ye shes kyi skad cig ma'i snga rol gyi shes pa'i skad cig la gnas pa ni /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i lam zhes bya ba'i ye shes kyi skad cig ma'i snga rol gyi shes pa'i skad cig la gnas pa ni /
translated: is the knowledge called the liberated path.

original: lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la zhugs pa zhes bya ste /🔽'jig rten 'dir lan cig phyir 'ongs nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bas na /
analyzed: lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la zhugs pa zhes bya ste / 'jig rten 'dir lan cig phyir 'ongs nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bas na /
translated: One who is an enterer to the result of once returner

original: lan cig phyir 'ong ba zhes brjod la /
analyzed: lan cig phyir 'ong ba zhes brjod la /
translated: is called a once returner because, after returning to this world once, he attains nirvana.🔽One who is an enterer to the result of once returner🔽is called an enterer to the result of once returner because he is engaged in and abiding in the application for the sake of that result.🔽One who is an enterer to the result of nonreturner

original: de'i 'bras bu'i don du zhugs shing sbyor ba la gnas pa ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la zhugs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu'i don du zhugs shing sbyor ba la gnas pa ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la zhugs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: is called an enterer to the result of nonreturner because he is engaged in and abiding in the application for the sake of that result.

original: skad cig ma drug pa la ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba'o //🔽skad cig ma drug pa'i 'og rol du 'phags pa nyon mongs pa dgu pa spong ba rnam par grol ba'i lam gyi ye shes kyi skad cig gi snga rol gyi ye shes kyi skad cig la gnas pa ni /
analyzed: skad cig ma drug pa la ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba'o // skad cig ma drug pa'i 'og rol du 'phags pa nyon mongs pa dgu pa spong ba rnam par grol ba'i lam gyi ye shes kyi skad cig gi snga rol gyi ye shes kyi skad cig la gnas pa ni /
translated: One who is an enterer to the result of nonreturner

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la zhugs pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la zhugs pa zhes bya ste /
translated: is called an enterer to the result of nonreturner because he is engaged in and abiding in the application for the sake of that result.

original: 'jig rten 'dir phyir mi 'ong bar de nyid du yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bas phyir mi 'ong ba zhes brjod la de'i 'bras bu'i don du zhugs shing sbyor ba la gnas pa ni /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dir phyir mi 'ong bar de nyid du yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bas phyir mi 'ong ba zhes brjod la de'i 'bras bu'i don du zhugs shing sbyor ba la gnas pa ni /
translated: Because they do not return to this world, they are called nonreturners.

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la zhugs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la zhugs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: One who is engaged in and abiding in the practice for the sake of that result is called an approacher to the result of nonreturn.

original: skad cig ma dgu pa la ni phyir mi 'ong ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: skad cig ma dgu pa la ni phyir mi 'ong ba zhes bya'o //
translated: In the ninth moment, one is called a nonreturner.

original: skad cig ma dgu pa'i 'og rol tu 'phags pa rnam par grol ba'i lam zhes bya ba'i ye shes kyi snga rol gyi skad cig srid pa'i rtse mo'i nyon mongs pa dgu'i gnyen po la gnas pa ni dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu la zhugs pa zhes bya ste
analyzed: skad cig ma dgu pa'i 'og rol tu 'phags pa rnam par grol ba'i lam zhes bya ba'i ye shes kyi snga rol gyi skad cig srid pa'i rtse mo'i nyon mongs pa dgu'i gnyen po la gnas pa ni dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu la zhugs pa zhes bya ste
translated: After the ninth moment, one who is abiding in the antidote to the nine afflictions of the summit of existence prior to the transcendent wisdom called the liberated path is called an approacher to the result of an arhat.

original: / lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis mchod par 'os pas dgra bcom pa zhes brjod la /
analyzed: / lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis mchod par 'os pas dgra bcom pa zhes brjod la /
translated: Because they are worthy of worship by the world with its gods, humans, and asuras, they are called arhats.

original: de'i 'bras bu'i don du zhugs shing sbyor ba la gnas pa ni /
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu'i don du zhugs shing sbyor ba la gnas pa ni /
translated: One who is engaged in and abiding in the practice for the sake of that result is called an approacher to the result of an arhat.

original: dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu la zhugs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu la zhugs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: One who has entered the result of an arhat is called a “candidate for arhatship.”

original: srid pa'i rtse mo'i nyon mongs pa rnam pa dgu pa spangs pa las rnam par grol ba'i lam dgu pa la gnas pa ni /
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mo'i nyon mongs pa rnam pa dgu pa spangs pa las rnam par grol ba'i lam dgu pa la gnas pa ni /
translated: One who is abiding on the ninth liberated path that abandons the ninth affliction of the peak of existence

original: dgra bcom pa zhes bya'o //🔽zhugs pa'i gang zag bzhi dang 'bras bu la gnas @161a * //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa zhes bya'o // zhugs pa'i gang zag bzhi dang 'bras bu la gnas @161a * //
translated: is called an arhat.🔽The four persons who are candidates and the four persons who are abiders in the results are called the eight great beings.

original: pa bzhi zhes bya ba gang zag skyes bu chen po brgyad po yon gnas su 'os pa dam pa de dag ni /
analyzed: pa bzhi zhes bya ba gang zag skyes bu chen po brgyad po yon gnas su 'os pa dam pa de dag ni /
translated: They are the holy ones who are worthy of receiving offerings.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge 'dun yin no zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge 'dun yin no zhes gsungs te /
translated: The Bhagavān said that they are the saṅgha.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it has been said:

original: de la brgya byin lha yi rgyal //
analyzed: de la brgya byin lha yi rgyal //
translated: Śakra, king of the gods,🔽asked Indraviṣṇu,

original: dbang bsgyur gyis ni zhus pa dang // srog chags zhing pa rgyal 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: dbang bsgyur gyis ni zhus pa dang // srog chags zhing pa rgyal 'gyur zhing //
translated: “I am a farmer of living beings.

original: dad ldan bsod nams dag 'dod pa //🔽rdzas las byung ba'i bsod nams ni //
analyzed: dad ldan bsod nams dag 'dod pa // rdzas las byung ba'i bsod nams ni //
translated: I have faith and wish for merit.🔽Those who always perform

original: rtag tu byed pa rnams kyis zhing //
analyzed: rtag tu byed pa rnams kyis zhing //
translated: meritorious actions that arise from material generosity🔽should give to a field

original: gang la phul na 'bras che ba //
analyzed: gang la phul na 'bras che ba //
translated: that will yield great results.

original: bzang po rab tu bshad bya ste //
analyzed: bzang po rab tu bshad bya ste //
translated: I will explain the excellent field.

original: rig dang zhabs su ldan pa yis //
analyzed: rig dang zhabs su ldan pa yis //
translated: And endowed with knowledge and conduct,

original: sbyin gnas gyur zhing dge 'dun che ;🔽; zhugs pa rnam pa bzhi dang ni //
analyzed: sbyin gnas gyur zhing dge 'dun che ; ; zhugs pa rnam pa bzhi dang ni //
translated: The Sangha is a great field of merit.🔽There are four who enter and four

original: 'bras la gnas pa bzhi rnams so //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'bras la gnas pa bzhi rnams so // zhes gsungs so //
translated: Who abide in the fruits.

original: de'i phyir gal te 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dang / de dag yongs su shes pa la sogs pa med na de'i tshe bden pa mthong ba med pas 'bras bu rnams mthong ba'i phyir zhugs pa dang / 'bras bu la gnas pa'i gang zag rnams med pas na /
analyzed: de'i phyir gal te 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dang / de dag yongs su shes pa la sogs pa med na de'i tshe bden pa mthong ba med pas 'bras bu rnams mthong ba'i phyir zhugs pa dang / 'bras bu la gnas pa'i gang zag rnams med pas na /
translated: Therefore, if the four noble truths and the complete understanding of them and so on do not exist, then at that time, since there is no seeing of the truths, there are no individuals who enter and abide in the fruits because of seeing the truths.

original: dge 'dun yod pa ma yin no //🔽de la rtogs pa'i chos kyi chos mngon sum du gyur pa nyid kyis bdud thams cad kyis kyang /
analyzed: dge 'dun yod pa ma yin no // de la rtogs pa'i chos kyi chos mngon sum du gyur pa nyid kyis bdud thams cad kyis kyang /
translated: Therefore the Sangha does not exist.

original: bcom ldan 'das las mi phyed pas dge 'dun yin te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das las mi phyed pas dge 'dun yin te /
translated: In this regard, the Sangha is the Bhagavān’s assembly, because all māras are unable to divide it through direct perception of the Dharma of realization.

original: de yod par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yod par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But that does not exist.

original: gal te 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams med pa'i phyir /
translated: If the four noble truths do not exist,

original: skyes bu gang zag brgyad po de dag nyid med na /
analyzed: skyes bu gang zag brgyad po de dag nyid med na /
translated: then those eight individuals do not exist.

original: 'phags pa dam pa rnams kyi chos su gyur pa dam pa'i chos kyang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'phags pa dam pa rnams kyi chos su gyur pa dam pa'i chos kyang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The holy Dharma, which is the Dharma of the noble ones, also does not exist.

original: de la 'gog pa'i bden pa ni 'bras bu'i chos so //
analyzed: de la 'gog pa'i bden pa ni 'bras bu'i chos so //
translated: The truth of cessation is the Dharma of the result.

original: lam gyi bden pa ni 'bras bu la 'jug pa'i chos te 'di ni re zhig rtogs pa'i chos yin no //🔽de la gsal bar byed pa bstan pa ni /
analyzed: lam gyi bden pa ni 'bras bu la 'jug pa'i chos te 'di ni re zhig rtogs pa'i chos yin no // de la gsal bar byed pa bstan pa ni /
translated: The truth of the path is the Dharma that leads to the result. This is the Dharma of realization.🔽The Dharma of scriptural transmission is the teaching that illuminates that Dharma.

original: lung gi chos yin na 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams med na ni /
analyzed: lung gi chos yin na 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams med na ni /
translated: If the noble truths do not exist,

original: 'di dag thams cad yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag thams cad yod pa ma yin no //
translated: then all of this does not exist.

original: 'phags pa'i bden rnams med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden rnams med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the noble truths do not exist,

original: dam pa'i chos kyang yod ma yin //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos kyang yod ma yin //
translated: the holy Dharma also does not exist.

original: chos dang dge 'dun yod min na //
analyzed: chos dang dge 'dun yod min na //
translated: If the Dharma and the Saṅgha do not exist,

original: sangs rgyas ji ltar yod par 'gyur //
analyzed: sangs rgyas ji ltar yod par 'gyur //
translated: how can the Buddha exist?

original: gal te ji skad bshad pa'i chos yod na ni /
analyzed: gal te ji skad bshad pa'i chos yod na ni /
translated: If the Dharma that was explained exists,

original: chos dang rjes su mthun pa'i chos kyi nan tan gyis chos thams cad rnam pa thams cad du mngon par rdzogs par thugs su @161b chud pa'i phyir /
analyzed: chos dang rjes su mthun pa'i chos kyi nan tan gyis chos thams cad rnam pa thams cad du mngon par rdzogs par thugs su @161b chud pa'i phyir /
translated: then because he fully and completely awakened to all phenomena in every respect through the practice of the Dharma that accords with that Dharma,

original: sangs rgyas yod do zhes bya bar rigs par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: sangs rgyas yod do zhes bya bar rigs par 'gyur zhing /
translated: It would be reasonable to say that the Buddha exists.

original: gal te dge 'dun yod na ni de'i tshe de'i nye bar bstan pa de dag gis ye shes kyi tshogs bsags shing de la dbul ba dang / rim gro dang skyabs su 'gro ba la sogs pa dag gis bsod nams kyi tshogs bsags pa na /
analyzed: gal te dge 'dun yod na ni de'i tshe de'i nye bar bstan pa de dag gis ye shes kyi tshogs bsags shing de la dbul ba dang / rim gro dang skyabs su 'gro ba la sogs pa dag gis bsod nams kyi tshogs bsags pa na /
translated: If the Saṅgha exists, then at that time, through the accumulation of the collection of wisdom by those who are taught by him, and through the accumulation of the collection of merit by them through worship, service, going for refuge, and so on,

original: rim gyis sangs rgyas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rim gyis sangs rgyas su 'gyur ro //
translated: they would gradually become buddhas.

original: yang na dge 'dun med na rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la zhugs pa la sogs pa rnams med do //
analyzed: yang na dge 'dun med na rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la zhugs pa la sogs pa rnams med do //
translated: Or, if the Saṅgha does not exist, then those who have entered for the result of stream entry and so on do not exist.

original: zhugs pa la sogs pa rnams ma thob par ni sangs rgyas nyid thob pa ma yin te /
analyzed: zhugs pa la sogs pa rnams ma thob par ni sangs rgyas nyid thob pa ma yin te /
translated: Without obtaining the result of stream entry and so on, buddhahood is not obtained.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang sngon gdon mi za bar 'bras bu 'ga' zhig la zhugs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang sngon gdon mi za bar 'bras bu 'ga' zhig la zhugs par 'gyur ro //
translated: The Bhagavān also said, “In the past, without doubt, he entered for some result.

original: 'bras bu de la zhugs pas /
analyzed: 'bras bu de la zhugs pas /
translated: Having entered for that result,

original: bcom ldan 'das dge 'dun gyi khongs su gtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das dge 'dun gyi khongs su gtogs pa yin no //
translated: the Bhagavān belongs to the Saṅgha.”

original: dge 'dun med na ni nges par sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dge 'dun med na ni nges par sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das yod pa ma yin no //
translated: If there is no Sangha, then there is definitely no Buddha Bhagavan.

original: yang na bcom ldan 'das kyang mi slob pa'i khongs su gtogs pa'i dge 'dun gyi khongs su 'du ba nyid yin na /
analyzed: yang na bcom ldan 'das kyang mi slob pa'i khongs su gtogs pa'i dge 'dun gyi khongs su 'du ba nyid yin na /
translated: Or else, the Bhagavan is included in the Sangha of those beyond training.

original: de lta yin dang kha cig na re /🔽sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun zhes brjod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta yin dang kha cig na re / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun zhes brjod pa'i phyir /
translated: Some say:

original: bcom ldan 'das dge 'dun gyi khongs su 'du ba nyid do zhes smras te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das dge 'dun gyi khongs su 'du ba nyid do zhes smras te /
translated: The Bhagavan Buddha is included in the Sangha because he is called a bhikṣu and a member of the Sangha of bhikṣus.🔽In their system,

original: de dag gi lugs ltar na /
analyzed: de dag gi lugs ltar na /
translated: the statement

original: chos dang dge 'dun yod min na //
analyzed: chos dang dge 'dun yod min na //
translated: If the Dharma and Sangha do not exist,

original: sangs rgyas ji ltar yod par 'gyur //
analyzed: sangs rgyas ji ltar yod par 'gyur //
translated: how could the Buddha exist?

original: zhes bya ba de chos gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba de chos gsal ba yin no //
translated: is a clear teaching.

original: bar ma 'don par byed pa dag ni /
analyzed: bar ma 'don par byed pa dag ni /
translated: Those who recite the middle length discourses say:

original: gzhi chen po las sa'i rnam par gzhag pa bstan pa las /
analyzed: gzhi chen po las sa'i rnam par gzhag pa bstan pa las /
translated: In the teaching on the levels in the great basis,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sa dang po la gnas pa mthong ba'i lam skyes pa yin par smras pa na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sa dang po la gnas pa mthong ba'i lam skyes pa yin par smras pa na /
translated: it is said that bodhisattvas abiding on the first level generate the path of seeing.

original: dge 'dun gyi khongs su gtogs par rjod par byed do zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi khongs su gtogs par rjod par byed do zhes bya'o //
translated: and is called a member of the Saṅgha.

original: de lta na ni /
analyzed: de lta na ni /
translated: In that case,

original: dge 'dun yod pa ma yin na //
analyzed: dge 'dun yod pa ma yin na //
translated: the Saṅgha does not exist.

original: byang chub sems dpa' yang med pas //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' yang med pas //
translated: And since the Bodhisattva does not exist,

original: sangs rgyas ji ltar yod par 'gyur //
analyzed: sangs rgyas ji ltar yod par 'gyur //
translated: how can the Buddha exist?

original: zhes bya ba 'di gsal ba kho na yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di gsal ba kho na yin no //
translated: This is made clear.🔽Thus,

original: de'i phyir / de skad stong pa nyid smra na //
analyzed: de'i phyir / de skad stong pa nyid smra na //
translated: he who speaks of emptiness in this way

original: dkon mchog gsum la gnod pa ni //🔽byed cing ste /
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum la gnod pa ni // byed cing ste /
translated: damages the Three Jewels.

original: stong pa nyid kyi don de skad smra na /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi don de skad smra na /
translated: He who speaks of the meaning of emptiness in this way damages the Three Jewels, which are called the Buddha, Dharma, and Saṅgha.

original: rnyed par dka' ba'i phyir dang / res 'ga' zhig na 'byung ba'i phyir dang / bsod nams chung ba rnams kyis @162a * //
analyzed: rnyed par dka' ba'i phyir dang / res 'ga' zhig na 'byung ba'i phyir dang / bsod nams chung ba rnams kyis @162a * //
translated: Because they are difficult to obtain, because they occur only occasionally, and because those of little merit do not encounter them,

original: de dang mi phrad pa'i phyir dang / rin thang che ba'i phyir na /
analyzed: de dang mi phrad pa'i phyir dang / rin thang che ba'i phyir na /
translated: and because they are so valuable,

original: dkon mchog gsum po sangs rgyas dang chos dang dge 'dun zhes bya ba dag la yang gnod pa byed pa yin no //
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum po sangs rgyas dang chos dang dge 'dun zhes bya ba dag la yang gnod pa byed pa yin no //
translated: he damages the Three Jewels.

original: gzhan yang 'bras bu yod pa dang // chos ma yin pa chos nyid dang // 'jig rten pa yi tha snyad ni //🔽kun la gnod pa byed pa yin //
analyzed: gzhan yang 'bras bu yod pa dang // chos ma yin pa chos nyid dang // 'jig rten pa yi tha snyad ni // kun la gnod pa byed pa yin //
translated: Moreover, all worldly conventions🔽are undermined.

original: stong pa nyid smra na zhes bya ba de dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: stong pa nyid smra na zhes bya ba de dang sbyar ro //
translated: “All worldly conventions” is connected to “if you say that all this is empty.”

original: gal te 'di dag thams cad stong zhing gang gi tshe 'di dag thams cad med na /
analyzed: gal te 'di dag thams cad stong zhing gang gi tshe 'di dag thams cad med na /
translated: If all this is empty and all this does not exist,

original: de'i tshe thams cad kyi nang du 'dus pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i tshe thams cad kyi nang du 'dus pa'i phyir /
translated: then because all is included in this,

original: chos dang chos ma yin pa gnyis po de dag gi rgyu can 'bras bu 'dod pa dang / mi 'dod pa dang bcas pa med par 'gyur la /
analyzed: chos dang chos ma yin pa gnyis po de dag gi rgyu can 'bras bu 'dod pa dang / mi 'dod pa dang bcas pa med par 'gyur la /
translated: the effects of both virtue and nonvirtue, together with their desired and undesired fruits, would not exist.

original: 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad kyis shig /'chos shig / zo shig /'dug shig / song shig / shog shig ces bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa 'di dag thams cad kyang thams cad kyi khongs su 'dus pa'i phyir dang / chos thams cad kyang stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir mi rigs pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad kyis shig /'chos shig / zo shig /'dug shig / song shig / shog shig ces bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa 'di dag thams cad kyang thams cad kyi khongs su 'dus pa'i phyir dang / chos thams cad kyang stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir mi rigs pa nyid do //
translated: And all these worldly conventions, such as “remove,” “construct,” “eat,” “sit,” “go,” “come,” and so on, would be illogical because all are included in this and because all phenomena are empty.

original: de'i phyir de skad bstan pa'i tshul 'di ni mi legs so zhes 'dzer to //
analyzed: de'i phyir de skad bstan pa'i tshul 'di ni mi legs so zhes 'dzer to //
translated: To this it is replied:

original: de la bshad pa khyod kyis ni //
analyzed: de la bshad pa khyod kyis ni //
translated: You have not understood

original: stong nyid dgongs dang stong nyid dang // stong nyid don ni ma rtogs pas //
analyzed: stong nyid dgongs dang stong nyid dang // stong nyid don ni ma rtogs pas //
translated: emptiness, the intention of the teaching, and the meaning of emptiness.

original: de phyir de ltar gnod pa yin //
analyzed: de phyir de ltar gnod pa yin //
translated: Therefore, you are harmed in this way.

original: khyod ni rang gi rnam par rtog pa kho nas med pa nyid ni stong pa nyid kyi don yin no zhes de ltar don phyin ci log tu sgro btags nas //
analyzed: khyod ni rang gi rnam par rtog pa kho nas med pa nyid ni stong pa nyid kyi don yin no zhes de ltar don phyin ci log tu sgro btags nas //
translated: You have imputed the meaning of emptiness in a distorted way, saying that nonexistence is the meaning of emptiness, through your own thought-construction alone.

original: gal te 'di dag kun stong na //
analyzed: gal te 'di dag kun stong na //
translated: If all this is empty,

original: 'byung ba med cing 'jig pa med //
analyzed: 'byung ba med cing 'jig pa med //
translated: there is no arising and no disintegration.

original: ces bya ba la sogs pas klan ka smra zhing //🔽kho bo cag la cher yid byung bar gyur pa ni /
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pas klan ka smra zhing // kho bo cag la cher yid byung bar gyur pa ni /
translated: You have criticized us with such statements.🔽We are greatly disappointed

original: shin tu gnod pa yin te /
analyzed: shin tu gnod pa yin te /
translated: that you are harmed in this way.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun du rtog pa rnam pa sna tshogs pa dag gis nyams pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun du rtog pa rnam pa sna tshogs pa dag gis nyams pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that you are ruined by various kinds of false imagination.

original: khyod kyis yongs su bzung ba gang yin pa 'di ni kho bo cag gis bstan bcos 'dir stong pa nyid kyi don du ma smras la /
analyzed: khyod kyis yongs su bzung ba gang yin pa 'di ni kho bo cag gis bstan bcos 'dir stong pa nyid kyi don du ma smras la /
translated: Whatever you have thoroughly grasped, we have not taught that to be the meaning of emptiness in this treatise.

original: khyod kyis ni stong pa nyid kyi don ma shes pas stong pa nyid kyang mi shes shing /
analyzed: khyod kyis ni stong pa nyid kyi don ma shes pas stong pa nyid kyang mi shes shing /
translated: You do not understand the meaning of emptiness, and therefore you do not understand emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid kyi dgos pa gang yin pa de yang mi shes pa yin no //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi dgos pa gang yin pa de yang mi shes pa yin no //
translated: You also do not understand the purpose of emptiness.

original: de'i phyir dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo ji ltar gnas pa'i don ma shes pas khyod kyis kho bo cag @162b gis bshad pa dang ma 'brel zhing mi rigs pa rnam pa mang po 'di smras pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo ji ltar gnas pa'i don ma shes pas khyod kyis kho bo cag @162b gis bshad pa dang ma 'brel zhing mi rigs pa rnam pa mang po 'di smras pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, because you do not understand the meaning of the intrinsic reality of things as it is, you have said many things that are irrelevant to our explanations and are illogical.

original: de nas stong pa nyid kyi dgos pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: de nas stong pa nyid kyi dgos pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is the purpose of emptiness?🔽This has been explained in the Examination of the Self:

original: 'di ni / las dang nyon mongs zad pas thar //
analyzed: 'di ni / las dang nyon mongs zad pas thar //
translated: Liberation is through the exhaustion of karma and afflictions.

original: las dang nyon mongs rnam rtog las //
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs rnam rtog las //
translated: Karma and afflictions arise from misconceptions.

original: de dag spros las spros pa ni //
analyzed: de dag spros las spros pa ni //
translated: Those arise from mental fabrication. Mental fabrication

original: stong pa nyid kyis 'gag par 'gyur //🔽zhes bdag brtag par bshad zin to //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyis 'gag par 'gyur //🔽zhes bdag brtag par bshad zin to //
translated: ceases through emptiness.

original: de'i phyir spros pa ma lus pa nye bar zhi bar bya ba'i phyir stong pa nyid nye bar ston pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir spros pa ma lus pa nye bar zhi bar bya ba'i phyir stong pa nyid nye bar ston pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, in order to completely pacify all elaborations, emptiness is taught.

original: de'i phyir stong pa nyid kyi dgos pa ni spros pa thams cad nye bar zhi ba yin na /
analyzed: de'i phyir stong pa nyid kyi dgos pa ni spros pa thams cad nye bar zhi ba yin na /
translated: Thus, the purpose of emptiness is the pacification of all elaborations.

original: khyod kyis ni stong pa nyid kyi don med pa yin par rtog cing spros pa'i dra ba kho na spel bar byed pa na /
analyzed: khyod kyis ni stong pa nyid kyi don med pa yin par rtog cing spros pa'i dra ba kho na spel bar byed pa na /
translated: But you imagine that the meaning of emptiness is nonexistence and you increase the net of elaborations alone.

original: stong pa nyid kyi dgos pa ma rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi dgos pa ma rtogs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, you do not understand the purpose of emptiness.

original: de nas stong pa nyid gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: de nas stong pa nyid gang yin zhe na /
translated: Next, what is emptiness?🔽It is explained in the same text:

original: de yang / gzhan las shes min zhi ba dang // spros pa rnams kyis ma spros pa //
analyzed: de yang / gzhan las shes min zhi ba dang // spros pa rnams kyis ma spros pa //
translated: Not known from elsewhere, peaceful,🔽not elaborated by elaborations,

original: rnam rtog med don tha dad min //
analyzed: rnam rtog med don tha dad min //
translated: nonconceptual, not a different object,

original: de ni de nyid mtshan nyid do //🔽zhes de nyid du bshad zin to //
analyzed: de ni de nyid mtshan nyid do // zhes de nyid du bshad zin to //
translated: that is the characteristic of reality.

original: de'i phyir stong pa nyid spros pa thams cad log pa'i rang bzhin la med pa nyid du ga la yod /
analyzed: de'i phyir stong pa nyid spros pa thams cad log pa'i rang bzhin la med pa nyid du ga la yod /
translated: Therefore, how could emptiness, the nature of the cessation of all elaborations, be nonexistent?

original: de'i phyir khyod kyis stong pa nyid kyang mi shes pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir khyod kyis stong pa nyid kyang mi shes pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, you do not understand emptiness.

original: don gang nye bar bzung nas stong pa nyid kyi sgra 'jug pa de yang /
analyzed: don gang nye bar bzung nas stong pa nyid kyi sgra 'jug pa de yang /
translated: The meaning of emptiness is the meaning of dependent origination.

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba gang //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba gang //
translated: Whatever is the meaning of dependent origination,

original: de nyid stong pa nyid du bshad //
analyzed: de nyid stong pa nyid du bshad //
translated: that is the meaning of emptiness.

original: de ni brten nas gdags pa ste //
analyzed: de ni brten nas gdags pa ste //
translated: That is dependent imputation,

original: de nyid dbu ma'i lam yin no //
analyzed: de nyid dbu ma'i lam yin no //
translated: and that is the middle way.

original: zhes 'di nyid du ston par 'gyur te /
analyzed: zhes 'di nyid du ston par 'gyur te /
translated: This will be explained here.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang /
translated: The Lord has also said:

original: gang zhig rkyen las skyes pa de ma skyes //
analyzed: gang zhig rkyen las skyes pa de ma skyes //
translated: Whatever arises from conditions does not arise;

original: de la skye ba'i rang bzhin yod ma yin //
analyzed: de la skye ba'i rang bzhin yod ma yin //
translated: it does not have the nature of arising.

original: rkyen la rag las gang de stong par bshad //
analyzed: rkyen la rag las gang de stong par bshad //
translated: That which depends on conditions is explained to be empty.

original: gang zhig stong nyid shes de bag yod min //🔽zhes tshigs su bcad de gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang zhig stong nyid shes de bag yod min // zhes tshigs su bcad de gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One who knows emptiness is heedful.

original: de ltar na rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i sgra'i don gang yin pa de nyid stong pa nyid kyi sgra'i don yin gyi dngos po med pa'i sgra'i don gang yin pa de ni stong pa nyid kyi sgra'i don ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i sgra'i don gang yin pa de nyid stong pa nyid kyi sgra'i don yin gyi dngos po med pa'i sgra'i don gang yin pa de ni stong pa nyid kyi sgra'i don ma yin no //
translated: Thus, the meaning of the term dependent origination is the meaning of the term emptiness. The meaning of the term nonexistence is not the meaning of the term emptiness.

original: khyod ni dngos po med pa'i sgra'i don stong pa nyid kyi sgra'i don du sgro btags nas /🔽kho bo cag la klan ka tshol ba yin no //
analyzed: khyod ni dngos po med pa'i sgra'i don stong pa nyid kyi sgra'i don du sgro btags nas / kho bo cag la klan ka tshol ba yin no //
translated: You are just looking for an opportunity to criticize us by superimposing the meaning of the term “emptiness” — which refers to a nonexistent thing — onto the meaning of the term “emptiness” as it is used in our texts.

original: de'i phyir stong pa nyid kyi sgra'i don yang mi shes pa yin no //🔽mi shes @163a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir stong pa nyid kyi sgra'i don yang mi shes pa yin no // mi shes @163a * //
translated: Therefore, you do not understand the meaning of the term “emptiness” as it is used in our texts.

original: bzhin du klan ka tshol ba ni nges par khyod nyid la gnod pa yin no //
analyzed: bzhin du klan ka tshol ba ni nges par khyod nyid la gnod pa yin no //
translated: Since you do not understand it, you are certainly harming yourself by criticizing it.

original: kho bo cag la ji skad smras pa'i klan ka tshol ba de su zhig ce na /🔽gang zhig bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung rab las /
analyzed: kho bo cag la ji skad smras pa'i klan ka tshol ba de su zhig ce na / gang zhig bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung rab las /
translated: Who is it that criticizes us as you have described?🔽It is someone who does not understand the unmistaken presentation of the two truths in the scriptures of the Bhagavat.

original: bstan pa bden pa gnyis kyis rnam par dbye ba phyin ci ma log par ma shes par gzhung tsam 'ba' zhig 'don pa lhur len pa'o //
analyzed: bstan pa bden pa gnyis kyis rnam par dbye ba phyin ci ma log par ma shes par gzhung tsam 'ba' zhig 'don pa lhur len pa'o //
translated: He is someone who is devoted to the mere recitation of texts.

original: de'i phyir slob dpon gyis gzhan gyi gsung rab kyi don log par rtog pa bzlog par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir slob dpon gyis gzhan gyi gsung rab kyi don log par rtog pa bzlog par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, the Master composed this treatise in order to turn away the misconceptions of others about the meaning of the scriptures.

original: re zhig bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung rab las bstan pa'i bden pa gnyis kyis phyin ci ma log par rnam par gzhag pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: re zhig bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung rab las bstan pa'i bden pa gnyis kyis phyin ci ma log par rnam par gzhag pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: First, the Buddha’s teaching of the Dharma is based on the two truths,🔽as it is said:

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyis chos bstan pa //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyis chos bstan pa //
translated: The teaching of the Dharma by the Buddhas

original: bden pa gnyis la yang dag brten //
analyzed: bden pa gnyis la yang dag brten //
translated: is based on the two truths:

original: 'jig rten kun rdzob bden pa dang // dam pa'i don gyi bden pa'o //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'jig rten kun rdzob bden pa dang // dam pa'i don gyi bden pa'o // zhes gsungs so //
translated: the worldly conventional truth and the truth of ultimate meaning.

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis chos bstan pa ni /
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis chos bstan pa ni /
translated: The teaching of the Dharma by the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones,

original: bden pa gnyis la brten nas 'jug go //
analyzed: bden pa gnyis la brten nas 'jug go //
translated: is based on the two truths.

original: bden pa gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: bden pa gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: What are the two truths?

original: 'jig rten kun rdzob kyi bden pa dang // don dam pa'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten kun rdzob kyi bden pa dang // don dam pa'i bden pa'o //
translated: They are the conventional truth of the world and the truth of ultimate meaning.🔽As it is said:

original: de la / 'jig rten phung por rab grags pa //
analyzed: de la / 'jig rten phung por rab grags pa //
translated: The world is well known as the aggregates.

original: de la 'jig rten nges par brten //
analyzed: de la 'jig rten nges par brten //
translated: The world is based on that.

original: zhes 'byung ba las na phung po la brten nas brtags pa'i gang zag la 'jig rten zhes brjod do //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ba las na phung po la brten nas brtags pa'i gang zag la 'jig rten zhes brjod do //
translated: Therefore, the person, which is imagined on the basis of the aggregates, is called the world.

original: kun nas sgrib pas na kun rdzob ste /
analyzed: kun nas sgrib pas na kun rdzob ste /
translated: It is conventional because it is completely veiled.

original: mi shes pa ni dngos po'i de kho na nyid la kun nas 'gegs par byed pa'i phyir kun rdzob ces bya'o //
analyzed: mi shes pa ni dngos po'i de kho na nyid la kun nas 'gegs par byed pa'i phyir kun rdzob ces bya'o //
translated: The ignorance that completely obstructs the reality of things is called “concealer” (samvrti).

original: yang na phan tshun brten pas na kun rdzob ste /
analyzed: yang na phan tshun brten pas na kun rdzob ste /
translated: Or, “concealer” means mutually dependent,

original: phan tshun brten pa nyid kyis na zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phan tshun brten pa nyid kyis na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: meaning that they exist in mutual dependence.

original: yang na kun rdzob ni brda ste /
analyzed: yang na kun rdzob ni brda ste /
translated: Or, “concealer” is a conventional symbol,

original: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: meaning worldly convention.

original: de yang brjod pa dang / brjod bya dang / shes pa dang shes bya la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: de yang brjod pa dang / brjod bya dang / shes pa dang shes bya la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
translated: It is characterized by expression and the expressed, cognition and the cognized, and so on.🔽The worldly concealer is the worldly concealer.

original: 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob ni 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob bo zhes 'jig rten kun rdzob ces gang las de ltar khyad par du byed pa 'jig rten ma yin pa'i kun rdzob kyang yod dam zhe na /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob ni 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob bo zhes 'jig rten kun rdzob ces gang las de ltar khyad par du byed pa 'jig rten ma yin pa'i kun rdzob kyang yod dam zhe na /
translated: What is the basis for the qualification “worldly” in “worldly concealer”? Is there a concealer that is not worldly?

original: 'di ni dngos po ji ltar gnas pa rjes su brjod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ni dngos po ji ltar gnas pa rjes su brjod pa yin gyi /
translated: This is a description of things as they are.

original: 'dir dpyad pa de mi 'jug go //
analyzed: 'dir dpyad pa de mi 'jug go //
translated: The analysis does not apply here.

original: rnam pa gcig tu na /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na /
translated: In one sense,

original: rab rib dang ling tog sngon po dang / mig @163b ser la sogs pas dbang po nyams pas mthong ba phyin ci log la gnas pa de dag ni 'jig rten ma yin te /
analyzed: rab rib dang ling tog sngon po dang / mig @163b ser la sogs pas dbang po nyams pas mthong ba phyin ci log la gnas pa de dag ni 'jig rten ma yin te /
translated: Those who are not of the world are those who, due to a defect in their faculties, such as cataracts, jaundice, or an eye disease, perceive things in a distorted way.

original: de dag gi kun rdzob gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: de dag gi kun rdzob gang yin pa de ni /
translated: The conventional truth of those who are not of the world

original: 'jig rten kun rdzob bden pa ma yin pas //
analyzed: 'jig rten kun rdzob bden pa ma yin pas //
translated: is not the conventional truth of the world.

original: 'jig rten kun rdzob bden pa dang // zhes de las khyad par du byas so //
analyzed: 'jig rten kun rdzob bden pa dang // zhes de las khyad par du byas so //
translated: Therefore, it is distinguished from the conventional truth of the world.

original: 'di yang dbu ma la 'jug pa las rgyas par bshad pas de las khong du chud par bya'o //🔽'jig rten gyi kun rdzob tu bden pa ni //
analyzed: 'di yang dbu ma la 'jug pa las rgyas par bshad pas de las khong du chud par bya'o // 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob tu bden pa ni //
translated: This is explained extensively in the Introduction to the Middle Way, so you should understand it from there.🔽The truth that is conventional in the world

original: 'jig rten kun rdzob bden pa ste //
analyzed: 'jig rten kun rdzob bden pa ste //
translated: is the conventional truth of the world.

original: brjod bya dang / rjod byed dang / shes pa dang / shes bya la sogs pa'i tha snyad ma lus pa 'di dag thams cad ni /
analyzed: brjod bya dang / rjod byed dang / shes pa dang / shes bya la sogs pa'i tha snyad ma lus pa 'di dag thams cad ni /
translated: All of these conventions, such as the expressed and the expresser, the knower and the known,

original: 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob kyi bden pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob kyi bden pa zhes bya'o //
translated: are called the conventional truth of the world.

original: don dam pa la ni 'di dag yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam pa la ni 'di dag yod pa ma yin te /
translated: These do not exist in the ultimate,

original: der ni brjod par bya ba bzlog pa ste /
analyzed: der ni brjod par bya ba bzlog pa ste /
translated: because there the expressed is stopped.

original: sems kyi spyod yul bzlog pas so //
analyzed: sems kyi spyod yul bzlog pas so //
translated: Because the domain of mind is stopped.

original: ma skyes pa dang ma 'gags pa //
analyzed: ma skyes pa dang ma 'gags pa //
translated: It is unborn and unceasing,

original: chos nyid mya ngan 'das dang mtshungs pa yin pa de'i phyir don dam pa de la tshig gam shes pa 'jug pa ga la yod //
analyzed: chos nyid mya ngan 'das dang mtshungs pa yin pa de'i phyir don dam pa de la tshig gam shes pa 'jug pa ga la yod //
translated: Like the nature of phenomena, nirvana. Therefore, how could words or cognition engage that ultimate?

original: don dam pa de ni gzhan las shes pa ma yin zhing zhi ba dang / 'phags pa rnams kyis so so rang gis rig par bya ba dang / spros pa thams cad las 'das pa yin gyi /
analyzed: don dam pa de ni gzhan las shes pa ma yin zhing zhi ba dang / 'phags pa rnams kyis so so rang gis rig par bya ba dang / spros pa thams cad las 'das pa yin gyi /
translated: That ultimate is not known from elsewhere, it is peace, it is to be personally experienced by the āryas, and it is beyond all elaborations.

original: de ni bstan par bya ba ma yin zhing /
analyzed: de ni bstan par bya ba ma yin zhing /
translated: It is not something that can be taught.

original: shes pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: shes pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not even cognition.🔽It is not known from elsewhere, it is peace,

original: gzhan las shes min zhi ba dang // spros pa rnams kyis ma spros pa //
analyzed: gzhan las shes min zhi ba dang // spros pa rnams kyis ma spros pa //
translated: It is not elaborated by elaborations.

original: rnam rtog med don tha dad min //
analyzed: rnam rtog med don tha dad min //
translated: It is nonconceptual, not different.

original: de ni de nyid mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de ni de nyid mtshan nyid do //
translated: That is the definition of reality.

original: zhes sngar bshad zin to //🔽don yang de yin la dam pa yang de yin pas na don dam pa'o //
analyzed: zhes sngar bshad zin to // don yang de yin la dam pa yang de yin pas na don dam pa'o //
translated: This has already been explained.🔽Since it is the object and it is also the highest, it is the ultimate.

original: de nyid bden pa yin pas don dam pa'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid bden pa yin pas don dam pa'i bden pa'o //
translated: Since that is the truth, it is the ultimate truth.

original: bden pa 'di gnyis kyi rnam par dbye ba ni /
analyzed: bden pa 'di gnyis kyi rnam par dbye ba ni /
translated: The detailed classification of these two truths

original: rgyas par dbu ma la 'jug pa las shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyas par dbu ma la 'jug pa las shes par bya'o //
translated: should be understood from the Madhyamakåvatåra.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis chos bstan pa ni //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis chos bstan pa ni //
translated: The teachings of the doctrine by the Buddha, the Transcendent Lord,

original: bden pa gnyis po 'di la brten nas 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: bden pa gnyis po 'di la brten nas 'jug pa yin no //
translated: proceed on the basis of these two truths.

original: bstan pa'i tshul de ltar rnam par gnas pa yin dang / gang dag bden pa gnyis kyis ni //
analyzed: bstan pa'i tshul de ltar rnam par gnas pa yin dang / gang dag bden pa gnyis kyis ni //
translated: This is the way the teaching is set forth, and

original: rnam dbye rnam par mi shes pa //🔽de dag sangs rgyas bstan pa ni //
analyzed: rnam dbye rnam par mi shes pa // de dag sangs rgyas bstan pa ni //
translated: those who do not understand the distinction🔽between the two truths🔽do not understand

original: zab mo'i 'di nyid rnam mi shes //
analyzed: zab mo'i 'di nyid rnam mi shes //
translated: this profound teaching of the Buddha.

original: zhes bya'o // 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: zhes bya'o // 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here someone might say,

original: gal te don dam pa spros pa dang bral ba'i rang bzhin @164a * //
analyzed: gal te don dam pa spros pa dang bral ba'i rang bzhin @164a * //
translated: “If the ultimate is the nature free from fabrication,

original: yin na / 'o na de nyid yin la rag mod /
analyzed: yin na / 'o na de nyid yin la rag mod /
translated: then it is indeed so,

original: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la sogs pa ston pa don dam pa ma yin pa gzhan 'dis ci zhig dgos /
analyzed: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la sogs pa ston pa don dam pa ma yin pa gzhan 'dis ci zhig dgos /
translated: but what is the point of this other, non-ultimate teaching of the aggregates, elements, faculties, noble truths, dependent origination, and so on?”

original: de nyid ma yin pa ni yongs su spang bar bya ba yin na /
analyzed: de nyid ma yin pa ni yongs su spang bar bya ba yin na /
translated: If that which is not reality is to be completely abandoned,

original: gang yongs su spang bar bya ba yin pa bstan pa des ci zhig bya /
analyzed: gang yongs su spang bar bya ba yin pa bstan pa des ci zhig bya /
translated: what is the use of teaching that which is to be completely abandoned?

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /
translated: We reply:

original: de ni de ltar bden mod kyi /
analyzed: de ni de ltar bden mod kyi /
translated: This is indeed true.

original: 'on kyang brjod par bya ba dang / rjod par byed pa dang / shes pa dang / shes bya la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can 'jig rten pa'i don dam pa khas ma blangs par don dam pa bstan par mi nus la /
analyzed: 'on kyang brjod par bya ba dang / rjod par byed pa dang / shes pa dang / shes bya la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can 'jig rten pa'i don dam pa khas ma blangs par don dam pa bstan par mi nus la /
translated: However, without accepting the worldly ultimate, which is characterized by the expressed, the expresser, consciousness, objects of consciousness, and so on, it is impossible to teach the ultimate.

original: ma bstan na yang rtogs par mi nus shing /
analyzed: ma bstan na yang rtogs par mi nus shing /
translated: And if it is not taught, it is impossible to realize it.🔽And without realizing the ultimate, it is impossible to reach the city of nirvana.

original: don dam pa ma rtogs par yang mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong khyer du phyin par mi nus so zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: don dam pa ma rtogs par yang mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong khyer du phyin par mi nus so zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach this, it is said:

original: tha snyad la ni ma brten par //🔽dam pa'i don ni bstan mi nus //
analyzed: tha snyad la ni ma brten par // dam pa'i don ni bstan mi nus //
translated: Without relying on the conventional,🔽the ultimate cannot be taught.

original: dam pa'i don ni ma rtogs par //
analyzed: dam pa'i don ni ma rtogs par //
translated: Without realizing the ultimate,

original: mya ngan 'das pa 'thob mi 'gyur //🔽zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: mya ngan 'das pa 'thob mi 'gyur //🔽zhes gsungs te /
translated: nirvana will not be attained.

original: de'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa'i thabs yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa'i thabs yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because it is the method for attaining nirvana,

original: chu 'dod pas snod ltar thog mar gdon mi za bar kun rdzob ji ltar gnas pa khas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: chu 'dod pas snod ltar thog mar gdon mi za bar kun rdzob ji ltar gnas pa khas blang bar bya'o //
translated: like someone who wants water and takes a vessel, you must first of all accept the conventional just as it is.

original: de'i phyir de ltar /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar /
translated: Therefore,

original: gang zhig kun rdzob dang / don dam pa'i bden pa'i mtshan nyid can bden pa gnyis kyis rnam par gzhag pa ma byas par stong pa nyid smra bar byed pa'i gang zag rnam pa de lta bu ni /
analyzed: gang zhig kun rdzob dang / don dam pa'i bden pa'i mtshan nyid can bden pa gnyis kyis rnam par gzhag pa ma byas par stong pa nyid smra bar byed pa'i gang zag rnam pa de lta bu ni /
translated: those who propound emptiness without having set forth the two truths, which are characterized by the conventional and the ultimate,🔽are ruined

original: stong pa nyid la lta nyes na //
analyzed: stong pa nyid la lta nyes na //
translated: by their bad view of emptiness,

original: shes rab chung rnams phung bar byed //
analyzed: shes rab chung rnams phung bar byed //
translated: those of little wisdom.🔽Like a snake wrongly grasped,

original: ji ltar sbrul la bzung nyes dang // rig sngags nyes par bsgrub pa bzhin //
analyzed: ji ltar sbrul la bzung nyes dang // rig sngags nyes par bsgrub pa bzhin //
translated: or a spell wrongly executed.🔽The yogi, having realized the lack of intrinsic existence of the conventional truth, which is merely produced by ignorance,

original: rnal 'byor pa kun rdzob kyi bden pa mi shes pa tsam gyis bskyed pa rang bzhin med par rtogs nas de'i stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa kun rdzob kyi bden pa mi shes pa tsam gyis bskyed pa rang bzhin med par rtogs nas de'i stong pa nyid do //
translated: realizes its emptiness, the ultimate truth.

original: don dam pa'i mtshan nyid rtogs pa ni mtha' gnyis su lhung bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: don dam pa'i mtshan nyid rtogs pa ni mtha' gnyis su lhung bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: He does not fall into the two extremes.

original: gang zhig da lta med par gyur pa de'i tshe na /
analyzed: gang zhig da lta med par gyur pa de'i tshe na /
translated: If something does not exist now, what could exist at that time?

original: ci zhig yod par 'gyur zhes de ltar sngar dngos po'i rang bzhin ma dmigs pas phyis kyang med pa nyid du mi rtogs la /
analyzed: ci zhig yod par 'gyur zhes de ltar sngar dngos po'i rang bzhin ma dmigs pas phyis kyang med pa nyid du mi rtogs la /
translated: Thus, since the essence of things is not observed earlier, later they are not cognized as nonexistent.

original: 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob gzugs brnyan dang 'dra ba la gnod pa ma byas pas /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob gzugs brnyan dang 'dra ba la gnod pa ma byas pas /
translated: Since the conventional reality of the world is not harmed, like a reflection,

original: las dang las kyi @164b 'bras bu dang chos dang chos ma yin pa la yang gnod pa la ma yin no //
analyzed: las dang las kyi @164b 'bras bu dang chos dang chos ma yin pa la yang gnod pa la ma yin no //
translated: karma, the result of karma, and Dharma and non-Dharma are not harmed.

original: don dam pa dngos po nyid du sgro 'dogs par byed pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam pa dngos po nyid du sgro 'dogs par byed pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor does it reify the ultimate as an entity,

original: dngos po rang bzhin dang bcas pa ma yin pa rnams kho na la las kyi 'bras bu la sogs pa mthong ba'i phyir dang / dngos po rang bzhin dang bcas pa yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir dang / dngos po rang bzhin dang bcas par smra ba rnams kyi ltar yang /
analyzed: dngos po rang bzhin dang bcas pa ma yin pa rnams kho na la las kyi 'bras bu la sogs pa mthong ba'i phyir dang / dngos po rang bzhin dang bcas pa yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir dang / dngos po rang bzhin dang bcas par smra ba rnams kyi ltar yang /
translated: because the results of karma and so on are seen only in things that do not have intrinsic existence, because things that have intrinsic existence do not exist, and because even for those who propound that things have intrinsic existence,

original: las dang las kyi 'bras bu ma mthong ba dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la sogs pa thams cad ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: las dang las kyi 'bras bu ma mthong ba dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la sogs pa thams cad ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they do not see karma and the effects of karma, and because they do not see dependent origination and so forth.

original: gang gis de ltar bden pa gnyis kyi rnam bar dbye ba ma mthong bar 'du byed rnams stong pa nyid du mthong ba des ni stong pa nyid mthong bas 'du byed rnams yod pa ma yin pa nyid du rtog par byed la /
analyzed: gang gis de ltar bden pa gnyis kyi rnam bar dbye ba ma mthong bar 'du byed rnams stong pa nyid du mthong ba des ni stong pa nyid mthong bas 'du byed rnams yod pa ma yin pa nyid du rtog par byed la /
translated: Those who do not see the distinction between the two truths, but see compounded phenomena as empty, by seeing emptiness, imagine that compounded phenomena do not exist.

original: yang na stong pa nyid 'ga' zhig dngos por brtags nas /
analyzed: yang na stong pa nyid 'ga' zhig dngos por brtags nas /
translated: Or else, imagining that emptiness is something real,

original: de'i rten gyi ched du dngos po'i rang bzhin yang rtog par byed de /
analyzed: de'i rten gyi ched du dngos po'i rang bzhin yang rtog par byed de /
translated: they imagine that the nature of things is a basis for that.

original: de ni gnyi ga ltar yang stong pa nyid la lta nyes pas nges par phung bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni gnyi ga ltar yang stong pa nyid la lta nyes pas nges par phung bar byed pa yin no //
translated: Both of these are certainly ruined by wrongly viewing emptiness.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: re zhig / gal te thams cad stong pa ste //
analyzed: re zhig / gal te thams cad stong pa ste //
translated: First, if one thinks, “Everything is empty,

original: thams cad yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: thams cad yod pa ma yin no //
translated: everything does not exist,”

original: zhes rtog na ni de'i tshe /
analyzed: zhes rtog na ni de'i tshe /
translated: then at that time,

original: 'di log par lta bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di log par lta bar 'gyur te /
translated: this becomes a wrong view.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said,

original: chos 'di log par bzung gyur na //
analyzed: chos 'di log par bzung gyur na //
translated: If this doctrine is wrongly grasped,

original: mi mkhas rnams ni chud kyang za //
analyzed: mi mkhas rnams ni chud kyang za //
translated: the unwise will be lost.

original: 'di ltar med par lta ba yi //
analyzed: 'di ltar med par lta ba yi //
translated: Thus, the one who has a nihilistic view

original: mi gtsang der ni bying bar 'gyur //🔽zhes bshad do //
analyzed: mi gtsang der ni bying bar 'gyur // zhes bshad do //
translated: will sink into impurity.

original: ci ste yang thams cad la skur pa 'debs par mi 'dod na ni de'i tshe /
analyzed: ci ste yang thams cad la skur pa 'debs par mi 'dod na ni de'i tshe /
translated: If one does not want to deny everything, then at that time,

original: ji ltar dngos po 'di ngag dmigs su zin kyang stong pa nyid du ji ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: ji ltar dngos po 'di ngag dmigs su zin kyang stong pa nyid du ji ltar 'gyur te /
translated: how could this entity which is perceived be empty?

original: de'i phyir rang bzhin med pa'i don ni stong pa nyid kyi don ma yin no zhes 'di nges par stong pa nyid spong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rang bzhin med pa'i don ni stong pa nyid kyi don ma yin no zhes 'di nges par stong pa nyid spong bar 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, the meaning of essencelessness is not the meaning of emptiness.

original: de ltar spangs nas chos kyis phongs par 'gyur ba'i las kyis nges par ngan 'gror 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar spangs nas chos kyis phongs par 'gyur ba'i las kyis nges par ngan 'gror 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Having thus rejected emptiness, one will definitely go to a miserable realm due to the karma of rejecting the teaching.

original: ji skad du rin po che'i phreng ba las /
analyzed: ji skad du rin po che'i phreng ba las /
translated: As it says in the Ratnavali:

original: gzhan yang 'di ni log bzung na //
analyzed: gzhan yang 'di ni log bzung na //
translated: Moreover, if this is wrongly grasped,

original: blun po mkhas pa'i nga rgyal can //
analyzed: blun po mkhas pa'i nga rgyal can //
translated: the fool who is proud of his knowledge,

original: spong bas ma rung bdag nyid can //
analyzed: spong bas ma rung bdag nyid can //
translated: who is ruined by his rejection,

original: mnar med par ni spyi tshugs 'gro //
analyzed: mnar med par ni spyi tshugs 'gro //
translated: will fall head first into the Avici hell.

original: zhes bshad do //
analyzed: zhes bshad do //
translated: Thus it is explained.🔽🔽

original: de ltar na re zhig stong pa nyid la dngos po med par bzung bas na /
analyzed: de ltar na re zhig stong pa nyid la dngos po med par bzung bas na /
translated: Thus, the one who apprehends emptiness as a non-entity

original: 'dzin pa po phung bar byed pa yin @165a * //🔽no ; ; ci ste bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi stong pa nyid dang / de'i rten 'du byed rnams yod pa nyid du rtog par byed pa de lta na yang mya ngan las 'das par 'gro ba'i lam la log par zhugs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dzin pa po phung bar byed pa yin @165a * // no ; ; ci ste bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi stong pa nyid dang / de'i rten 'du byed rnams yod pa nyid du rtog par byed pa de lta na yang mya ngan las 'das par 'gro ba'i lam la log par zhugs pa'i phyir /
translated: is destroyed by his own apprehension.

original: stong pa nyid bstan pa 'bras bu med pa nyid du 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: stong pa nyid bstan pa 'bras bu med pa nyid du 'gyur ro ;
translated: If one imagines that the emptiness of the Exalted Ones and the conditioned entities which are its basis exist, then even in that case, the teaching of emptiness would be fruitless because one would be wrongly engaged in the path leading to nirvana.

original: ; de'i phyir de ltar na stong pa nyid dngos po'i ngo bor gzung ba na yang 'dzin pa po phung bar byed do //
analyzed: ; de'i phyir de ltar na stong pa nyid dngos po'i ngo bor gzung ba na yang 'dzin pa po phung bar byed do //
translated: Thus, even when emptiness is apprehended as the entityness of entities, the one who apprehends it is destroyed.

original: gal te phan 'dogs pa gang yin pa de rnam pa gzhan du gzung na /
analyzed: gal te phan 'dogs pa gang yin pa de rnam pa gzhan du gzung na /
translated: If one apprehends that which benefits in another way,

original: phan 'dogs par ma gyur mod /
analyzed: phan 'dogs par ma gyur mod /
translated: it will not benefit;

original: gnod par byed par ni ji ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gnod par byed par ni ji ltar 'gyur te /
translated: but how could it be harmful?

original: 'bru dag go rims las nyams par btab pa na /
analyzed: 'bru dag go rims las nyams par btab pa na /
translated: If one plants seeds in a way that is contrary to their proper order,

original: 'debs pa po brlag par byed pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'debs pa po brlag par byed pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But it does not destroy the one who plants it.

original: de'i phyir slob dpon gyis brjod par bzhed pa'i don ston pa'i dpe gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir slob dpon gyis brjod par bzhed pa'i don ston pa'i dpe gsungs pa ni /
translated: Therefore, the Master states an example to show the meaning he intends to express:🔽Just as a snake is wrongly seized,

original: ji ltar sbrul la bzung nyes dang // rig sngags nyes par bsgrubs pa bzhin //🔽zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: ji ltar sbrul la bzung nyes dang // rig sngags nyes par bsgrubs pa bzhin // zhes bya ba ste /
translated: and a spell is wrongly accomplished.

original: ji ltar sbrul sman dang sngags kyi stobs kyis man ngag ji lta ba bzhin bzung na nor gyi phung po chen po 'gugs par byed la /
analyzed: ji ltar sbrul sman dang sngags kyi stobs kyis man ngag ji lta ba bzhin bzung na nor gyi phung po chen po 'gugs par byed la /
translated: Just as a snake, if seized according to the instructions, by the power of medicine and spells, will draw off a great mass of wealth.

original: ji ltar nye bar bstan pa bor nas 'dzin na ni 'dzin pa po nyid phung bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar nye bar bstan pa bor nas 'dzin na ni 'dzin pa po nyid phung bar byed pa yin no //
translated: But if it is seized, abandoning the teaching, it will destroy the one who seizes it.

original: yang ji ltar man ngag ji lta ba bzhin rab tu bsgrubs ba'i rig sngags kyis ni sgrub pa po la phan 'dogs par byed la /
analyzed: yang ji ltar man ngag ji lta ba bzhin rab tu bsgrubs ba'i rig sngags kyis ni sgrub pa po la phan 'dogs par byed la /
translated: And just as a spell, if accomplished according to the instructions, will benefit the one who accomplishes it.

original: man ngag las nyams par bsgrubs na ni sgrub pa po nyid brlag par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: man ngag las nyams par bsgrubs na ni sgrub pa po nyid brlag par byed pa yin no //
translated: But if it is accomplished, deviating from the instructions, it will destroy the one who accomplishes it.

original: de bzhin du 'dir yang nye bar bstan pa ji lta ba bzhin du stong pa nyid bzung na ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir yang nye bar bstan pa ji lta ba bzhin du stong pa nyid bzung na ni /
translated: In the same way, if one grasps emptiness in the way it is taught here,

original: 'dzin pa po mya ngan las 'das pa'i bde ba mchog la sbyor bar byed la /
analyzed: 'dzin pa po mya ngan las 'das pa'i bde ba mchog la sbyor bar byed la /
translated: then the one who grasps it will be connected to the supreme bliss of nirvana.

original: ji ltar nye bar bstan par spangs nas bzung na ni /
analyzed: ji ltar nye bar bstan par spangs nas bzung na ni /
translated: But if one grasps it by abandoning the way it is taught,

original: nges par ji skad bshad pa'i tshul gyis 'dzin pa po nyid phung bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: nges par ji skad bshad pa'i tshul gyis 'dzin pa po nyid phung bar byed pa yin no //
translated: then the one who grasps it will certainly be ruined in the way explained.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar stong pa nyid la bzung nyes pas 'dzin pa po phung bar byed la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar stong pa nyid la bzung nyes pas 'dzin pa po phung bar byed la /
translated: Because in this way, if emptiness is grasped incorrectly, the one who grasps it will be ruined.

original: shes rab zhan pa dag gis kyang yang dag par 'dzin par mi nus pa /
analyzed: shes rab zhan pa dag gis kyang yang dag par 'dzin par mi nus pa /
translated: And because those of little wisdom are unable to grasp it correctly,

original: de phyir zhan pas chos 'di yi //
analyzed: de phyir zhan pas chos 'di yi //
translated: therefore the Sage,

original: gting rtogs dka' bar mkhyen gyur nas //🔽thub pa'i thugs ni chos bstan las //
analyzed: gting rtogs dka' bar mkhyen gyur nas // thub pa'i thugs ni chos bstan las //
translated: knowing that it is difficult for the weak🔽to fathom this Dharma,🔽turned his mind away

original: rab tu log par gyur pa yin //🔽gang gi phyir phyin ci log tu bzung bas //
analyzed: rab tu log par gyur pa yin // gang gi phyir phyin ci log tu bzung bas //
translated: from teaching the Dharma.🔽Because those of little wisdom🔽are unable to grasp this Dharma, which is characterized by emptiness,

original: stong @165b pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi chos 'dis shes rab chung ba ste /
analyzed: stong @165b pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi chos 'dis shes rab chung ba ste /
translated: correctly,

original: sems can spobs pa chung ba phung bar byed pa de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: sems can spobs pa chung ba phung bar byed pa de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Because of that,🔽the Bhagavan, the Sage, turned his mind away from teaching the Dharma.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas /
translated: After fully and completely awakening to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment,

original: sems can thams cad kyi khams dang chos shin tu zab pa la gzigs te /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi khams dang chos shin tu zab pa la gzigs te /
translated: he saw the elements of all sentient beings and the very profound Dharma.

original: zhan pa dag gis chos 'di'i don rtogs par dka' bar mkhyen par gyur nas thub pa bcom ldan 'das kyi thugs chos ston pa las log par gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: zhan pa dag gis chos 'di'i don rtogs par dka' bar mkhyen par gyur nas thub pa bcom ldan 'das kyi thugs chos ston pa las log par gyur pa yin no //
translated: Knowing that it would be difficult for the weak to understand the meaning of this Dharma, the Bhagavan, the Sage, turned his mind away from teaching the Dharma.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it says in a sutra:

original: mdo las / de nas bcom ldan 'das mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas ring por ma lon par 'di snyam du dgongs te /
analyzed: mdo las / de nas bcom ldan 'das mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas ring por ma lon par 'di snyam du dgongs te /
translated: Then, not long after the Bhagavan fully and completely awakened, he thought this:

original: ngas chos zab mo zab par snang ba brtag par bya ba ma yin zhing /
analyzed: ngas chos zab mo zab par snang ba brtag par bya ba ma yin zhing /
translated: I have realized the profound Dharma, which appears to be profound, which is not an object of analysis,

original: rtog ge'i spyod yul ma yin pa /
analyzed: rtog ge'i spyod yul ma yin pa /
translated: which is not an object of sophistry,

original: zhib mo mkhas shing mdzangs par rig par bya ba thugs su chud de /
analyzed: zhib mo mkhas shing mdzangs par rig par bya ba thugs su chud de /
translated: which is subtle, and which is to be known by the learned and the wise.

original: de gal te ngas gzhan dag la bstan na /
analyzed: de gal te ngas gzhan dag la bstan na /
translated: If I teach it to others,

original: gzhan gyis nga'i de rtogs par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: gzhan gyis nga'i de rtogs par mi 'gyur /
translated: Others will not understand my view.

original: des nga la gnod par 'gyur zhing zhum par 'gyur /🔽thugs mi spro bar 'gyur bas gang bdag nyid gcig pu dgon pa rab tu dben pa mthong ba'i chos la /
analyzed: des nga la gnod par 'gyur zhing zhum par 'gyur / thugs mi spro bar 'gyur bas gang bdag nyid gcig pu dgon pa rab tu dben pa mthong ba'i chos la /
translated: They will harm me and I will be discouraged.🔽They will not be pleased, so I will live alone, in a secluded place, and attain the happiness of this life.

original: bde ba la reg par gnas par rab tu thob pas gnas par bya'o zhes bya ba rgyas par gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: bde ba la reg par gnas par rab tu thob pas gnas par bya'o zhes bya ba rgyas par gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: This is the extensive explanation.

original: de'i phyir de ltar bden pa gnyis phyin ci ma log par rnam par gnas pa ma shes par /🔽skyon du thal bar 'gyur ba ni //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar bden pa gnyis phyin ci ma log par rnam par gnas pa ma shes par / skyon du thal bar 'gyur ba ni //
translated: Therefore, without understanding the unmistaken way the two truths are set forth,🔽you say that the consequence of our position

original: stong la 'thad pa ma yin pas //
analyzed: stong la 'thad pa ma yin pas //
translated: is a fault, but it is not a fault for us.

original: khyed ni stong nyid spong byed pa //
analyzed: khyed ni stong nyid spong byed pa //
translated: You say that we are abandoning emptiness,

original: gang de nga la mi 'thad do //
analyzed: gang de nga la mi 'thad do //
translated: but that is not tenable for us.

original: gang gi phyir khyod kyis kho bo cag la gal te 'di dag kun stong la //
analyzed: gang gi phyir khyod kyis kho bo cag la gal te 'di dag kun stong la //
translated: You say to us, “If all this is empty,

original: 'byung ba med cing 'jig pa med //
analyzed: 'byung ba med cing 'jig pa med //
translated: there would be no arising or cessation.”

original: ces bya ba la sogs pas skyon chen por thal bar nye bar bkod pa gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pas skyon chen por thal bar nye bar bkod pa gang yin pa de ni /
translated: You say that this consequence is a great fault for us.

original: bden pa gnyis kyi rnam par gzhag pa mngon par ma shes pas /
analyzed: bden pa gnyis kyi rnam par gzhag pa mngon par ma shes pas /
translated: Because they do not understand the presentation of the two truths,🔽they do not comprehend the meaning of emptiness and the purpose of emptiness as it is.

original: stong pa nyid dang / stong pa nyid kyi don dang / stong pa nyid kyi dgos pa ji lta ba bzhin khong du ma chud pas bkod pa yin pas /🔽kho bo cag gi stong pa la ste /
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang / stong pa nyid kyi don dang / stong pa nyid kyi dgos pa ji lta ba bzhin khong du ma chud pas bkod pa yin pas / kho bo cag gi stong pa la ste /
translated: Therefore, they set forth this refutation.

original: stong pa nyid du smra ba la de'i 'thad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: stong pa nyid du smra ba la de'i 'thad pa ma yin no //
translated: But it is not tenable for them to refute emptiness,🔽the meaning of emptiness, and the purpose of emptiness.

original: gang gi phyir mi 'thad pa de'i phyir khyod stong pa nyid la nye bar thal bar brjod cing /
analyzed: gang gi phyir mi 'thad pa de'i phyir khyod stong pa nyid la nye bar thal bar brjod cing /
translated: Because it is not tenable, you are the one who is said to be “beset by emptiness”

original: stong pa nyid spong bar byed pa ste /🔽'dor @166a * //
analyzed: stong pa nyid spong bar byed pa ste / 'dor @166a * //
translated: and who “rejects emptiness.”🔽You are the one who “abandons,” “throws away,” “removes,” and “opposes” emptiness.

original: zhing sel la zlog par byed pa gang yin pa'i spong ba de nged cag la mi 'thad do //
analyzed: zhing sel la zlog par byed pa gang yin pa'i spong ba de nged cag la mi 'thad do //
translated: We do not accept that.

original: 'di ltar khyed kyis ni dngos po med pa'i don stong pa nyid kyi don du sgro btags nas thal ba brjod pa yin na /
analyzed: 'di ltar khyed kyis ni dngos po med pa'i don stong pa nyid kyi don du sgro btags nas thal ba brjod pa yin na /
translated: Because you superimpose the meaning of nonexistence on the meaning of emptiness and then state your reductio,

original: kho bo cag ni stong pa nyid kyi don dngos po med pa'i don du mi 'chad cing /
analyzed: kho bo cag ni stong pa nyid kyi don dngos po med pa'i don du mi 'chad cing /
translated: we do not explain the meaning of emptiness as the meaning of nonexistence.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: Well then, what do you explain as the meaning of emptiness?

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i don to //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i don to //
translated: It is the meaning of dependent origination.

original: de'i phyir stong pa nyid du lta ba la sun 'byin pa 'di mi rigs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir stong pa nyid du lta ba la sun 'byin pa 'di mi rigs so //
translated: Therefore, it is not reasonable to criticize the view of emptiness.

original: kho bo cag gi phyogs la ji skad smras pa'i skyon du thal ba mi 'jug pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: kho bo cag gi phyogs la ji skad smras pa'i skyon du thal ba mi 'jug pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: Not only does the consequence of the faults stated not apply to our position,

original: 'on kyang bden pa la sogs pa rnam par gzhag pa thams cad ches shin tu 'thad pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'on kyang bden pa la sogs pa rnam par gzhag pa thams cad ches shin tu 'thad pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: but also all the presentations of the truths and so on are completely tenable.🔽To demonstrate this, Nāgārjuna says:

original: gang la stong pa nyid rung ba //
analyzed: gang la stong pa nyid rung ba //
translated: For those for whom emptiness is possible,

original: de la thams cad rung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: de la thams cad rung bar 'gyur //
translated: Everything is possible.

original: gang la stong nyid mi rung ba //
analyzed: gang la stong nyid mi rung ba //
translated: For those for whom emptiness is not possible,

original: de la thams cad mi rung 'gyur //
analyzed: de la thams cad mi rung 'gyur //
translated: Nothing is possible.

original: gang la dngos po thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid 'di rung ba de la ji skad smras pa de dag thams cad rung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang la dngos po thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid 'di rung ba de la ji skad smras pa de dag thams cad rung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: For those for whom this emptiness of intrinsic existence of all things is possible, everything that has been stated is possible.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: gang gi phyir kho bo cag ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la stong pa nyid ces smra ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir kho bo cag ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la stong pa nyid ces smra ste /
translated: Because we say that emptiness is dependent origination.

original: de'i phyir / gang la stong pa nyid 'di rung ba de la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rung la /
analyzed: de'i phyir / gang la stong pa nyid 'di rung ba de la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rung la /
translated: Therefore, for whom emptiness is possible, dependent origination is possible.

original: gang la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rung ba de la 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi rnams rung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rung ba de la 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi rnams rung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: For whom dependent origination is possible, the four noble truths are possible.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: gang gi phyir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba nyid sdug bsngal du 'gyur gyi /
