analyzed: gang gi phyir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba nyid sdug bsngal du 'gyur gyi /
translated: Because dependent origination itself is suffering.

original: rten cing 'brel par mi 'byung ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par mi 'byung ba ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not non-dependent origination.

original: de ni rang bzhin med pas stong par 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: de ni rang bzhin med pas stong par 'gyur ro ;
translated: Since it is essenceless, it is empty.

original: ; sdug bsngal yod na ni sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba dang / sdug bsngal 'gog pa dang / sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam rung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ; sdug bsngal yod na ni sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba dang / sdug bsngal 'gog pa dang / sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam rung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If there is suffering, then the origin of suffering, the cessation of suffering, and the path leading to the cessation of suffering are possible.

original: de'i phyir sdug bsngal yongs su shes pa dang / kun 'byung spang ba dang / 'gog pa mngon du bya ba dang / lam bsgom par yang rung ngo //
analyzed: de'i phyir sdug bsngal yongs su shes pa dang / kun 'byung spang ba dang / 'gog pa mngon du bya ba dang / lam bsgom par yang rung ngo //
translated: Therefore, it is possible to thoroughly know suffering, to abandon its origin, to actualize its cessation, and to cultivate the path.

original: sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa yongs su shes pa la sogs pa yod na ni 'bras bu rnams rung bar 'gyur ro //🔽'bras bu rnams yod na 'bras bu la gnas pa dag rung ngo //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa yongs su shes pa la sogs pa yod na ni 'bras bu rnams rung bar 'gyur ro // 'bras bu rnams yod na 'bras bu la gnas pa dag rung ngo //
translated: If there were such things as the thorough knowledge of the truth of suffering, etc., then the fruits would be tenable.🔽If the fruits existed, then those who abide in the fruits would be tenable.

original: 'bras bu la gnas pa dag yod na ni @166b zhugs pa dag kyang rung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu la gnas pa dag yod na ni @166b zhugs pa dag kyang rung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If those who abide in the fruits existed, then those who enter the fruits would be tenable.

original: 'bras bu la gnas pa dang zhugs pa dag yod na ni dge 'dun rung ngo //
analyzed: 'bras bu la gnas pa dang zhugs pa dag yod na ni dge 'dun rung ngo //
translated: If those who abide in the fruits and those who enter the fruits existed, then the Saṅgha would be tenable.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams yod na /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams yod na /
translated: If the four noble truths existed,

original: dam pa'i chos kyang rung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos kyang rung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then the holy Dharma would be tenable.

original: dam pa'i chos dang dge 'dun yod na ni sangs rgyas kyang rung bar 'gyur ro//
analyzed: dam pa'i chos dang dge 'dun yod na ni sangs rgyas kyang rung bar 'gyur ro//
translated: If the holy Dharma and the Saṅgha existed, then the Buddha would be tenable.

original: de'i phyir dkon mchog gsum yang rung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir dkon mchog gsum yang rung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the Three Jewels would be tenable.

original: 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos thams cad khyad par du rtogs pa thams cad kyang rung la /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos thams cad khyad par du rtogs pa thams cad kyang rung la /
translated: All the distinctions that are realized in all mundane and supramundane dharmas would be tenable.

original: chos dang chos ma yin pa dag dang / de'i 'bras bu dang / 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad dag kyang rung bar 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: chos dang chos ma yin pa dag dang / de'i 'bras bu dang / 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad dag kyang rung bar 'gyur ro ;
translated: Dharma and nondharma, their effects, and worldly conventions would all be tenable.

original: ; de'i phyir de ltar na /
analyzed: ; de'i phyir de ltar na /
translated: Therefore,

original: gang la stong pa nyid rung ba de la thams cad rung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang la stong pa nyid rung ba de la thams cad rung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: for those to whom emptiness makes sense, everything makes sense.

original: gang la stong pa nyid mi rung ba de la ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba nyid med pas /🔽thams cad mi rung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang la stong pa nyid mi rung ba de la ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba nyid med pas / thams cad mi rung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: For those to whom emptiness does not make sense, nothing makes sense.

original: ji ltar mi rung ba de ltar ni rgyas par ston par 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: ji ltar mi rung ba de ltar ni rgyas par ston par 'gyur ro ;
translated: How nothing makes sense for those to whom emptiness does not make sense will be extensively explained below.

original: ; de'i phyir de ltar kho bo cag gi phyogs chos yongs su dag cing /🔽rnam par gzhag pa thams cad dang mi 'gal bar rnam par gnas pa yin pa dang / rang gi phyogs rags pa shin tu nyes pa'i skyon dang bral bar de dag dang 'gal ba la shin tu blun pas /
analyzed: ; de'i phyir de ltar kho bo cag gi phyogs chos yongs su dag cing / rnam par gzhag pa thams cad dang mi 'gal bar rnam par gnas pa yin pa dang / rang gi phyogs rags pa shin tu nyes pa'i skyon dang bral bar de dag dang 'gal ba la shin tu blun pas /
translated: Thus, our position is completely pure with respect to phenomena,🔽and it is tenable without contradicting any of the presentations.

original: yon tan dang skyon ji ltar gnas pa dag ma mthong ba /
analyzed: yon tan dang skyon ji ltar gnas pa dag ma mthong ba /
translated: Since our position is free from the fault of gross errors, those who are extremely foolish with respect to the contradictions of their position do not see the faults and qualities as they are.

original: khyod ni rang gi skyon rnams ni //
analyzed: khyod ni rang gi skyon rnams ni //
translated: You are completely transferring your own faults

original: nga la yongs su sgyur byed pa //🔽rta la mngon par zhon bzhin du //
analyzed: nga la yongs su sgyur byed pa // rta la mngon par zhon bzhin du //
translated: To us.🔽You are like someone who, while riding a horse,

original: rta nyid brjed par gyur pa bzhin //
analyzed: rta nyid brjed par gyur pa bzhin //
translated: Forgets that very horse.

original: ji ltar 'ga' zhig rta gang la zhon pa de nyid brjed nas de phrogs pa'i nyes pas gzhan la klan ka tshol ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar 'ga' zhig rta gang la zhon pa de nyid brjed nas de phrogs pa'i nyes pas gzhan la klan ka tshol ba de bzhin du /
translated: Just as someone who is riding a horse forgets that very horse and, due to the fault of being deprived of it, seeks to find fault in others,🔽in the same way, you, while riding the horse of emptiness, the

original: khyod kyang stong pa nyid rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi rta la zhon pa kho na yin bzhin du /
analyzed: khyod kyang stong pa nyid rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi rta la zhon pa kho na yin bzhin du /
translated: character of dependent origination,

original: shin tu rnam par g-yengs pas de ma dmigs pas kho bo cag la yongs su rtsod pa yin no //
analyzed: shin tu rnam par g-yengs pas de ma dmigs pas kho bo cag la yongs su rtsod pa yin no //
translated: are completely distracted. Since you do not see it, you argue with us.

original: gang dag mi dmigs pas stong pa nyid du smras pa kho na la klan ka tshol ba /
analyzed: gang dag mi dmigs pas stong pa nyid du smras pa kho na la klan ka tshol ba /
translated: Those who seek to find fault with the statement that things are empty because they are not perceived

original: gzhan gyi skyon de dag kyang gang zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan gyi skyon de dag kyang gang zhe na /
translated: What are the faults of others?

original: de dag rgyas par bstan pa'i phyir //🔽gal te dngos rnams rang bzhin la //
analyzed: de dag rgyas par bstan pa'i phyir // gal te dngos rnams rang bzhin la //
translated: In order to teach them extensively,🔽If you view things as existing

original: yod par rjes su lta byed na //
analyzed: yod par rjes su lta byed na //
translated: In virtue of their intrinsic nature,

original: de lta yod na dngos po rnams //🔽rgyu rkyen med par khyod lta'o //
analyzed: de lta yod na dngos po rnams // rgyu rkyen med par khyod lta'o //
translated: If you view things in this way,

original: zhes gsungs te /🔽gal te khyod @167a * //
analyzed: zhes gsungs te / gal te khyod @167a * //
translated: you view things as lacking causes and conditions.🔽If you view things as

original: dngos po rnams rang bzhin gyis yod par lta bar byed na /
analyzed: dngos po rnams rang bzhin gyis yod par lta bar byed na /
translated: existing essentially,

original: de'i tshe rang bzhin ni rgyu dang rkyen la mi ltos pa'i phyir /🔽dngos po rnams rgyu rkyen med pa ste /🔽rgyu dang rkyen yod pa ma yin zhing /
analyzed: de'i tshe rang bzhin ni rgyu dang rkyen la mi ltos pa'i phyir / dngos po rnams rgyu rkyen med pa ste / rgyu dang rkyen yod pa ma yin zhing /
translated: then, because essence does not depend on causes and conditions,🔽you view things as lacking causes and conditions.🔽That is, you view things as having no causes and conditions.

original: rgyu med par khyod lta ba ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu med par khyod lta ba ma yin no //
translated: You do not view things as having causes.

original: rgyu med par lta ba khas len pa ma yin na yang /
analyzed: rgyu med par lta ba khas len pa ma yin na yang /
translated: Even though you do not accept the view that things are causeless,🔽you are still committed to the view that🔽the effect and the cause,

original: 'bras bu dang ni rgyu nyid dang // byed pa po dang byed dang bya //
analyzed: 'bras bu dang ni rgyu nyid dang // byed pa po dang byed dang bya //
translated: the agent and the object of action,🔽arising and cessation,

original: skye ba dang ni 'gag pa dang // 'bras bu la yang gnod pa byed pa yin no //
analyzed: skye ba dang ni 'gag pa dang // 'bras bu la yang gnod pa byed pa yin no //
translated: and the effect itself are all undermined.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: gal te bum pa rang bzhin gyis yod do zhes rtogs na ni /
analyzed: gal te bum pa rang bzhin gyis yod do zhes rtogs na ni /
translated: If you understand the pot to exist essentially,

original: de'i tshe rang bzhin gyis yod pa de la 'jim pa la sogs pa rgyu dang rkyen dag gis ci dgos te /
analyzed: de'i tshe rang bzhin gyis yod pa de la 'jim pa la sogs pa rgyu dang rkyen dag gis ci dgos te /
translated: then what need is there for such things as clay—causes and conditions?

original: de'i phyir de dag med la /
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag med la /
translated: Therefore, they do not exist.

original: bum pa zhes bya ba'i 'bras bu rgyu med pa yang 'thad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bum pa zhes bya ba'i 'bras bu rgyu med pa yang 'thad pa ma yin no //
translated: And it is not tenable that the effect called “pot” is without a cause.

original: de med na ni byed pa po rdza mkhan dang / byed pa po 'khor lo la sogs pa dang / bum pa byed pa'i bya ba yang med do //
analyzed: de med na ni byed pa po rdza mkhan dang / byed pa po 'khor lo la sogs pa dang / bum pa byed pa'i bya ba yang med do //
translated: If that does not exist, then the potter as the agent, the wheel and so on as the instrument, and the action of making the pot also do not exist.

original: de dag med pas skye ba dang 'gag pa dag kyang med la /
analyzed: de dag med pas skye ba dang 'gag pa dag kyang med la /
translated: Since they do not exist, arising and ceasing also do not exist.

original: skye ba dang 'gag pa dag yod pa ma yin na /
analyzed: skye ba dang 'gag pa dag yod pa ma yin na /
translated: If arising and ceasing do not exist,

original: 'bras bu yang yod par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: 'bras bu yang yod par ga la 'gyur /
translated: how could an effect exist?

original: de'i phyir dngos po rang bzhin dang bcas par khas len na /
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po rang bzhin dang bcas par khas len na /
translated: Therefore, if you accept that things possess intrinsic reality,

original: 'bras bu la sogs pa de dag thams cad la gnod pa byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu la sogs pa de dag thams cad la gnod pa byed pa yin no //
translated: all of these refutations apply to you.

original: de'i phyir de ltar dngos po rang bzhin dang bcas par khas len na /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar dngos po rang bzhin dang bcas par khas len na /
translated: Thus, if you accept that things possess intrinsic reality,

original: khyod la thams cad mi rung ba yin no //
analyzed: khyod la thams cad mi rung ba yin no //
translated: everything is untenable for you.

original: kho bo cag stong pa nyid du smras pa rnams la 'di dag thams cad 'thad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: kho bo cag stong pa nyid du smras pa rnams la 'di dag thams cad 'thad pa ma yin no //
translated: For us who advocate emptiness, all of these are untenable.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar kho bo cag gis ni //
analyzed: 'di ltar kho bo cag gis ni //
translated: Thus, we maintain that

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba gang //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba gang //
translated: Whatever is dependently arisen

original: de ni stong pa nyid du bshad //
analyzed: de ni stong pa nyid du bshad //
translated: Is explained to be emptiness.

original: de ni brten nas gdags pa ste //
analyzed: de ni brten nas gdags pa ste //
translated: That is dependent imputation.

original: de nyid dbu ma'i lam yin no //🔽rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ste //

analyzed: gal te dngos po rnams stong pa nyid ma yin zhing rang bzhin dang bcas pa nyid du gyur na /
translated: If things were not empty of intrinsic reality, and had intrinsic reality,

original: de'i tshe rang bzhin ni yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de'i tshe rang bzhin ni yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir //
translated: then, because intrinsic reality does not exist,

original: sus kyang bya ba ci yang med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sus kyang bya ba ci yang med par 'gyur te /
translated: no one would do anything at all.

original: nam mkha'i mi sgrib pa ni sus kyang byed pa ma yin pa bzhin no //🔽byed bzhin pa ma yin pa yang bya bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: nam mkha'i mi sgrib pa ni sus kyang byed pa ma yin pa bzhin no // byed bzhin pa ma yin pa yang bya bar 'gyur la /
translated: Just as no one makes the non-obstruction of space.🔽And that which is not being done would be done.

original: bya ba mi byed pa yang byed pa por 'gyur na /
analyzed: bya ba mi byed pa yang byed pa por 'gyur na /
translated: And the non-doer would be the agent.

original: de dag ni de ltar yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag ni de ltar yang ma yin te /
translated: But that is not so.

original: de'i phyir dngos po rnams mi stong pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po rnams mi stong pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, things are not not empty.

original: gzhan yang / rang bzhin yod na 'gro ba rnams //
analyzed: gzhan yang / rang bzhin yod na 'gro ba rnams //
translated: Moreover, if there were intrinsic reality,🔽the world would not be🔽unproduced,

original: ma skyes pa @171a * //🔽dang ma 'gags dang // ther zug tu ni gnas 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: ma skyes pa @171a * // dang ma 'gags dang // ther zug tu ni gnas 'gyur zhing //
translated: undestroyed,

original: gnas skabs sna tshogs bral bar 'gyur //
analyzed: gnas skabs sna tshogs bral bar 'gyur //
translated: and would be devoid of the variety of conditions.

original: gal te dngos po rnams rang bzhin dang bcas par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te dngos po rnams rang bzhin dang bcas par gyur na /
translated: If things were endowed with intrinsic reality,

original: de'i tshe / rang bzhin bcos ma ma yin pa'i phyir dang / ldog pa med pa'i phyir 'gro ba 'di dag thams cad skye ba med pa dang 'gag pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe / rang bzhin bcos ma ma yin pa'i phyir dang / ldog pa med pa'i phyir 'gro ba 'di dag thams cad skye ba med pa dang 'gag pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: then at that time, because intrinsic reality is not fabricated and does not change, all these transmigrators would be without arising and without cessation.

original: skye ba med pa dang 'gag pa med pa nyid kyi phyir na /
analyzed: skye ba med pa dang 'gag pa med pa nyid kyi phyir na /
translated: Because of being without arising and without cessation,

original: 'gro ba ther zug tu gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'gro ba ther zug tu gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: the transmigrators would be permanent.

original: rgyu dang rkyen la mi ltos pas na /
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen la mi ltos pas na /
translated: Because of not relying on causes and conditions,

original: stong pa ma yin par smra ba rnams la /
analyzed: stong pa ma yin par smra ba rnams la /
translated: those who assert non-emptiness

original: 'gro ba rten cing 'brel par mi 'byung zhing gnas skabs sna tshogs pa dang bral par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'gro ba rten cing 'brel par mi 'byung zhing gnas skabs sna tshogs pa dang bral par 'gyur ro //
translated: would be without the dependent origination of the transmigrators and would be devoid of the various states.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis /
translated: the Bhagavān said:

original: mi stong cung zhig yod na rgyal ba yis //
analyzed: mi stong cung zhig yod na rgyal ba yis //
translated: If there were anything non-empty,

original: 'ga' yang lung ston mi gsung 'gyur med par //
analyzed: 'ga' yang lung ston mi gsung 'gyur med par //
translated: the Victor would not have said anything.

original: rang rang dngos la ther zug gnas de la //
analyzed: rang rang dngos la ther zug gnas de la //
translated: Those who are permanent in their own entities

original: 'phel ba med cing yongs su nyams pa med //
analyzed: 'phel ba med cing yongs su nyams pa med //
translated: have no increase and no decrease.

original: ces gsungs pa dang / de bzhin du 'phags pa glang po rtsal las kyang /
analyzed: ces gsungs pa dang / de bzhin du 'phags pa glang po rtsal las kyang /
translated: And likewise, the noble Hastikakṣya-sutra says:

original: gal te chos rnams rang bzhin 'ga' yod na //
analyzed: gal te chos rnams rang bzhin 'ga' yod na //
translated: If phenomena had any intrinsic reality,

original: rgyal ba nyan thos bcas pas de mkhyen 'gyur //
analyzed: rgyal ba nyan thos bcas pas de mkhyen 'gyur //
translated: The Victorious One and his disciples would have known it.

original: ther zug chos rnams mya ngan 'da' mi 'gyur //
analyzed: ther zug chos rnams mya ngan 'da' mi 'gyur //
translated: Immutable phenomena would not attain nirvana,

original: mkhas rnams nam yang spros pa med mi 'gyur //
analyzed: mkhas rnams nam yang spros pa med mi 'gyur //
translated: And the learned would never be free from conceptual elaborations.

original: zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: dngos po rang bzhin dang bcas par khas len na 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad dag mi 'thad pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /🔽'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: dngos po rang bzhin dang bcas par khas len na 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad dag mi 'thad pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi / 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: If one accepts that things have intrinsic nature, not only is worldly convention untenable,🔽but also🔽what is beyond the world is untenable.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa dag kyang yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa dag kyang yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate this, the treatise states:

original: gal te stong pa yod min na //
analyzed: gal te stong pa yod min na //
translated: If emptiness does not exist,🔽There would be no unobtainable to obtain,

original: ma thob thob par bya ba dang // sdug bsngal mthar byed las dang ni //
analyzed: ma thob thob par bya ba dang // sdug bsngal mthar byed las dang ni //
translated: No activity to end suffering,

original: nyon mongs thams cad spong ba'ang med //🔽ces gsungs te /
analyzed: nyon mongs thams cad spong ba'ang med // ces gsungs te /
translated: And no relinquishment of all afflictions.

original: gal te stong pa yod pa ma yin zhing /
analyzed: gal te stong pa yod pa ma yin zhing /
translated: If emptiness does not exist,

original: 'di dag thams cad rang bzhin dang bcas par 'gyur na /
analyzed: 'di dag thams cad rang bzhin dang bcas par 'gyur na /
translated: If all of these were to exist essentially,

original: de'i tshe gang ma thob pa de ni mi thob pa kho na yin pas /
analyzed: de'i tshe gang ma thob pa de ni mi thob pa kho na yin pas /
translated: then at that time, that which is not attained would not be attained.

original: 'bras bu ma thob pa 'thob par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu ma thob pa 'thob par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the non-attainment of the fruit would not be attained.

original: de bzhin du sngar sdug bsngal mthar byad par ma gyur pas de ltar yang ma 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du sngar sdug bsngal mthar byad par ma gyur pas de ltar yang ma 'gyur ro //
translated: Similarly, since previously the end of suffering was not attained, it will not be attained in the future.

original: sngar nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs par ma gyur pas phyis kyang spong par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sngar nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs par ma gyur pas phyis kyang spong par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Since previously all of the afflictions were not abandoned, they will not be abandoned in the future.

original: de ltar na gang ge phyir @171b dngos po rang bzhin dang bcas par smra bar khas blangs par gyur na /
analyzed: de ltar na gang ge phyir @171b dngos po rang bzhin dang bcas par smra bar khas blangs par gyur na /
translated: Thus, if one accepts that things exist essentially,🔽then everything is impossible.

original: thams cad mi rung ba de'i phyir /
analyzed: thams cad mi rung ba de'i phyir /
translated: Therefore,

original: gang gis rten cing 'brel par 'byung //
analyzed: gang gis rten cing 'brel par 'byung //
translated: Whoever sees dependent origination🔽Sees suffering, its origin,

original: mthong ba de ni sdug bsngal dang // kun 'byung dang ni 'gog pa dang // lam nyid de dag mthong ba yin //
analyzed: mthong ba de ni sdug bsngal dang // kun 'byung dang ni 'gog pa dang // lam nyid de dag mthong ba yin //
translated: Its cessation, and the path.

original: gang gis stong pa nyid rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid can yang dag par 'byung ba des ni /
analyzed: gang gis stong pa nyid rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid can yang dag par 'byung ba des ni /
translated: Whoever sees emptiness, the characteristic of dependent origination,

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po rnams de kho na nyid du yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po rnams de kho na nyid du yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin mthong ba yin no //
translated: They see the four noble truths just as they are, in reality.

original: ji skad du 'phags pa chos thams cad 'jug pa med par bstan pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: ji skad du 'phags pa chos thams cad 'jug pa med par bstan pa'i mdo las /
translated: As the noble Sūtra Teaching the Inexpressibility of All Phenomena says,

original: 'jam dpal gang gis chos thams cad skye ba med par mthong ba des ni sdug bsngal yongs su shes pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jam dpal gang gis chos thams cad skye ba med par mthong ba des ni sdug bsngal yongs su shes pa yin no //
translated: “Mañjuśrī, whoever sees that all phenomena are unborn understands suffering.

original: gang gis chos thams cad med pa nyid du mthong ba des ni kun 'byung ba spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gis chos thams cad med pa nyid du mthong ba des ni kun 'byung ba spangs pa yin no //
translated: Whoever sees that all phenomena are nonexistent abandons the origin of suffering.

original: gang gis chos thams cad shin tu mya ngan las 'das bar mthong ba des ni 'gog pa mngon du byas pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gis chos thams cad shin tu mya ngan las 'das bar mthong ba des ni 'gog pa mngon du byas pa yin no //
translated: Whoever sees that all phenomena are completely beyond suffering realizes cessation.

original: 'jam dpal gang gis chos thams cad dngos po med par mthong ba des ni lam bsgoms pa yin no zhes bya ba rgya cher gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'jam dpal gang gis chos thams cad dngos po med par mthong ba des ni lam bsgoms pa yin no zhes bya ba rgya cher gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: Mañjuśrī, whoever sees that all phenomena are unreal meditates on the path.”

original: 'phags pa bsam gtan pa'i dpe mkhyud kyi mdo las kyang //
analyzed: 'phags pa bsam gtan pa'i dpe mkhyud kyi mdo las kyang //
translated: And the noble Sūtra on the Posture for Beginning Concentration says,

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: Then the Blessed One said to Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta:

original: 'jam dpal 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin ma mthong bas /
analyzed: 'jam dpal 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin ma mthong bas /
translated: “Mañjuśrī, because sentient beings have not seen the noble truths as they are,

original: sems can phyin ci log pa zhes sems phyin ci log tu gyur pa rnams 'khor ba yang dag pa ma yin pa 'di las 'da' bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can phyin ci log pa zhes sems phyin ci log tu gyur pa rnams 'khor ba yang dag pa ma yin pa 'di las 'da' bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: they are said to be mistaken, and their minds have become mistaken. They will not transcend this false cyclic existence.”

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: When this was said, Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta said to the Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das gang la nye bar dmigs pas sems can rnams 'khor ba las 'das par mi 'gyur ba bstan du gsol /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gang la nye bar dmigs pas sems can rnams 'khor ba las 'das par mi 'gyur ba bstan du gsol /
translated: “Blessed One, please teach what is to be observed so that sentient beings will transcend cyclic existence.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa ;
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa ;
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: 'jam dpal bdag dang bdag gi bar dmigs pas sems can rnams 'khor ba las mi 'da'o //
analyzed: 'jam dpal bdag dang bdag gi bar dmigs pas sems can rnams 'khor ba las mi 'da'o //
translated: “Mañjuśrī, sentient beings do not transcend cyclic existence because they observe a self and what belongs to a self.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'jam dpal bdag dang gzhan du yang dag par mthong ba gang yin pa de ni las mngon par 'du byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jam dpal bdag dang gzhan du yang dag par mthong ba gang yin pa de ni las mngon par 'du byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: Mañjuśrī, those who see self and other as real will create karma.

original: 'jam dpal byis pa so so'i @172a * //
analyzed: 'jam dpal byis pa so so'i @172a * //
translated: Mañjuśrī, immature, ordinary people,

original: skye bo thos pa dang mi ldan pa ni chos thams cad shin tu mya ngan las 'das par mi shes pas bdag dang gzhan du dmigs par byed do //🔽dmigs nas mngon par zhen par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skye bo thos pa dang mi ldan pa ni chos thams cad shin tu mya ngan las 'das par mi shes pas bdag dang gzhan du dmigs par byed do // dmigs nas mngon par zhen par 'gyur ro //
translated: who are not learned, do not understand that all phenomena are utterly beyond suffering, and so they objectify self and other.🔽Having objectified, they become attached.

original: mngon par zhen pas chags par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mngon par zhen pas chags par 'gyur ro //
translated: Through attachment, they become desirous.

original: sdang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sdang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They become hateful.

original: rmongs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rmongs par 'gyur ro //
translated: They become ignorant.

original: de chags pa dang sdang ba dang rmongs par gyur pas /
analyzed: de chags pa dang sdang ba dang rmongs par gyur pas /
translated: Through desire, hatred, and ignorance,

original: lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las rnam pa gsum mngon par 'du byed do //
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las rnam pa gsum mngon par 'du byed do //
translated: they create the three kinds of karma with their body, speech, and mind.

original: de yod pa ma yin pa la sgro 'dogs pas bdag ni chags so //
analyzed: de yod pa ma yin pa la sgro 'dogs pas bdag ni chags so //
translated: Since they superimpose what does not exist, they think, ‘I am desirous.

original: bdag ni sdang ngo //🔽bdag ni rmongs so snyam du rnam par rtog par byed do //
analyzed: bdag ni sdang ngo //🔽bdag ni rmongs so snyam du rnam par rtog par byed do //
translated: I am hateful.🔽I am ignorant.’

original: de de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa la rab tu byung nas 'di snyam du sems te /🔽bdag ni tshul khrims dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa la rab tu byung nas 'di snyam du sems te / bdag ni tshul khrims dang ldan pa'o //
translated: He goes forth in the teachings of the Thus-Gone One and thinks,🔽‘I am disciplined.

original: bdag ni tshangs par spyod pa'o //
analyzed: bdag ni tshangs par spyod pa'o //
translated: I am celibate.

original: bdag ni 'khor ba las yang dag par 'da' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag ni 'khor ba las yang dag par 'da' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: I will transcend saṃsāra.

original: bdag gis mya ngan las 'das pa thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag gis mya ngan las 'das pa thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: I will attain nirvāṇa.

original: bdag ni sdug bsngal rnams las thar bar 'gyur ro snyam du rtog par byed cing /
analyzed: bdag ni sdug bsngal rnams las thar bar 'gyur ro snyam du rtog par byed cing /
translated: I will be liberated from suffering.’

original: de chos 'di dag ni dge ba'o //
analyzed: de chos 'di dag ni dge ba'o //
translated: He thinks, ‘These are virtuous phenomena.

original: chos 'di dag ni mi dge ba'o //🔽chos 'di dag ni spang bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: chos 'di dag ni mi dge ba'o // chos 'di dag ni spang bar bya ba'o //
translated: These are unvirtuous phenomena.🔽These phenomena are to be abandoned.

original: chos 'di dag ni mngon du bya ba'o //
analyzed: chos 'di dag ni mngon du bya ba'o //
translated: These phenomena are to be actualized.

original: sdug bsngal yongs su shes par bya'o //🔽kun 'byung spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal yongs su shes par bya'o // kun 'byung spang bar bya'o //
translated: Suffering is to be understood.🔽The origin of suffering is to be relinquished.

original: 'gog pa mngon du bya'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa mngon du bya'o //
translated: Cessation is to be actualized.

original: lam bsgom par bya'o snyam du rtog go //
analyzed: lam bsgom par bya'o snyam du rtog go //
translated: The path is to be cultivated.’

original: de nas de gang zhig 'du byed thams cad las 'byol par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas de gang zhig 'du byed thams cad las 'byol par 'gyur ro //
translated: Then he thinks, ‘I will escape from all formations.

original: 'du byed thams cad ni mi rtag pa'o //
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad ni mi rtag pa'o //
translated: All formations are impermanent.

original: 'du byed thams cad ni kun tu 'bar ba'o snyam du rtog par byed do //
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad ni kun tu 'bar ba'o snyam du rtog par byed do //
translated: He thinks, “All formations are burning.”

original: de ltar rtog pa de la skyo ba dang lhan cig tu gyur pa yid la byed pa mtshan ma med pa sngon du 'gro ba skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar rtog pa de la skyo ba dang lhan cig tu gyur pa yid la byed pa mtshan ma med pa sngon du 'gro ba skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, the attention that is accompanied by disenchantment and preceded by the signless arises in him.

original: de 'di snyam du chos 'di dag yongs su shes pa gang yin pa de ni sdug bsngal yongs su shes pa'o snyam du sems so //
analyzed: de 'di snyam du chos 'di dag yongs su shes pa gang yin pa de ni sdug bsngal yongs su shes pa'o snyam du sems so //
translated: He thinks, “The full understanding of these phenomena is the full understanding of suffering.”

original: de 'di snyam du gang bdag gis kun 'byung spang bar bya'o snyam du sems par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de 'di snyam du gang bdag gis kun 'byung spang bar bya'o snyam du sems par 'gyur zhing /
translated: He thinks, “I must abandon the origin.”

original: chos 'di dag gis nyen par 'gyur /🔽ches ngo tsha bar 'gyur /
analyzed: chos 'di dag gis nyen par 'gyur / ches ngo tsha bar 'gyur /
translated: He is tormented by these phenomena.🔽He is ashamed of them.

original: mi dga' bar 'gyur /
analyzed: mi dga' bar 'gyur /
translated: He is disgusted by them.

original: smod par 'gyur /
analyzed: smod par 'gyur /
translated: He condemns them.

original: skrag cing dngang la kun tu dngang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skrag cing dngang la kun tu dngang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: He is frightened and terrified by them.

original: de 'di snyam du gang chos 'di dag gis nyen po de ni chos 'di dag mngon du byas pa yin zhing /
analyzed: de 'di snyam du gang chos 'di dag gis nyen po de ni chos 'di dag mngon du byas pa yin zhing /
translated: He thinks, “The one who is tormented by these phenomena has realized these phenomena.

original: 'di ni kun 'byung spang ba'o @172b snyam du sems par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ni kun 'byung spang ba'o @172b snyam du sems par 'gyur ro //
translated: This is the abandonment of the origin.”

original: de 'di snyam du 'gog pa mngon du bya'o snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de 'di snyam du 'gog pa mngon du bya'o snyam du sems te /
translated: He thinks, “I will realize cessation.”

original: de gnyis su brtags nas 'gog pa mngon du shes pa yin no //
analyzed: de gnyis su brtags nas 'gog pa mngon du shes pa yin no //
translated: Having investigated these two, he realizes cessation.

original: de 'di snyam du 'gog pa mngon du byas pa de ni 'di yin no snyam du sems so //
analyzed: de 'di snyam du 'gog pa mngon du byas pa de ni 'di yin no snyam du sems so //
translated: He thinks, “This is the realization of cessation.”

original: de 'di snyam du gang bdag gis lam sgom mo snyam du sems shing /
analyzed: de 'di snyam du gang bdag gis lam sgom mo snyam du sems shing /
translated: He thinks, “I will cultivate the path.”

original: de gcig pu dben par song nas chos de dag yid la byed pa na zhi gnas 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de gcig pu dben par song nas chos de dag yid la byed pa na zhi gnas 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Having gone to a solitary place, he brings to mind those dharmas, and he attains serenity.

original: skyo ba dang lhan cig tu gyur pa'i yid la byed pa de de la zhi gnas skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skyo ba dang lhan cig tu gyur pa'i yid la byed pa de de la zhi gnas skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: That attention accompanied by weariness gives rise to serenity.

original: de chos thams cad la sems phyir 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de chos thams cad la sems phyir 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: He turns his mind away from all dharmas.

original: phyir 'dren zhing phyir ldog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyir 'dren zhing phyir ldog par 'gyur ro //
translated: He turns back, he turns away.

original: de dag gis nyen par 'gyur /
analyzed: de dag gis nyen par 'gyur /
translated: He is oppressed by them.

original: ches ngo tsha bar 'gyur /
analyzed: ches ngo tsha bar 'gyur /
translated: He is very ashamed.

original: mngon par mi dga' ba'i sems skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mngon par mi dga' ba'i sems skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: He feels a sense of urgency.

original: de 'di snyam du bdag sdug bsngal thams cad las grol bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de 'di snyam du bdag sdug bsngal thams cad las grol bar 'gyur te /
translated: He thinks, “I will be liberated from all suffering.

original: yang phyis bya ba ci yang med cing bdag ni dgra bcom par gyur to zhes bya bar bdag nyid shes so //
analyzed: yang phyis bya ba ci yang med cing bdag ni dgra bcom par gyur to zhes bya bar bdag nyid shes so //
translated: Later, when there was nothing more to do, he thought, “I have become an arhat.”

original: de 'chi ba'i dus byed pa'i tshe bdag nyid skye bar mthong bas /
analyzed: de 'chi ba'i dus byed pa'i tshe bdag nyid skye bar mthong bas /
translated: But when he saw himself being reborn,

original: de sangs rgyas kyi byang chub la the tshom dang som nyi za bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de sangs rgyas kyi byang chub la the tshom dang som nyi za bar 'gyur ro //

original: de som nyir lhung ste 'chi ba'i dus byas nas dmyal ba chen po dag tu lhung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de som nyir lhung ste 'chi ba'i dus byas nas dmyal ba chen po dag tu lhung bar 'gyur ro //

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: ji ltar skye ba med pa'i chos rnams la brtags nas /
analyzed: ji ltar skye ba med pa'i chos rnams la brtags nas /

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la som nyi dang yid gnyis skyed par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la som nyi dang yid gnyis skyed par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and became uncertain about the Tathāgata.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta said to the Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po rnams la ji ltar 'khums par bgyi /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po rnams la ji ltar 'khums par bgyi /
translated: “Blessed One, how should one be doubtful about the four noble truths?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,🔽“Mañjuśrī,

original: 'jam dpal gang gis chos thams cad ma skyes par mthong ba des ni /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gang gis chos thams cad ma skyes par mthong ba des ni /
translated: Mañjuśrī, whoever sees all phenomena as unborn

original: sdug bsngal yongs su shes pa yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal yongs su shes pa yin no //
translated: knows suffering.🔽Whoever sees all phenomena as unarisen

original: gang gis chos thams cad 'byung ba med par mthong ba des ni kun 'byung ba spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gis chos thams cad 'byung ba med par mthong ba des ni kun 'byung ba spangs pa yin no //
translated: abandons the origin.🔽Whoever sees all phenomena as utterly nirvāṇa

original: gang gis chos thams cad gtan mya ngan las 'das par mthong ba des ni 'gog pa mngon du byas pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gis chos thams cad gtan mya ngan las 'das par mthong ba des ni 'gog pa mngon du byas pa yin no //
translated: realizes cessation.🔽Whoever sees all phenomena as utterly unborn

original: gang gis chos thams cad shin tu ma skyes par mthong ba des ni lam bsgoms pa yin no //🔽'jam dpal gang gis de ltar @173a * //
analyzed: gang gis chos thams cad shin tu ma skyes par mthong ba des ni lam bsgoms pa yin no // 'jam dpal gang gis de ltar @173a * //
translated: cultivates the path.🔽Mañjuśrī, whoever sees the four noble truths🔽in this way

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po mthong ba des ni chos 'di dag ni dge ba'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po mthong ba des ni chos 'di dag ni dge ba'o //
translated: knows that some phenomena are virtuous

original: chos 'di dag ni mi dge ba'o //🔽chos 'di dag ni spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: chos 'di dag ni mi dge ba'o // chos 'di dag ni spang bar bya'o //
translated: and some are nonvirtuous,🔽that some phenomena are to be abandoned

original: chos 'di dag ni mngon du bya'o //
analyzed: chos 'di dag ni mngon du bya'o //

original: sdug bsngal yongs su shes par bya /🔽kun 'byung spang bar bya /
analyzed: sdug bsngal yongs su shes par bya / kun 'byung spang bar bya /
translated: and that suffering is to be fully understood,🔽the origin is to be abandoned,

original: 'gog pa mngon du bya /
analyzed: 'gog pa mngon du bya /
translated: and cessation is to be realized.

original: lam bsgom par bya'o zhes mi rtog rnam par rtog par mi byed de /
analyzed: lam bsgom par bya'o zhes mi rtog rnam par rtog par mi byed de /
translated: “I will cultivate the path” — he does not think in such terms.

original: 'di ltar gang brtag par bya ba'i chos de des ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar gang brtag par bya ba'i chos de des ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //

original: byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams ni chos de dag la rtog pa na chags par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams ni chos de dag la rtog pa na chags par 'gyur ro //
translated: When ordinary people imagine those dharmas, they become attached to them.

original: sdang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sdang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They become averse to them.

original: rmongs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rmongs par 'gyur ro //
translated: They become confused about them.

original: de chos 'ga' yang mi len mi 'dor de ltar mi len mi 'dor ba de ni /
analyzed: de chos 'ga' yang mi len mi 'dor de ltar mi len mi 'dor ba de ni /
translated: He does not take up or reject any dharma.

original: khams gsum la sems chags par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khams gsum la sems chags par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: He does not become attached to the three realms.

original: khams gsum thams cad ma skyes pa dang / sgyu ma lta bu dang / rmi lam lta bu dang / brag ca lta bur mthong ngo //
analyzed: khams gsum thams cad ma skyes pa dang / sgyu ma lta bu dang / rmi lam lta bu dang / brag ca lta bur mthong ngo //
translated: He sees the entire three realms as unborn, like an illusion, like a dream, like an echo.

original: chos thams cad de lta bu'i rang bzhin can du mthong bas sems can thams cad la rjes su chags pa dang / khong khro ba dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad de lta bu'i rang bzhin can du mthong bas sems can thams cad la rjes su chags pa dang / khong khro ba dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Seeing all dharmas as having that kind of nature, he becomes free of attachment and aversion to all sentient beings.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?
