analyzed: 'di ltar des gang la rjes su chags pa dang / khong khro bar 'gyur ba'i chos de ma dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he does not apprehend any phenomenon in which he might abide or in which he might become angry.

original: des sems nam mkha' dang mnyam pas sangs rgyas kyang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
analyzed: des sems nam mkha' dang mnyam pas sangs rgyas kyang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
translated: Since his mind is equal to space, he does not see even the Buddha as real.

original: chos kyang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
analyzed: chos kyang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
translated: He does not see even the Dharma as real.

original: dge 'dun yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong zhing /
analyzed: dge 'dun yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong zhing /
translated: He does not see even the Saṅgha as real.

original: chos thams cad stong pa'o zhes bya bar mthong bas chos gang la yang som nyi skyed par mi byed do //
analyzed: chos thams cad stong pa'o zhes bya bar mthong bas chos gang la yang som nyi skyed par mi byed do //
translated: Since he sees all phenomena as empty, he does not generate doubt about any phenomenon.

original: som nyi med pas nye bar len pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: som nyi med pas nye bar len pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since he is without doubt, he does not grasp.

original: nye bar len pa med pas nye bar len pa med par yongs su mya ngan las 'da'o zhes rgya cher gsungs so //🔽slob dpon zla ba grags pa'i zhal snga nas sbyar ba'i tshigs gsal ba las /
analyzed: nye bar len pa med pas nye bar len pa med par yongs su mya ngan las 'da'o zhes rgya cher gsungs so // slob dpon zla ba grags pa'i zhal snga nas sbyar ba'i tshigs gsal ba las /
translated: Since he does not grasp, he attains nirvāṇa without grasping.”

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa brtag pa zhes bya ba rab tu byed pa nyi shu bzhi pa'i 'grel pa'o /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa brtag pa zhes bya ba rab tu byed pa nyi shu bzhi pa'i 'grel pa'o /
translated: This concludes the commentary on the twenty-fourth chapter, having twenty-four verses, called “the investigation of the noble truths.

original: // /'dir smras pa /
analyzed: // /'dir smras pa /
translated: Here someone might say:

original: gal te 'di dag kun stong na //
analyzed: gal te 'di dag kun stong na //
translated: If all this is empty,

original: 'byung ba med cing 'jig pa med //
analyzed: 'byung ba med cing 'jig pa med //
translated: There is neither arising nor disintegration.

original: gang zhig spang dang 'gog pa las //
analyzed: gang zhig spang dang 'gog pa las //
translated: From the cessation of what

original: mya ngan 'da' bar 'gyur bar 'dod //
analyzed: mya ngan 'da' bar 'gyur bar 'dod //
translated: Is nirvana asserted?

original: 'di na bcom ldan 'das @173b kyis gang zag changs par spyod pa bsten zhing /
analyzed: 'di na bcom ldan 'das @173b kyis gang zag changs par spyod pa bsten zhing /
translated: Here the Bhagavān taught that for those who are persons who practice pure conduct,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa la zhugs pa chos rjes su mthun pa'i chos kyi nan tan dang ldan pa rnams la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa la zhugs pa chos rjes su mthun pa'i chos kyi nan tan dang ldan pa rnams la /
translated: who have entered the teachings of the Tathāgata, and who are endowed with the practice of the Dharma that accords with the Dharma,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa rnam pa gnyis su gsungs te /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa rnam pa gnyis su gsungs te /
translated: there are two kinds of nirvana:

original: phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa dang / phung po lhag ma med pa'o //
analyzed: phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa dang / phung po lhag ma med pa'o //
translated: Nirvana with remainder and nirvana without remainder.

original: de la ma rig pa dang 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa'i tshogs ma lus par spangs pa las phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das par 'dod do //
analyzed: de la ma rig pa dang 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa'i tshogs ma lus par spangs pa las phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das par 'dod do //
translated: Among them, nirvana with remainder is asserted to be the abandonment of the entire mass of afflictions such as ignorance and attachment without remainder.

original: de la 'di la bdag la chags pa bsten pas na phung po ste /
analyzed: de la 'di la bdag la chags pa bsten pas na phung po ste /
translated: In that regard, it is a heap because it is relied on by attachment to a self.

original: bdag tu gdags pa'i rgyu nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la phung po'i sgras brjod do //🔽lhag ma lus pas na lhag ma'o //
analyzed: bdag tu gdags pa'i rgyu nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la phung po'i sgras brjod do // lhag ma lus pas na lhag ma'o //
translated: The term “aggregates” refers to the five appropriated aggregates that are the causes for the imputation of self.🔽The term “remainder” means that which remains.

original: phung po nyid lhag ma yin pas na phung po lhag ma'o //
analyzed: phung po nyid lhag ma yin pas na phung po lhag ma'o //
translated: The remainder is the aggregates.

original: phung po lhag ma dang lhan cig gnas pas na phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: phung po lhag ma dang lhan cig gnas pas na phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa'o //
translated: The term “with remainder” means that which remains together with the aggregates.

original: de ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: de ci yin zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: It is nirvana.🔽It is like a village that remains after a band of thieves has been completely killed.

original: de yang chom rkun gyi tshogs ma lus par bsad de grang tsam 'dug pa dang chos mthun par 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa nyon mongs pa'i chom rkun dang bral ba phung po tsam 'ba' zhig lus pa ste /
analyzed: de yang chom rkun gyi tshogs ma lus par bsad de grang tsam 'dug pa dang chos mthun par 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa nyon mongs pa'i chom rkun dang bral ba phung po tsam 'ba' zhig lus pa ste /
translated: It is the mere remaining of the aggregates that is free from the band of thieves that are the afflictions, such as the afflicted view of the self.

original: de ni phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: de ni phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: That is nirvana with remainder.

original: chom rkun gyi tshogs ma lus par bsad de grong tsam po yang zhig pa dang chos mtshungs par mya ngan las 'das pa gang la phung po tsam yang yod pa ma yin pa de ni phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: chom rkun gyi tshogs ma lus par bsad de grong tsam po yang zhig pa dang chos mtshungs par mya ngan las 'das pa gang la phung po tsam yang yod pa ma yin pa de ni phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
translated: Just as a village is destroyed when a band of robbers is killed, so too, nirvana is the non-existence of even the aggregates.

original: 'di phung po'i lhag ma dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di phung po'i lhag ma dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is nirvana without remainder because it is free from the remainder of the aggregates.

original: de nyid kyi dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de nyid kyi dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: With reference to just that, it is said:

original: gang na lus zhig 'du shes 'gags //
analyzed: gang na lus zhig 'du shes 'gags //
translated: Where the body is destroyed,🔽perception ceases,

original: tshor ba thams cad bral gyur zhing //
analyzed: tshor ba thams cad bral gyur zhing //
translated: all feelings are eliminated,

original: 'du byed nye bar zhi ba dang // rnam par shes pa nub gyur pa //
analyzed: 'du byed nye bar zhi ba dang // rnam par shes pa nub gyur pa //
translated: volitions are pacified, and consciousness has set.

original: zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du /
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du /
translated: And similarly:

original: ma zhum ba yi lus kyis ni //
analyzed: ma zhum ba yi lus kyis ni //
translated: With an undaunted body,

original: tshor ba dang du len pa na //
analyzed: tshor ba dang du len pa na //
translated: he endures feelings.

original: de yi sems ni rnam par grol //🔽mar me shi bar gyur pa bzhin //
analyzed: de yi sems ni rnam par grol // mar me shi bar gyur pa bzhin //
translated: His mind is liberated,

original: zhes bshad do //
analyzed: zhes bshad do //
translated: like a flame blown out by the wind.

original: de'i phyir phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa de ni phung po 'gags pa las 'thob bo //
analyzed: de'i phyir phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa de ni phung po 'gags pa las 'thob bo //
translated: Therefore, nirvana without remainder is attained from the cessation of the aggregates.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa rnam pa gnyis po de ji ltar rung bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa rnam pa gnyis po de ji ltar rung bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How could these two types of nirvana be tenable?

original: gal te nyon mongs pa rnams dang phung po rnams 'gags par gyur pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te nyon mongs pa rnams dang phung po rnams 'gags par gyur pa yin na /
translated: If the afflictions and the aggregates were to cease,

original: gang @174a * //
analyzed: gang @174a * //
translated: then what would🔽cease in order for nirvana to occur?

original: gi tshe 'di dag thams cad stong pa yin zhing /
analyzed: gi tshe 'di dag thams cad stong pa yin zhing /
translated: When all of these are empty

original: cung zad kyang skye ba med la cung zad kyang 'gag pa yang med pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: cung zad kyang skye ba med la cung zad kyang 'gag pa yang med pa de'i tshe /
translated: and nothing whatsoever arises or ceases,🔽then what afflictions and what aggregates

original: gang dag 'gags pa las mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ba nyon mongs pa'ang phung po rnams yod par gal 'gyur /
analyzed: gang dag 'gags pa las mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ba nyon mongs pa'ang phung po rnams yod par gal 'gyur /
translated: could cease in order for nirvana to occur?

original: de'i phyir dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin yod pa nyid do zhes 'dzer to //
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin yod pa nyid do zhes 'dzer to //
translated: Therefore, they say that things do have intrinsic reality.

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /
translated: We respond:

original: de ltar rang bzhin khas len na yang /
analyzed: de ltar rang bzhin khas len na yang /
translated: Even though you accept intrinsic reality,

original: gal te 'di kun mi stong na //
analyzed: gal te 'di kun mi stong na //
translated: if all these were not empty,

original: 'byung ba med cing 'jig pa med //
analyzed: 'byung ba med cing 'jig pa med //
translated: there would be no arising and no disintegration.

original: gang zhig spong dang 'gags pa las //
analyzed: gang zhig spong dang 'gags pa las //
translated: What is it that ceases in order for

original: mya ngan 'das par 'gyur bar 'dod //
analyzed: mya ngan 'das par 'gyur bar 'dod //
translated: nirvana to occur?

original: gang las de dag log pas mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ba /
analyzed: gang las de dag log pas mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ba /
translated: And from which they are averted, nirvana is attained.

original: nyon mongs pa rnams dang phung po rang bzhin gyis rnam par gnas pa ldog par ga la 'gyur te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams dang phung po rang bzhin gyis rnam par gnas pa ldog par ga la 'gyur te /
translated: How could the afflictions and the naturally abiding aggregates be reversed?

original: rang bzhin la ldog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin la ldog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no reversal of intrinsic reality.

original: de'i phyir rang bzhin dang bcas par smra ba la mya ngan las 'das pa mi 'thad pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir rang bzhin dang bcas par smra ba la mya ngan las 'das pa mi 'thad pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, for those who advocate intrinsic reality, nirvana is untenable.

original: gang las de dag la nyes pa 'dir 'gyur ba /
analyzed: gang las de dag la nyes pa 'dir 'gyur ba /
translated: But for those who advocate emptiness,🔽nirvana is tenable.🔽For those who advocate emptiness, nirvana is tenable, because for them the afflictions are adventitious and the aggregates are like a magician’s illusions.

original: stong pa nyid du smra ba rnams kyis ni mya ngan las 'das pa nyon mongs pa ldog pa'i mtshan nyid can nam phung po ldog pa'i mtshan nyid can 'dod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: stong pa nyid du smra ba rnams kyis ni mya ngan las 'das pa nyon mongs pa ldog pa'i mtshan nyid can nam phung po ldog pa'i mtshan nyid can 'dod pa ma yin no //
translated: But for those who advocate intrinsic reality, nirvana is not tenable, because for them the afflictions and the aggregates are not reversed.

original: de'i phyir stong pa nyid du smra ba rnams la klan ka 'dir mi 'gyur ba nyid do //🔽gal te stong pa nyid du smra ba rnams mya ngan las 'das pa phung po rnams sam /
analyzed: de'i phyir stong pa nyid du smra ba rnams la klan ka 'dir mi 'gyur ba nyid do // gal te stong pa nyid du smra ba rnams mya ngan las 'das pa phung po rnams sam /
translated: But for those who advocate emptiness, nirvana is tenable, because for them the afflictions are adventitious and the aggregates are like a magician’s illusions.🔽But for those who advocate intrinsic reality, nirvana is not tenable, because for them the afflictions and the aggregates are not reversed.

original: nyon mongs pa rnams log pa'i mtshan nyid can mi 'dod na /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams log pa'i mtshan nyid can mi 'dod na /
translated: If those who advocate emptiness do not assert that nirvana has the characteristic of the reversal of the afflictions or the characteristic of the reversal of the aggregates,🔽then how could this fault apply to those who advocate emptiness?

original: mtshan nyid gang dang ldan pa zhig 'dod ce na /
analyzed: mtshan nyid gang dang ldan pa zhig 'dod ce na /
translated: What is the definition of nirvana?🔽It is said:

original: brjod pa / spangs pa med pa 'thob med pa //🔽chad pa med pa rtag med pa //
analyzed: brjod pa / spangs pa med pa 'thob med pa // chad pa med pa rtag med pa //
translated: There is no abandonment, no attainment,🔽no annihilation, no permanence,

original: 'gag pa med pa skye med pa ;
analyzed: 'gag pa med pa skye med pa ;
translated: no cessation, and no production;

original: / de ni mya ngan 'das par brjod //
analyzed: / de ni mya ngan 'das par brjod //
translated: that is said to be nirvana.

original: gang zhig 'dod chags la sogs pa ltar spangs pa med cing /
analyzed: gang zhig 'dod chags la sogs pa ltar spangs pa med cing /
translated: There is no abandonment, like that of desire and so on.

original: dge sbyong gi 'bras bu ltar 'thob pa med pa /
analyzed: dge sbyong gi 'bras bu ltar 'thob pa med pa /
translated: There is no attainment, like the fruit of the sraddhadhimukta and the samayasambuddha.

original: phung po la sogs pa ltar chad pa yang med la /
analyzed: phung po la sogs pa ltar chad pa yang med la /
translated: There is no annihilation, like the aggregates and so on.

original: gang yang mi stong pa ltar rtag pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: gang yang mi stong pa ltar rtag pa ma yin pa /
translated: There is no permanence, like that which is not empty.

original: rang bzhin gyi 'gag pa med pa skye ba med pa spros pa thams cad nye bar zhi ba'i mtshan nyid can de ni mya ngan las 'das par bshad do //🔽de'i phyir rnam pa de lta bu de la nyon mongs pa gang dag spangs pas de mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ba /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi 'gag pa med pa skye ba med pa spros pa thams cad nye bar zhi ba'i mtshan nyid can de ni mya ngan las 'das par bshad do // de'i phyir rnam pa de lta bu de la nyon mongs pa gang dag spangs pas de mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ba /
translated: That which has no cessation by nature and no production, which has the characteristic of the pacification of all fabrication, is explained to be nirvana.

original: nyon mongs par rtog pa ga la yod cing /
analyzed: nyon mongs par rtog pa ga la yod cing /
translated: Therefore, how could there be the conception of afflictions in that which is such that nirvana would be attained through the abandonment of those afflictions?

original: phung po gang dag @174b 'gags pas de 'thob bar 'gyur ba phung por rtog pa yang ga la yod /
analyzed: phung po gang dag @174b 'gags pas de 'thob bar 'gyur ba phung por rtog pa yang ga la yod /
translated: How could there be the conception of aggregates by which nirvana is attained through the cessation of the aggregates?

original: ji srid du rtog pa 'di dag 'byung ba de srid du mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ji srid du rtog pa 'di dag 'byung ba de srid du mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: As long as these conceptions occur, nirvana is not attained,

original: spros pa thams cad zad pa nyid las de 'thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spros pa thams cad zad pa nyid las de 'thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is attained through the exhaustion of all fabrication.

original: ci ste mya ngan las 'das pa la nyon mongs pa rnams med cing phung po rnams kyang med mod kyi /
analyzed: ci ste mya ngan las 'das pa la nyon mongs pa rnams med cing phung po rnams kyang med mod kyi /
translated: But if you think that although afflictions do not exist and the aggregates also do not exist in nirvana,

original: de lta na yang mya ngan las 'das pa'i snga rol na yod pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta na yang mya ngan las 'das pa'i snga rol na yod pa yin no //
translated: they exist prior to nirvana,

original: de'i phyir de dag 'gags pa ni spros pa zad pa las mya ngan las 'das pa yin par 'gyur ro snyam na /
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag 'gags pa ni spros pa zad pa las mya ngan las 'das pa yin par 'gyur ro snyam na /
translated: and therefore their cessation is nirvana through the exhaustion of fabrication,

original: brjod pa / 'dzin pa 'di ni dor bar bya'o //
analyzed: brjod pa / 'dzin pa 'di ni dor bar bya'o //
translated: we reply: This grasping should be abandoned.

original: gang gi phyir mya ngan las 'das pa'i snga rol na rang bzhin gyis yod pa rnams ni yang dngos po med par bya bar mi nus te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir mya ngan las 'das pa'i snga rol na rang bzhin gyis yod pa rnams ni yang dngos po med par bya bar mi nus te /
translated: Because those that exist essentially prior to nirvana cannot be made nonexistent.

original: de'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa 'dod pas rtog pa 'di dor bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa 'dod pas rtog pa 'di dor bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one who desires nirvana should abandon this conception.

original: mya ngan 'das mtha' gang yin pa //
analyzed: mya ngan 'das mtha' gang yin pa //
translated: The limit of nirvana

original: de ni 'khor ba'i mtha' yin te //🔽de gnyis khyad par cung zad ni //
analyzed: de ni 'khor ba'i mtha' yin te // de gnyis khyad par cung zad ni //
translated: is the limit of cyclic existence.🔽There is not the slightest difference

original: shin tu phra ba'ang yod ma yin //
analyzed: shin tu phra ba'ang yod ma yin //
translated: between these two.

original: zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: This will be explained.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang //🔽mya ngan 'das la chos rnams yod nyid med //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang // mya ngan 'das la chos rnams yod nyid med //
translated: The Bhagavān also said:🔽In nirvana, dharmas are neither existent nor nonexistent.

original: chos gang der med de dag gzhar yang med //
analyzed: chos gang der med de dag gzhar yang med //
translated: Dharmas that do not exist there never exist.

original: yod dang med ces rtog pa dang ldan zhing //
analyzed: yod dang med ces rtog pa dang ldan zhing //
translated: Those who think in terms of existence and nonexistence

original: de ltar spyod rnams sdug bsngal nyer mi zhi //🔽zhes gsungs pa yin pas so //
analyzed: de ltar spyod rnams sdug bsngal nyer mi zhi // zhes gsungs pa yin pas so //
translated: and who practice accordingly will not pacify suffering.

original: tshigs su bcad pa 'di'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa 'di'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of this verse is as follows.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa ste phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings na'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa ste phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings na'o //
translated: In nirvana, that is, in the realm of nirvana without remainder of the aggregates.

original: chos rnams ni nyon mongs pa dang las dang skye ba'i mtshan nyid can rnams sam phung po rnams te /
analyzed: chos rnams ni nyon mongs pa dang las dang skye ba'i mtshan nyid can rnams sam phung po rnams te /
translated: Dharmas are those characterized by afflictions, actions, and birth, or the aggregates.

original: rnam pa thams cad du bral pa'i phyir yod pa nyid med do //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du bral pa'i phyir yod pa nyid med do //
translated: Because it is completely devoid of them, it does not exist.

original: 'di ni rgol ba thams cad kyi 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni rgol ba thams cad kyi 'dod pa yin no //
translated: This is the assertion of all disputants.

original: mar me gtang bas mun par thag pa la sbrul du dmigs pa ltar chos gang dag mya ngan las 'das pa 'di la yod pa ma yin pa de dag ni gzhar yang med do //
analyzed: mar me gtang bas mun par thag pa la sbrul du dmigs pa ltar chos gang dag mya ngan las 'das pa 'di la yod pa ma yin pa de dag ni gzhar yang med do //
translated: Just as when a lamp is lit, a rope that was imagined to be a snake in the dark is not, so any phenomenon that does not exist in nirvana never existed.

original: nyon mongs pa dang las dang skye ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi chos de dag ni 'khor ba'i gnas skabs kyi dus 'ga' zhig na yang de kho na nyid du yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang las dang skye ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi chos de dag ni 'khor ba'i gnas skabs kyi dus 'ga' zhig na yang de kho na nyid du yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Those phenomena characterized by afflictions, karma, and birth never existed in reality at any time during the period of cyclic existence.

original: 'di ltar mun pa'i gnas skabs na thag pa la sbrul rang gi ngo bos yod pa ni ma yin te /🔽yod par gyur pa'i sbrul ltar mun pa dang snang bar yang 'dzin par @175a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar mun pa'i gnas skabs na thag pa la sbrul rang gi ngo bos yod pa ni ma yin te / yod par gyur pa'i sbrul ltar mun pa dang snang bar yang 'dzin par @175a * //
translated: Thus, in the dark, a rope is not a snake by its own nature.

original: 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If it were, then like an existent snake, it would be apprehended in the dark and in the light.

original: 'o na ji ltar 'khor ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar 'khor ba yin zhe na /
translated: How then is there cyclic existence?

original: brjod pa / rab rib can rnams la skra shad dang sbrang bu mchu rings la sogs pa snang ba ltar dngos po yod pa mi yin pa'i rang bzhin can dag kyang byis pa bdag dang bdag gi bar yang dag pa ma yin pa'i phyir ci log gi gdon gyis bzung ba🔽rnams bden bar snang ba yin no zhes gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: brjod pa / rab rib can rnams la skra shad dang sbrang bu mchu rings la sogs pa snang ba ltar dngos po yod pa mi yin pa'i rang bzhin can dag kyang byis pa bdag dang bdag gi bar yang dag pa ma yin pa'i phyir ci log gi gdon gyis bzung ba rnams bden bar snang ba yin no zhes gsungs pa ni /
translated: Just as those with eye disease see hairs, flies, and so on, so too the childish, who are seized by the demon of error, see things that are not real, that are not the nature of entities, as the self and entities connected to the self.🔽They appear to be real.

original: yod dang med ces rtog pa dang ldan zhing //
analyzed: yod dang med ces rtog pa dang ldan zhing //
translated: Those who think “it exists” or “it does not exist”

original: de ltar spyod rnams sdug bsngal nyer mi zhi //
analyzed: de ltar spyod rnams sdug bsngal nyer mi zhi //
translated: Do not pacify suffering by such conduct.

original: zhes bya'o // yod do zhes dngos po yod par rtog pa dang ldan pa rgyal dpog pa dang / gzegs zan dang ser skya la sogs pa bye brag tu smra ba rnams la thug pa rnams dang / med ces rtog pa dang ldan pa med pa pa rnams dang /
analyzed: zhes bya'o // yod do zhes dngos po yod par rtog pa dang ldan pa rgyal dpog pa dang / gzegs zan dang ser skya la sogs pa bye brag tu smra ba rnams la thug pa rnams dang / med ces rtog pa dang ldan pa med pa pa rnams dang /
translated: Those who think “it exists” are the Vaiśeṣikas, the Kaṇādins, Kapila, and so on, up to the Vaibhāṣikas, and those who think “it does not exist” are the Nihilists.

original: de dag las gzhan 'du byed 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa dang / mi ldan pa'i 'du byed med par smra zhing de las gzhan yod par smra ba rnams dang / kun du brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid med par smra zhing /
analyzed: de dag las gzhan 'du byed 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa dang / mi ldan pa'i 'du byed med par smra zhing de las gzhan yod par smra ba rnams dang / kun du brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid med par smra zhing /
translated: Others, who assert the nonexistence of past and future formations, of nonindicative form, and of nonassociated formative forces, and the existence of what is other than those,

original: gzhan gyi dbang dang yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid yod par smra ba rnams te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang dang yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid yod par smra ba rnams te /
translated: and those who assert the nonexistence of the imagined nature and the existence of the dependent nature and the perfected nature,

original: de ltar yod pa dang med par smra ba rnams kyi sdug bsngal te 'khor ba zhi bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar yod pa dang med par smra ba rnams kyi sdug bsngal te 'khor ba zhi bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya'o //
translated: in this way, those who assert existence and nonexistence do not pacify suffering or samsara.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: Similarly,🔽it is said:

original: ji ltar dogs pa'i 'du shes kyis ni dug langs pa //
analyzed: ji ltar dogs pa'i 'du shes kyis ni dug langs pa //
translated: Those who have the idea of poison,

original: dug de khong du song ba med kyang brgyal bar 'gyur //
analyzed: dug de khong du song ba med kyang brgyal bar 'gyur //
translated: even though the poison has not entered their stomach, faint.

original: de bzhin byis pa bdag dang bdag gir khas len pa //
analyzed: de bzhin byis pa bdag dang bdag gir khas len pa //
translated: Likewise, the childish who assert the self and entities connected to the self

original: bdag der 'du shes yang dag min rtag skye zhing 'chi //🔽zhes kyang gsungs so //
analyzed: bdag der 'du shes yang dag min rtag skye zhing 'chi // zhes kyang gsungs so //
translated: continuously die and are born with the idea of self, which is not real.

original: de'i phyir de lta bas na //
analyzed: de'i phyir de lta bas na //
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: mya ngan las 'das pa la 'ga' yang spangs pa med la /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa la 'ga' yang spangs pa med la /
translated: In nirvana, there is no abandonment of anything whatsoever,

original: 'ga' yang 'gag pa med do zhes shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'ga' yang 'gag pa med do zhes shes par bya'o //
translated: and there is no cessation of anything whatsoever.

original: de'i phyir rtog pa thams cad zad pa nyid mya ngan las 'das pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rtog pa thams cad zad pa nyid mya ngan las 'das pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the exhaustion of all conceptualization is nirvana.

original: ji skad du 'phags pa rin po che'i phreng ba las kyang /
analyzed: ji skad du 'phags pa rin po che'i phreng ba las kyang /
translated: As it says in the Precious Garland:

original: mya ngan 'das pa dngos med pa'ang //🔽min na de dngos gal yin //
analyzed: mya ngan 'das pa dngos med pa'ang // min na de dngos gal yin //
translated: Nirvana is not a non-thing,🔽and if it were a thing,

original: dngos dang dngos po med 'dzin pa //
analyzed: dngos dang dngos po med 'dzin pa //
translated: It would be a thing that is grasped

original: zad pa mya ngan 'das zhes bya //🔽zhes bshad do /🔽gang dag mya ngan las 'das pa kun du rtog pa thams cad nye bar zhi ba'i ngo bo ma rtogs shing /
analyzed: zad pa mya ngan 'das zhes bya // zhes bshad do / gang dag mya ngan las 'das pa kun du rtog pa thams cad nye bar zhi ba'i ngo bo ma rtogs shing /
translated: and a thing that is abandoned.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po dang dngos po med pa dang de gnyi ga dang / gnyi @175b gam yin pa'i ngo bor yongs su rtog par byed pa /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po dang dngos po med pa dang de gnyi ga dang / gnyi @175b gam yin pa'i ngo bor yongs su rtog par byed pa /
translated: Those who do not understand that nirvana is the pacification of all conceptualization and who conceive of nirvana as a thing, a non-thing, both of those, or neither of those,

original: de dag la brjod pa /
analyzed: de dag la brjod pa /
translated: we will say to them:

original: re zhig mya ngan 'das dngos min //
analyzed: re zhig mya ngan 'das dngos min //
translated: First, nirvana is not a thing,

original: rga shi'i mtshan nyid thal bar 'gyur //
analyzed: rga shi'i mtshan nyid thal bar 'gyur //
translated: because it would follow that it would have the characteristics of aging and death.

original: rga dang 'chi ba med pa yi //
analyzed: rga dang 'chi ba med pa yi //
translated: A thing that is not subject to aging and death

original: dngos po yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po yod pa ma yin no //
translated: does not exist.

original: de la mya ngan las 'das pa dngos por mngon par zhen pa kha cig ni 'di skad du /🔽'dir mya ngan las 'das pa ni nyon mongs pa dang las dang skye ba'i rgyun 'jug pa nges par 'gog par 'gyur ba /
analyzed: de la mya ngan las 'das pa dngos por mngon par zhen pa kha cig ni 'di skad du / 'dir mya ngan las 'das pa ni nyon mongs pa dang las dang skye ba'i rgyun 'jug pa nges par 'gog par 'gyur ba /
translated: Some who are attached to the idea that nirvana is a thing say:

original: chu'i rgyun 'gog pa'i chu lon dang 'dra ba'i don dngos po'i bdag nyid can yin te /
analyzed: chu'i rgyun 'gog pa'i chu lon dang 'dra ba'i don dngos po'i bdag nyid can yin te /
translated: Here, nirvana is a thing that has the nature of an object, like a dam that stops the current of a river, which definitely stops the continuation of the afflictions, karma, and birth.

original: yod pa ma yin pa'i rang bzhin gyi chos ni de ltar 'bras bu byed par yang ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: yod pa ma yin pa'i rang bzhin gyi chos ni de ltar 'bras bu byed par yang ma mthong ngo //
translated: A nonexistent thing cannot be seen to function in that way.

original: gal te 'di dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang lhan cig tu 'gyur pa'i srid pa zad cing 'dod chags dang bral ba 'gog pa gang yin pa de ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes gsungs pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te 'di dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang lhan cig tu 'gyur pa'i srid pa zad cing 'dod chags dang bral ba 'gog pa gang yin pa de ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes gsungs pa ma yin nam /
translated: But isn’t it said that “nirvana is the cessation of the craving that accompanies the delight in desire, and is free from desire”?

original: zad pa tsam ni dngos po yin par 'os pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: zad pa tsam ni dngos po yin par 'os pa yang ma yin no //
translated: And it is not tenable that mere cessation is a thing.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: And similarly:

original: mar me shi bar gyur pa ltar //
analyzed: mar me shi bar gyur pa ltar //
translated: Like a lamp that is extinguished,

original: de yi sems ni rnam par thar //🔽zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de yi sems ni rnam par thar // zhes gsungs te /
translated: His mind is liberated.

original: mar me shi ba ni dngos po yin no zhes bya bar yang mi 'thad do zhe na /
analyzed: mar me shi ba ni dngos po yin no zhes bya bar yang mi 'thad do zhe na /
translated: It is not tenable to say that the extinction of a butterlamp is a thing.

original: smras pa / sred pa zad pa ni sred pa zad pa'o zhes de ltar ni shes par mi bya'o //
analyzed: smras pa / sred pa zad pa ni sred pa zad pa'o zhes de ltar ni shes par mi bya'o //
translated: We reply: The extinction of craving should not be understood as the extinction of craving.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba'i chos de yod na sred pa zad par 'gyur ba de ni sred pa zad pa'o zhes bya bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba'i chos de yod na sred pa zad par 'gyur ba de ni sred pa zad pa'o zhes bya bar rig par bya'o //
translated: The extinction of craving should be understood as the extinction of craving when the phenomenon called nirvana exists.

original: mar me ni dpe tsam du zad do //
analyzed: mar me ni dpe tsam du zad do //
translated: The butterlamp is merely an example.

original: der yang gang yod na sems thar par 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya bar rig par bya'o zhes smra'o //🔽de ltar mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po rnam par gnas pa yin dang / re zhig mya ngan 'das dngos min //
analyzed: der yang gang yod na sems thar par 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya bar rig par bya'o zhes smra'o // de ltar mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po rnam par gnas pa yin dang / re zhig mya ngan 'das dngos min //
translated: In that case, it should be understood that when something exists, the mind is liberated.

original: zhes slob dpon nges par rtog par mdzad do //
analyzed: zhes slob dpon nges par rtog par mdzad do //
translated: Thus the master Nāgārjuna has ascertained that nirvana is a thing.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: Because

original: rga shi'i mtshan nyid thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: rga shi'i mtshan nyid thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: it would follow that it has the characteristics of aging and death.

original: dngos po ni rga shi'i mtshan nyid la mi 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po ni rga shi'i mtshan nyid la mi 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because a thing is not confused about the characteristics of aging and death.

original: de'i phyir de mya ngan las 'das pa nyid du yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de mya ngan las 'das pa nyid du yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, it would not even be nirvana,

original: rga shi'i mtshan nyid can yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rga shi'i mtshan nyid can yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because it would have the characteristics of aging and death,

original: rnam par shes pa la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya bar dgongs pa yin no //🔽rga shi'i mtshan nyid la mi 'khrul ba de nyid bsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya bar dgongs pa yin no // rga shi'i mtshan nyid la mi 'khrul ba de nyid bsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: like consciousness and so on. This is the intended meaning.

original: rga dang 'chi ba med pa @176a * //🔽yi // dngos po yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rga dang 'chi ba med pa @176a * // yi // dngos po yod pa ma yin no //
translated: In order to dispel the confusion about the characteristics of aging and death,

original: zhes bshad de /
analyzed: zhes bshad de /
translated: it is said:🔽A thing that is devoid of aging and death🔽does not exist.

original: rga shi dang bral ba gang yin pa de ni dngos po nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: rga shi dang bral ba gang yin pa de ni dngos po nyid ma yin te /
translated: That which is devoid of aging and death is not a thing,

original: rga shi dang bral ba'i phyir nam mkha'i me tog bzhin no //
analyzed: rga shi dang bral ba'i phyir nam mkha'i me tog bzhin no //
translated: because it is devoid of aging and death, like a sky flower.🔽Moreover,

original: gzhan yang / gal te mya ngan 'das dngos na //
analyzed: gzhan yang / gal te mya ngan 'das dngos na //
translated: If nirvana were a thing,

original: mya ngan 'das pa 'dus byas 'gyur //
analyzed: mya ngan 'das pa 'dus byas 'gyur //
translated: nirvana would be a conditioned thing.

original: dngos po 'dus byas ma yin pa //
analyzed: dngos po 'dus byas ma yin pa //
translated: But a thing that is not conditioned

original: 'ga' yang gang na'ang yod ma yin //
analyzed: 'ga' yang gang na'ang yod ma yin //
translated: does not exist anywhere.

original: gal te mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po yin na ni de'i tshe mya ngan las 'das pa de 'dus byas su 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po yin na ni de'i tshe mya ngan las 'das pa de 'dus byas su 'gyur te /
translated: If nirvana were a thing, then nirvana would be conditioned,

original: dngos po yin pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dngos po yin pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa bzhin no //
translated: because it would be a thing, like consciousness.

original: gang 'dus byas ma yin pa de ni dngos por mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang 'dus byas ma yin pa de ni dngos por mi 'gyur te /
translated: That which is not conditioned would not be a thing,

original: dper na bong bu'i rva bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na bong bu'i rva bzhin no //
translated: like the horn of an ass.

original: ldog pa bshad pa'i phyir //🔽dngos po 'dus byas ma yin pa //
analyzed: ldog pa bshad pa'i phyir // dngos po 'dus byas ma yin pa //
translated: To explain the reversal, he says:

original: 'ga' yang gang na'ang yod ma yin //
analyzed: 'ga' yang gang na'ang yod ma yin //
translated: There is no existent thing anywhere

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /🔽'ga' yang zhes bya ba ni brten pa ste /🔽nang ngam phyi'i bdag nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te / 'ga' yang zhes bya ba ni brten pa ste / nang ngam phyi'i bdag nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: that is not conditioned.

original: gang na'ang zhes bya ba ni rten te /
analyzed: gang na'ang zhes bya ba ni rten te /
translated: “ Anywhere” means in any place,

original: yul lam dus sam grub pa'i mthar ro //
analyzed: yul lam dus sam grub pa'i mthar ro //
translated: in any object, in any time, or in any philosophical theory.

original: gzhan yang / gal te mya ngan 'das dngos na //
analyzed: gzhan yang / gal te mya ngan 'das dngos na //
translated: Moreover, if nirvana were a thing,

original: ji ltar myang 'das de brten min //🔽dngos po brten nas ma yin pa //
analyzed: ji ltar myang 'das de brten min // dngos po brten nas ma yin pa //
translated: how could nirvana be nondependent?🔽There is no existent thing anywhere

original: 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: that is not dependent.

original: gal te khyod kyi lugs kyis mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te khyod kyi lugs kyis mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po yin na ni /
translated: If nirvana were a thing,

original: de brten nas yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de brten nas yin par 'gyur te /
translated: then it would be dependent,

original: rang gi rgyu'i tshogs pa la brten nas yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rang gi rgyu'i tshogs pa la brten nas yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: because it would depend on the collection of its own causes.

original: de ltar brten nas mya ngan las 'das pa 'dod pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar brten nas mya ngan las 'das pa 'dod pa yang ma yin te /
translated: But nirvana is not accepted as being dependent in that way.

original: 'o na ci zhe na de ni ma brten par ro //
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na de ni ma brten par ro //
translated: But rather, it is independent.

original: gal te mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po yin na /

translated: A non-thing will not be established.🔽People say that the transformation of a thing

analyzed: dngos med yin par skye bo smra // zhes sngar bshad zin to //

analyzed: de'i phyir mo gsham gyi bu dngos po med pa ma yin no zhes shes par bya'o //

analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di ni gnas so //

translated: Sometimes the reality of coming and going is designated as existing in dependence on the collection of causes and conditions, like long and short.

analyzed: res 'ga' ni rgyur byas nas 'dogs te mar me'i 'od bzhin no // gal te 'dir rgyur byas nas 'dogs sam /

analyzed: brten nas skye'o zhes rnam par 'jog kyang rung ste /

analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du skye ba dang 'chi ba'i rgyun de ma brten pa'am rgyur byas pa ma yin par mi 'jug pa gang yin pa de mya ngan las 'das pa yin par rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Nirvana is posited as the non-reliant or non-dependent non-engagement of the continuum of birth and death in every way.

original: mi 'jug pa tsam ni dngos po 'am dngos po med pa yin no zhes bya bar brtag par yang mi nus te /
analyzed: mi 'jug pa tsam ni dngos po 'am dngos po med pa yin no zhes bya bar brtag par yang mi nus te /

analyzed: de ltar na mya ngan las 'das pa ni dngos po dang dngos po med pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Thus, nirvana is neither an entity nor a non-entity.🔽Or, for those who maintain that samsara is the formations, nirvana is the non-engagement of that which is dependently arisen and ceases.

translated: It is called “nirvana” because it is not dependent.

original: gang dag gi ltar na gang zag 'khor ba yin pa de dag gi rtag pa dang mi rtag pa nyid du brjod du med pa de'i 'ong ba dang 'gro ba'i dngos po med par nye bar len pa de dang de la brten nas gang yin pa de ni
analyzed: gang dag gi ltar na gang zag 'khor ba yin pa de dag gi rtag pa dang mi rtag pa nyid du brjod du med pa de'i 'ong ba dang 'gro ba'i dngos po med par nye bar len pa de dang de la brten nas gang yin pa de ni
translated: Those who say that the person is samsara cannot describe it as permanent or impermanent, and they cannot describe it as having the nature of coming or going.

original: rgyur byas nas 'jug pa yin la /
analyzed: rgyur byas nas 'jug pa yin la /
translated: It is said that the person is imputed in dependence on the appropriated aggregates.

original: rgyur byas shing rgyur byas nas 'jug pa de nyid da ltar rgyur byas pa ma yin par mi 'jug pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya bar bsnyad do //
analyzed: rgyur byas shing rgyur byas nas 'jug pa de nyid da ltar rgyur byas pa ma yin par mi 'jug pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya bar bsnyad do //
translated: The person is imputed in dependence on the appropriated aggregates, and it is said that when the appropriated aggregates are not appropriated, the person does not come or go.

original: 'du byed rnams dang gang zag gi mi 'jug pa tsam ni dngos po 'am dngos po med pa yin no zhes bya bar brtag par nus pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams dang gang zag gi mi 'jug pa tsam ni dngos po 'am dngos po med pa yin no zhes bya bar brtag par nus pa yang ma yin no //
translated: The mere nonoccurrence of the aggregates and the person is not something that can be conceived as either an entity or a nonentity.🔽Therefore it is also illogical for nirvana to be an entity or a nonentity.

original: de'i phyir yang mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po dang dngos po med par mi rigs so zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po dang dngos po med par mi rigs so zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Moreover, the Teacher has said

original: gzhan yang / 'byung ba dang ni 'jig pa dag //
analyzed: gzhan yang / 'byung ba dang ni 'jig pa dag //
translated: That both emergence and destruction

original: slang bar ston pas bka' stsal to //
analyzed: slang bar ston pas bka' stsal to //
translated: Are taught to be dependent.

original: de phyir mya ngan 'das pa ni //
analyzed: de phyir mya ngan 'das pa ni //
translated: Therefore, it is reasonable that nirvana

analyzed: dngos min dngos med min par rigs // de la mdo las dge slong dag gang dag 'byung ba'am 'jig pas srid pa las nges par 'byung ba tshol ba de ni de dag gi yongs @178a * //
translated: is neither a thing nor a non-thing.🔽In this regard, a sutra declares:

original: su mi shes pa chen po yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: su mi shes pa chen po yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: Monks, those who seek liberation from cyclic existence through the view of creation or the view of annihilation are greatly confused.

original: 'byung ba'i sred pa dang 'jig pa'i sred pa de ni gnyi ga yang yongs su spang bar bya ba yin na /
analyzed: 'byung ba'i sred pa dang 'jig pa'i sred pa de ni gnyi ga yang yongs su spang bar bya ba yin na /
translated: The craving for creation and the craving for annihilation are both to be abandoned.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa ni de ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis spang bar bya ba ma gsungs te /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa ni de ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis spang bar bya ba ma gsungs te /
translated: But the Transcendent Lord has not declared nirvana to be an object of abandonment.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: spang bar bya ba ma yin par ro //
analyzed: spang bar bya ba ma yin par ro //
translated: It is not an object of abandonment.

original: de'i phyir gal te mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po'i rang bzhin can nam /
analyzed: de'i phyir gal te mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po'i rang bzhin can nam /
translated: Therefore, if nirvana were to have the nature of a thing or

original: dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin du gyur na ni /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin du gyur na ni /
translated: the nature of a non-thing,

original: de yang spang bar bya ba kho nar 'gyur na /
analyzed: de yang spang bar bya ba kho nar 'gyur na /
translated: then it would be an object of abandonment.

original: spang bar bya ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: spang bar bya ba yang ma yin te /
translated: But it is not an object of abandonment.

original: de'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po ma yin zhing dngos po med pa yang ma yin par mi rigs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po ma yin zhing dngos po med pa yang ma yin par mi rigs so //
translated: Therefore, it is illogical that nirvana is neither a thing nor a nonthing.🔽According to those who assert that nirvana is both a thing and a nonthing,

original: gang dag gi ltar na nyon mongs pa dang skye ba gnyis de la med pas /
analyzed: gang dag gi ltar na nyon mongs pa dang skye ba gnyis de la med pas /
translated: since both affliction and birth do not exist in nirvana,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin yin la /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin yin la /
translated: nirvana has the nature of a nonthing.

original: rang nyid dngos po'i ngo bo yin pas dngos po'i rang bzhin yin no zhes gnyis ka'i rang bzhin yin pa de dag gi /
analyzed: rang nyid dngos po'i ngo bo yin pas dngos po'i rang bzhin yin no zhes gnyis ka'i rang bzhin yin pa de dag gi /
translated: Since it itself has the nature of an entity, it has the nature of a thing.

original: gnyi ga'i rang bzhin can gyi mya ngan las 'das pa yang mi 'thad do zhes bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: gnyi ga'i rang bzhin can gyi mya ngan las 'das pa yang mi 'thad do zhes bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: In order to demonstrate that nirvana that has the nature of both is also untenable, it is said:

original: gal te mya ngan 'das pa ni //
analyzed: gal te mya ngan 'das pa ni //
translated: If nirvana

original: dngos dang dngos med gnyis yin na //
analyzed: dngos dang dngos med gnyis yin na //
translated: were both a thing and a nonthing,

original: dngos dang dngos po med pa dag / thar par 'gyur na de mi rigs //
analyzed: dngos dang dngos po med pa dag / thar par 'gyur na de mi rigs //
translated: then a thing and a nonthing would be liberation, but that is illogical.

original: gal te mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po dang dngos po med pa gnyi ga'i rang bzhin du gyur na ni //
analyzed: gal te mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po dang dngos po med pa gnyi ga'i rang bzhin du gyur na ni //
translated: If nirvana were to have the nature of both a thing and a nonthing,🔽then a thing and a nonthing would be liberation, but that is illogical.

original: de'i tshe dngos po dang dngos po med par thar par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe dngos po dang dngos po med par thar par 'gyur ro //
translated: At that time, liberation would be a thing and a nonthing.

original: de'i phyir 'du byed rnams kyi bdag nyid 'thob pa dang / de dang bral ba gang yin pa de nyid thar par 'gyur na /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'du byed rnams kyi bdag nyid 'thob pa dang / de dang bral ba gang yin pa de nyid thar par 'gyur na /
translated: Therefore, if the attainment of the identity of formations and the separation from that were liberation,

original: 'du byed dag ni thar ba zhes bya bar rigs pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'du byed dag ni thar ba zhes bya bar rigs pa yang ma yin no //
translated: it would not be tenable to call formations “liberation.”

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For this reason,

original: de mi rigs so zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de mi rigs so zhes bshad do //
translated: it is said, “That is not tenable.”

original: gzhan yang / gal te mya ngan 'das pa ni //
analyzed: gzhan yang / gal te mya ngan 'das pa ni //
translated: Moreover, if nirvana

original: dngos dang dngos med gnyis yin na //
analyzed: dngos dang dngos med gnyis yin na //
translated: were both a thing and a nonthing,

original: mya ngan 'das pa ma brten min //
analyzed: mya ngan 'das pa ma brten min //
translated: nirvana would not be nondependent,

original: de gnyis brten nas yin phyir ro //
analyzed: de gnyis brten nas yin phyir ro //
translated: because those two are dependent.

original: gal te mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin yin na ni /
translated: If nirvana were the nature of a thing and a nonthing,

original: de'i tshe rgyu dang rkyen gyi tshogs pa la brten cing ltos nas yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i tshe rgyu dang rkyen gyi tshogs pa la brten cing ltos nas yin gyi /
translated: then it would be dependent and reliant on the assembly of causes and conditions.

original: ma brten par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ma brten par ni ma yin no //
translated: It would not be nondependent.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽gang gi phyir /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / gang gi phyir /
translated: Why is that?🔽Because

original: de gnyis brten nas yin phyir ro ste /
analyzed: de gnyis brten nas yin phyir ro ste /
translated: those two are dependent.

original: dngos po la brten nas dngos po med pa yin zhing /
analyzed: dngos po la brten nas dngos po med pa yin zhing /
translated: Non-things are dependent on things.

original: dngos po med pa la brten nas @178b dngos po yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dngos po med pa la brten nas @178b dngos po yod pa'i phyir /
translated: Things exist in dependence on non-things.

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa de gnyi ga brten nas yin gyi ma brten par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa de gnyi ga brten nas yin gyi ma brten par ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, both things and non-things are dependent, not independent.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir de ltar 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir de ltar 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: If nirvana were both a thing and a non-thing,

original: de ni de ltar yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni de ltar yang ma yin te /
translated: it would not be like that.

original: de'i phyir 'di ni mi rigs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ni mi rigs so //
translated: Therefore this is illogical.

original: gzhan yang / ji ltar mya ngan 'das pa ni //
analyzed: gzhan yang / ji ltar mya ngan 'das pa ni //
translated: Moreover, how could nirvana

original: dngos dang dngos med gnyis yin te //
analyzed: dngos dang dngos med gnyis yin te //
translated: Be both a thing and a non-thing?

original: mya ngan 'das pa 'dus ma byas //
analyzed: mya ngan 'das pa 'dus ma byas //
translated: Nirvana is unconditioned.

original: dngos dang dngos med 'dus byas yin //
analyzed: dngos dang dngos med 'dus byas yin //
translated: Things and non-things are conditioned.

original: dngos po ni rang gi rgyu dang rkyen gyi tshogs pa las byung ba'i phyir 'dus byas yin la /
analyzed: dngos po ni rang gi rgyu dang rkyen gyi tshogs pa las byung ba'i phyir 'dus byas yin la /
translated: A thing is conditioned because it arises from the assembly of its own causes and conditions.

original: dngos po med pa yang dngos po la brten nas 'byung ba'i phyir dang / skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi zhes 'byung ba'i phyir 'dus byas yin no //
analyzed: dngos po med pa yang dngos po la brten nas 'byung ba'i phyir dang / skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi zhes 'byung ba'i phyir 'dus byas yin no //
translated: because non-entity arises in dependence on entity, and because it is said that “the condition of birth is aging and death.”

original: de'i phyir gal te mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin yin na ni //
analyzed: de'i phyir gal te mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin yin na ni //
translated: Therefore, if nirvana had the nature of an entity and a non-entity,

original: de'i tshe de 'dus ma byas yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i tshe de 'dus ma byas yin gyi /
translated: then at that time it would be uncompounded.

original: 'dus byas nyid du 'gyur na //
analyzed: 'dus byas nyid du 'gyur na //
translated: But if it were compounded,

original: 'dus byas su ni 'dod pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dus byas su ni 'dod pa yang ma yin no //
translated: it would not be tenable to assert that it is uncompounded.

original: de'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po dang dngos po med par mi rigs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po dang dngos po med par mi rigs so //
translated: Therefore it is not tenable that nirvana is an entity or a non-entity.

original: ci ste yang mya ngan las 'das pa ni dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin ma yin te /
analyzed: ci ste yang mya ngan las 'das pa ni dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin ma yin te /
translated: But if you think that nirvana does not have the nature of an entity or a non-entity,

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: then what is it?

original: mya ngan las 'das pa la dngos po dang dngos po med pa de dag yod pa ma yin no snyam na /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa la dngos po dang dngos po med pa de dag yod pa ma yin no snyam na /
translated: If you think that neither an entity nor a non-entity exist in nirvana,

original: de yang mi rigs so ;
analyzed: de yang mi rigs so ;
translated: that is also untenable.🔽Why?

original: / gang las she na /🔽gang gi phyir //
analyzed: / gang las she na / gang gi phyir //
translated: Because

original: ji ltar mya ngan 'das pa la //
analyzed: ji ltar mya ngan 'das pa la //
translated: in nirvana

original: dngos dang dngos med gnyis yod de //
analyzed: dngos dang dngos med gnyis yod de //
translated: Existence and nonexistence are both untenable.

original: dngos dang dngos po med pa phan tshun 'gal ba dag kyang mya ngan las 'das pa gcig la yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos dang dngos po med pa phan tshun 'gal ba dag kyang mya ngan las 'das pa gcig la yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Nor can existence and nonexistence be present together in nirvana, since they are mutually exclusive.

original: de'i phyir / ji ltar mya ngan 'das pa la //
analyzed: de'i phyir / ji ltar mya ngan 'das pa la //
translated: Therefore, how could nirvana

original: dngos dang dngos med gnyis yod de //
analyzed: dngos dang dngos med gnyis yod de //
translated: Be both a thing and a nonthing?

original: yod pa ma yin pa nyid de snyam du dgongs pa yin no //
analyzed: yod pa ma yin pa nyid de snyam du dgongs pa yin no //
translated: The point is that it cannot be.

original: ji lta bur zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bur zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: de gnyis gcig la yod min te //
analyzed: de gnyis gcig la yod min te //
translated: They cannot both be present

original: snang ba dang ni mun pa bzhin //🔽ji ltar khyim gcig tu dus gcig gi tshe /🔽phan tshun 'gal bas /
analyzed: snang ba dang ni mun pa bzhin // ji ltar khyim gcig tu dus gcig gi tshe / phan tshun 'gal bas /
translated: Like light and darkness.

original: snang ba dang mun pa dag yod pa ma yin pa de bzhin du de gnyis kyang mya ngan las 'das pa la yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: snang ba dang mun pa dag yod pa ma yin pa de bzhin du de gnyis kyang mya ngan las 'das pa la yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Just as light and darkness cannot be present together in the same place at the same time, since they are mutually exclusive, so too existence and nonexistence cannot be present together in nirvana.

original: da ni mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po ma yin zhing dngos po med pa yang ma yin pa yang ji ltar mi rigs pa de ltar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po ma yin zhing dngos po med pa yang ma yin pa yang ji ltar mi rigs pa de ltar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, to demonstrate how it is that nirvana cannot be both a thing and a nonthing, the treatise states:

original: dngos min dngos po med min pa //
analyzed: dngos min dngos po med min pa //
translated: It is not a thing, nor is it a nonthing.

original: mya ngan 'das par gang ston pa //
analyzed: mya ngan 'das par gang ston pa //
translated: And nirvana is taught

original: dngos po med dang dngos @179a * //
analyzed: dngos po med dang dngos @179a * //
translated: As neither a thing nor a non-thing.🔽If a thing and a non-thing were established,

original: po dag / grub na de ni 'grub par 'gyur //🔽zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: po dag / grub na de ni 'grub par 'gyur // zhes gsungs te /
translated: Then nirvana would be established as such.

original: gal te dngos po zhes bya ba 'ba' zhig yod na ni /
analyzed: gal te dngos po zhes bya ba 'ba' zhig yod na ni /
translated: If only a thing called “nirvana” existed,

original: de'i tshe de bkag pa'i sgo nas mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i rtog pa 'dir 'gyur la /
analyzed: de'i tshe de bkag pa'i sgo nas mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i rtog pa 'dir 'gyur la /
translated: then at that time, through the negation of that, this conception would arise: “Nirvana is not a thing.”

original: gal te dngos po med pa 'ga' zhig yod na ni /
analyzed: gal te dngos po med pa 'ga' zhig yod na ni /
translated: If a non-thing existed,

original: de'i tshe de bkag pas mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po med pa ma yin par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: de'i tshe de bkag pas mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po med pa ma yin par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: then through the negation of that, nirvana would not be a non-thing.

original: gang gi tshe dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag nyid yod pa ma yin pa de'i tshe de dag bkag pa yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag nyid yod pa ma yin pa de'i tshe de dag bkag pa yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But when things and non-things do not exist, then their negations do not exist.

original: de'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po ma yin zhing /
analyzed: de'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po ma yin zhing /
translated: Therefore, nirvana is not a thing,🔽and it is not a non-thing.

original: dngos po med pa yang ma yin no snyam du rtog pa gang yin pa de yang mi 'thad pas 'di ni rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po med pa yang ma yin no snyam du rtog pa gang yin pa de yang mi 'thad pas 'di ni rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: But since this conception is untenable, this is not a correct view.

original: gzhan yang / gal te mya ngan 'das pa ni //
analyzed: gzhan yang / gal te mya ngan 'das pa ni //
translated: Moreover, if nirvana

original: dngos min dngos po med min na //
analyzed: dngos min dngos po med min na //
translated: is not a thing nor a nonthing,🔽how could it be said

original: dngos min dngos po med min zhes //
analyzed: dngos min dngos po med min zhes //
translated: that “it is not a thing nor a nonthing”?🔽If you imagine that nirvana exists essentially as neither a thing nor a nonthing,🔽then how could it be said that “it is not a thing nor a nonthing”?

original: gang zhig gis ni de mngon byed //🔽gal te mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po ma yin zhing dngos po med pa yang ma yin pa'i rang bzhin du yod do zhes rtog na /
analyzed: gang zhig gis ni de mngon byed // gal te mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po ma yin zhing dngos po med pa yang ma yin pa'i rang bzhin du yod do zhes rtog na /
translated: What is it that makes it manifest?

original: da ni gang zhig gis rnam pa de lta bur gyur pa mya ngan las 'das pa gnyi ga'i ngo bo ma yin pa de yod do zhes bya bar mngon par byed de /
analyzed: da ni gang zhig gis rnam pa de lta bur gyur pa mya ngan las 'das pa gnyi ga'i ngo bo ma yin pa de yod do zhes bya bar mngon par byed de /
translated: What is it that makes manifest that kind of nirvana, which is neither of those two, a thing or a nonthing?

original: 'dzin pa'am gsal bar byed /
analyzed: 'dzin pa'am gsal bar byed /
translated: What is it that apprehends it or makes it manifest?

original: ci mya ngan las 'das pa de la rnam pa de lta bu'i rtogs pa po 'ga' zhig yod dam 'on te med /
analyzed: ci mya ngan las 'das pa de la rnam pa de lta bu'i rtogs pa po 'ga' zhig yod dam 'on te med /
translated: Is there or is there not someone who understands nirvana in that way?

original: gal te yod na ni de ltar na mya ngan las 'das par yang bdag yod par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te yod na ni de ltar na mya ngan las 'das par yang bdag yod par 'gyur na /
translated: If there is, then in that case, the self would exist in nirvana.

original: 'dod pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dod pa ni ma yin te /
translated: But that is unacceptable,

original: nye bar len pa med par bdag yod pa nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nye bar len pa med par bdag yod pa nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because without appropriation, the self does not exist.

original: ci ste med na ni de'i tshe rnam pa de lta bu'i mya ngan las 'das pa de yod par gang gis gcod par byed /
analyzed: ci ste med na ni de'i tshe rnam pa de lta bu'i mya ngan las 'das pa de yod par gang gis gcod par byed /
translated: But if it does not exist, then at that time, who would ascertain the existence of such a nirvāṇa?

original: gal te 'khor ba na gnas pas yongs su gcod par byed do zhe na /🔽'khor ba na gnas pas yongs su gcod par byed na de ci rnam par shes pas gcod par byed dam /
analyzed: gal te 'khor ba na gnas pas yongs su gcod par byed do zhe na / 'khor ba na gnas pas yongs su gcod par byed na de ci rnam par shes pas gcod par byed dam /
translated: If you say that one who abides in saṃsāra ascertains it,

original: 'on te ye shes kyis yin grang na /
analyzed: 'on te ye shes kyis yin grang na /
translated: then if one who abides in saṃsāra ascertains it, is it ascertained by consciousness or by wisdom?

original: gal te rnam par shes pas yin par rtog na /
analyzed: gal te rnam par shes pas yin par rtog na /
translated: If you think it is ascertained by consciousness,

original: de ni mi rigs so //
analyzed: de ni mi rigs so //
translated: that is not reasonable.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it not reasonable?

original: 'di ltar rnam par shes pa 'di ni mtshan ma la dmigs pa yin no /
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam par shes pa 'di ni mtshan ma la dmigs pa yin no /
translated: Because this consciousness is the apprehension of a sign.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa la ni mtshan ma cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa la ni mtshan ma cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Nirvāṇa does not have even the slightest sign.

original: de'i phyir re zhig de ni rnam par shes pas dmigs par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir re zhig de ni rnam par shes pas dmigs par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not ascertained by consciousness.

original: ye shes kyis kyang spyod par byed pa @179b ma yin te /
analyzed: ye shes kyis kyang spyod par byed pa @179b ma yin te /
translated: It is also not ascertained by wisdom.

original: ye shes kyis ni stong pa nyid la dmigs par 'gyur dgos la de yang ma skyes pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin pas /
analyzed: ye shes kyis ni stong pa nyid la dmigs par 'gyur dgos la de yang ma skyes pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin pas /
translated: Wisdom must focus on emptiness, and that is also by nature unarisen.

original: ji ltar yod pa ma yin pa'i rang bzhin des mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po ma yin zhing /🔽dngos po med pa ma yin pa zhes bya bar 'dzin par byed /
analyzed: ji ltar yod pa ma yin pa'i rang bzhin des mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po ma yin zhing / dngos po med pa ma yin pa zhes bya bar 'dzin par byed /
translated: How could that unarisen nature apprehend nirvana as neither a thing nor a nonthing?

original: ye shes ni spros pa thams cad las 'das pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽de'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa ni gang gis kyang dngos po ma yin zhing /
analyzed: ye shes ni spros pa thams cad las 'das pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro // de'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa ni gang gis kyang dngos po ma yin zhing /
translated: Wisdom is by nature beyond all elaborations.🔽Therefore, no one apprehends nirvana as neither a thing nor a nonthing.

original: dngos po med pa ma yin no zhes bya bar mngon par mi byed la /🔽mngon par ma byas shing gsal bar ma byas la /
analyzed: dngos po med pa ma yin no zhes bya bar mngon par mi byed la / mngon par ma byas shing gsal bar ma byas la /
translated: Since it is not apprehended, it is not manifest.🔽Since it is not manifest, it is not clearly evident.

original: ma bzung ba de ni de ltar yod do zhes bya bar mi rigs so //
analyzed: ma bzung ba de ni de ltar yod do zhes bya bar mi rigs so //
translated: Since it is not clearly evident, it is not grasped. It is illogical to say that it exists in that way.

original: ji ltar mya ngan las 'das pa la rtog pa bzhi po 'di dag rnam pa thams cad du mi srid pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar mya ngan las 'das pa la rtog pa bzhi po 'di dag rnam pa thams cad du mi srid pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as these four conceptions about nirvana are impossible in every respect,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa thugs su chud pa po de bzhin gshegs pa la yang rtog pa 'di dag srid pa ma yin zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa thugs su chud pa po de bzhin gshegs pa la yang rtog pa 'di dag srid pa ma yin zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that such concepts are impossible even for the Tathagata, who has realized nirvana, it is said:

original: bcom ldan mya ngan 'das gyur nas //
analyzed: bcom ldan mya ngan 'das gyur nas //
translated: The Bhagavat, having attained nirvana,🔽is not manifest as existent,

original: yod par mi mngon de bzhin du //🔽med do zhe 'am gnyi ga 'am //
analyzed: yod par mi mngon de bzhin du // med do zhe 'am gnyi ga 'am //
translated: and likewise

original: gnyis min zhes kyang mi mngon no //🔽zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: gnyis min zhes kyang mi mngon no // zhes gsungs te /
translated: is not manifest as nonexistent, both, or neither.🔽Thus, as was explained above:

original: 'di ltar // gang gis 'dzin stug bzung gyur pa //🔽de ni mya ngan 'das pa la //🔽de bzhin gshegs pa yod ce 'am //
analyzed: 'di ltar // gang gis 'dzin stug bzung gyur pa // de ni mya ngan 'das pa la // de bzhin gshegs pa yod ce 'am //
translated: One who is seized by the tight grip of🔽grasping at “I” and “mine”🔽will conceptualize the Tathagata as

original: med ces rnam rtog rtog par byed //🔽ces gong du bshad zin to //
analyzed: med ces rnam rtog rtog par byed // ces gong du bshad zin to //
