original: de ltar na re zhig de bzhin gshegs pa mya ngan las 'das phan chad yod pa'am med do zhes bya bar mi mngon no //
analyzed: de ltar na re zhig de bzhin gshegs pa mya ngan las 'das phan chad yod pa'am med do zhes bya bar mi mngon no //
translated: Thus, first of all, it is not manifest that the Tathagata exists or does not exist after attaining nirvana.

original: 'di gnyis med pas gnyi ga'o zhes bya bar yang mi mngon no //
analyzed: 'di gnyis med pas gnyi ga'o zhes bya bar yang mi mngon no //
translated: Since neither of these two is the case, it is not manifest that he is both.

original: gnyi ga med pa nyid kyis na gnyi ga ma yin pa zhes bya bar yang mi mngon zhing mi 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: gnyi ga med pa nyid kyis na gnyi ga ma yin pa zhes bya bar yang mi mngon zhing mi 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: Since neither is the case, it is not even the case that he is not manifest or apprehended as “neither.”

original: bcom ldan 'das mya ngan las 'das nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das mya ngan las 'das nas /
translated: After the Blessed One’s parinirvāṇa,

original: rnam pa bzhir mi mngon pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: rnam pa bzhir mi mngon pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: not only is he not manifest in the four ways,🔽but also,

original: gzhan yang / bcom ldan bzhugs par gyur na yang //
analyzed: gzhan yang / bcom ldan bzhugs par gyur na yang //
translated: while the Blessed One was present,

original: yod par mi mngon de bzhin du //
analyzed: yod par mi mngon de bzhin du //
translated: he was not manifest as existent,🔽nor as nonexistent,

original: med do zhe 'am gnyi ga dang // gnyis min zhes kyang mi mngon no //
analyzed: med do zhe 'am gnyi ga dang // gnyis min zhes kyang mi mngon no //
translated: nor as both, nor as neither.

original: ji ltar mi mngon pa de ltar ni de bzhin gshegs pa brtag par bstan zin pa nyid do //
analyzed: ji ltar mi mngon pa de ltar ni de bzhin gshegs pa brtag par bstan zin pa nyid do //
translated: As to how he was not manifest, that has already been explained in the chapter on the analysis of the Tathāgata.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /🔽'khor ba mya ngan 'das pa las //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir / 'khor ba mya ngan 'das pa las //
translated: For that very reason,

original: khyad par cung zad yod ma yin //
analyzed: khyad par cung zad yod ma yin //
translated: there is not the slightest difference

original: mya ngan 'das pa'ang 'khor ba las //
analyzed: mya ngan 'das pa'ang 'khor ba las //
translated: between saṃsāra and nirvāṇa.

original: khyad par cung zad yod ma yin //
analyzed: khyad par cung zad yod ma yin //
translated: There is not the slightest difference🔽between nirvāṇa and saṃsāra.

original: gang gi phyir @180a * //
analyzed: gang gi phyir @180a * //
translated: Since,🔽while the Blessed One was present, he was not manifest as existent, and so on,

original: bcom ldan 'das zhugs pa na yang yod do zhes bya ba la sogs pa mi mngon la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhugs pa na yang yod do zhes bya ba la sogs pa mi mngon la /
translated: and

original: mya ngan las 'das pa na yang yod do zhes bya ba la sogs par mi mngon pa de nyid kyi phyir 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa gnyis la phan tshun khyad par 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa na yang yod do zhes bya ba la sogs par mi mngon pa de nyid kyi phyir 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa gnyis la phan tshun khyad par 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Because of that, samsara and nirvana are not different in the least,

original: rnam par dpyad na rang bzhin mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //🔽gang yang bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad du /
analyzed: rnam par dpyad na rang bzhin mtshungs pa'i phyir ro // gang yang bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad du /
translated: because when analyzed, they are the same in nature.

original: dge slong dag skye ba dang rga shi'i 'khor ba ni thog ma dang tha ma med do zhes gsungs pa de yang 'di nyid kyi phyir 'thad pa yin to /
analyzed: dge slong dag skye ba dang rga shi'i 'khor ba ni thog ma dang tha ma med do zhes gsungs pa de yang 'di nyid kyi phyir 'thad pa yin to /
translated: Also, the statement by the Bhagavān, “Monks, the cycle of birth and aging and death is without a beginning or end,” is tenable for this very reason.

original: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa gnyis la khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa gnyis la khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no difference between samsara and nirvana.🔽Thus,

original: 'di ltar / myang 'das mtha' dag gang yin pa //
analyzed: 'di ltar / myang 'das mtha' dag gang yin pa //
translated: The end of nirvana

original: de ni 'khor ba'i mtha' yin te //🔽de gnyis khyad par cung zad ni //
analyzed: de ni 'khor ba'i mtha' yin te // de gnyis khyad par cung zad ni //
translated: Is the end of samsara.🔽There is not the slightest

original: shin tu phra ba'ang yod ma yin //
analyzed: shin tu phra ba'ang yod ma yin //
translated: Difference between the two.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa dang 'khor ba la khyad par med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa dang 'khor ba la khyad par med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because there is no difference between nirvana and samsara,

original: sngon dang phyi ma'i mthar rtog pa yod pa ma yin pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: sngon dang phyi ma'i mthar rtog pa yod pa ma yin pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: Not only is there no conception of a prior limit and a later limit,🔽The views of the world’s end, permanence,🔽and so on, are based on

original: gang 'das phan chad mtha' sogs dang // rtag la sogs par lta ba dag / mya ngan 'das dang phyi mtha' dang // sngon gyi mtha' la brten pa yin //
analyzed: gang 'das phan chad mtha' sogs dang // rtag la sogs par lta ba dag / mya ngan 'das dang phyi mtha' dang // sngon gyi mtha' la brten pa yin //
translated: nirvana, the later limit, and the prior limit.

original: de dag kyang de nyid kyi phyir mi 'thad pa yin te /
analyzed: de dag kyang de nyid kyi phyir mi 'thad pa yin te /
translated: They are also untenable for that reason.

original: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa de gnyis ka yang rang bzhin gyis zhi ba nyid du ro gcig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa de gnyis ka yang rang bzhin gyis zhi ba nyid du ro gcig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because both cyclic existence and nirvana are of one taste in being naturally peaceful.

original: de la 'das phan chad ces bya ba'i nye bar mtshon pa 'dis ni lta ba bzhin bzung ngo //
analyzed: de la 'das phan chad ces bya ba'i nye bar mtshon pa 'dis ni lta ba bzhin bzung ngo //
translated: The phrase “and so on” in the line “the views of the world’s end, permanence, and so on” includes the views of nihilism, finitude, and infinitude.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: The views of the world’s end and so on are as follows.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa grongs phan chad pa yod pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa grongs phan chad med pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa grongs phan chad yod kyang yod la med kyang med pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa grongs phan chad yod pa yang ma yin med pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa grongs phan chad pa yod pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa grongs phan chad med pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa grongs phan chad yod kyang yod la med kyang med pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa grongs phan chad yod pa yang ma yin med pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba ste /
translated: and the Tathagata neither exists nor does not exist after death.

original: lta ba bzhi po 'di dag ni mya ngan las 'das pa la mchog tu 'dzin par zhugs so //
analyzed: lta ba bzhi po 'di dag ni mya ngan las 'das pa la mchog tu 'dzin par zhugs so //
translated: These four views are based on the belief in the supremacy of liberation.

original: mtha' la sogs pa yang lta ba bzhi'o //
analyzed: mtha' la sogs pa yang lta ba bzhi'o //
translated: The four views concerning the extremes, etc., are also four views.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: 'jig rten mtha' dang ldan no //
analyzed: 'jig rten mtha' dang ldan no //
translated: The world is eternal,

original: 'jig rten mtha' dang mi ldan no //🔽'jig rten mtha' dang ldan pa yang yin la mtha' dang mi ldan pa yang yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten mtha' dang mi ldan no // 'jig rten mtha' dang ldan pa yang yin la mtha' dang mi ldan pa yang yin no //
translated: the world is not eternal,🔽the world is both eternal and not eternal,

original: mtha' dang ldan pa yang ma yin la mtha' dang mi ldan pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: mtha' dang ldan pa yang ma yin la mtha' dang mi ldan pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba ste /
translated: and the world is neither eternal nor not eternal.

original: lta @180b ba bzhi po 'di dag ni phyi ma'i mtha' la brten te 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: lta @180b ba bzhi po 'di dag ni phyi ma'i mtha' la brten te 'jug pa yin no //
translated: These four views are based on the future.

original: de la bdag dang 'jig rten la ma 'ongs pa'i skye ba ma mthong bas 'jig rten mtha' dang ldan no zhes de ltar na rtog pa na /
analyzed: de la bdag dang 'jig rten la ma 'ongs pa'i skye ba ma mthong bas 'jig rten mtha' dang ldan no zhes de ltar na rtog pa na /
translated: If one thinks that the world is finite because one does not see future birth of the world,

original: phyi ma'i mtha' la brten nas 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyi ma'i mtha' la brten nas 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: then one engages in a view based on the future.

original: de bzhin du ma 'ongs pa'i skye ba mthong bas 'jig rten mtha' dang mi ldan no zhes 'jug cing /🔽mthong ba dang ma mthong bas ni gnyi gar rtogs par 'gyur la /
analyzed: de bzhin du ma 'ongs pa'i skye ba mthong bas 'jig rten mtha' dang mi ldan no zhes 'jug cing / mthong ba dang ma mthong bas ni gnyi gar rtogs par 'gyur la /
translated: Similarly, if one thinks that the world is infinite because one does not see future birth of the world,🔽then one engages in a view based on the future.🔽If one thinks that the world is both finite and infinite, then one engages in a view based on the future.

original: gnyi ga bkag pas ni mtha' dang ldan pa yang ma yin mtha' dang mi ldan pa yang ma yin no zhes bya bar rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnyi ga bkag pas ni mtha' dang ldan pa yang ma yin mtha' dang mi ldan pa yang ma yin no zhes bya bar rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one thinks that the world is neither finite nor infinite, then one engages in a view based on the future.

original: 'jig rten rtag go //
analyzed: 'jig rten rtag go //
translated: The world is permanent.

original: 'jig rten mi rtag go //
analyzed: 'jig rten mi rtag go //
translated: The world is impermanent.🔽The world is both permanent and impermanent.

original: 'jig rten rtag kyang rtag la mi rtag kyang mi rtag go //
analyzed: 'jig rten rtag kyang rtag la mi rtag kyang mi rtag go //
translated: The world is neither permanent nor impermanent.

original: rtag pa yang ma yin mi rtag pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba lta ba bzhi po 'di dag ni sngon gyi mtha' la brten nas 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: rtag pa yang ma yin mi rtag pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba lta ba bzhi po 'di dag ni sngon gyi mtha' la brten nas 'byung ba yin no //
translated: “It is neither permanent nor impermanent” — these four views arise in dependence on the prior limit.

original: de la bdag dang 'jig rten las 'das par skyes pa mthong bas 'jig rten rtag go snyam du rtogs par 'gyur la /
analyzed: de la bdag dang 'jig rten las 'das par skyes pa mthong bas 'jig rten rtag go snyam du rtogs par 'gyur la /
translated: One thinks, “The world is permanent,” seeing that it is beyond the self and the world.

original: ma mthong bas ni mi rtag go snyam du rtogs par 'gyur ro //🔽mthong ba dang ma mthong bas ni rtag kyang rtag la mi rtag kyang mi rtag go snyam du rtogs par 'gyur la /
analyzed: ma mthong bas ni mi rtag go snyam du rtogs par 'gyur ro // mthong ba dang ma mthong bas ni rtag kyang rtag la mi rtag kyang mi rtag go snyam du rtogs par 'gyur la /
translated: One thinks, “It is impermanent,” not seeing it.🔽One thinks, “It is both permanent and impermanent,” seeing and not seeing it.

original: mthong ba yang ma yin ma mthong ba yang ma yin pas ni rtag pa yang ma yin mi rtag pa yang ma yin no snyam du rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mthong ba yang ma yin ma mthong ba yang ma yin pas ni rtag pa yang ma yin mi rtag pa yang ma yin no snyam du rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: One thinks, “It is neither permanent nor impermanent,” neither seeing nor not seeing it.

original: lta ba 'di dag ji ltar rung bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: lta ba 'di dag ji ltar rung bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How could these views be tenable?

original: gal te dngos po gang zhig la rang bzhin 'ga' zhig yod na ni /
analyzed: gal te dngos po gang zhig la rang bzhin 'ga' zhig yod na ni /
translated: If any thing had any essence,

original: de la dngos po dang dngos po med par brtags pas lta ba 'di dag yod par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: de la dngos po dang dngos po med par brtags pas lta ba 'di dag yod par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: Since things and nonthings are investigated, these views exist.

original: gang gi tshe 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa gnyis la khyad par med par bstan pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa gnyis la khyad par med par bstan pa de'i tshe /
translated: But when it is shown that there is no difference between cyclic existence and nirvana,

original: dngos po thams cad stong pa la //🔽mtha' yod ci zhig mtha' med ci //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad stong pa la // mtha' yod ci zhig mtha' med ci //
translated: then all things are empty.

original: mtha' dang mtha' med ci zhig yin //
analyzed: mtha' dang mtha' med ci zhig yin //
translated: How could there be an end? How could there be no end?🔽How could there be both end and no end?

original: mtha' dang mtha' med min pa ci //🔽de nyid ci zhig gzhan ci yin //🔽rtag pa ci zhig mi rtag ci //🔽rtag dang mi rtag gnyi ga ci //
analyzed: mtha' dang mtha' med min pa ci // de nyid ci zhig gzhan ci yin // rtag pa ci zhig mi rtag ci // rtag dang mi rtag gnyi ga ci //
translated: How could there be neither end nor no end?🔽How could there be reality? How could there be unreality?🔽How could there be both reality and unreality?

original: gnyi ga yin pa'ang ci zhig yin //
analyzed: gnyi ga yin pa'ang ci zhig yin //
translated: How could there be neither reality nor unreality?

original: lung du ma bstan pa'i dngos po bcu bzhi po 'di dag kyang dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo med na mi rigs pa nyid do //
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa'i dngos po bcu bzhi po 'di dag kyang dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo med na mi rigs pa nyid do //
translated: These fourteen indeterminate things are not tenable if the intrinsic reality of things does not exist.

original: gang zhig dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo sgro btags te /
analyzed: gang zhig dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo sgro btags te /
translated: Someone who superimposes the intrinsic reality of things

original: de dang bral ba dang ma bral ba las lta ba 'di dag bskyed nas /
analyzed: de dang bral ba dang ma bral ba las lta ba 'di dag bskyed nas /
translated: and generates these views on the basis of whether they are separated from or not separated from that🔽.

original: mngon par zhen pa de'i mngon @181a * //
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa de'i mngon @181a * //
translated: One should understand that this attachment

original: par zhen pa 'dis mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong khyer du 'gro ba'i lam 'gog cing /
analyzed: par zhen pa 'dis mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong khyer du 'gro ba'i lam 'gog cing /
translated: blocks the path to the city of nirvana and

original: 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal dag la sbyor bar byed pa yin no zhes shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal dag la sbyor bar byed pa yin no zhes shes par bya'o //
translated: binds one to the sufferings of cyclic existence.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might say this:

original: gal te de ltar khyod kyis mya ngan las 'das pa yang bkag na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar khyod kyis mya ngan las 'das pa yang bkag na /
translated: “If you refute nirvana in this way,

original: de ltar yin na /
analyzed: de ltar yin na /
translated: then it follows that

original: bcom ldan 'das sems can gyi phung po spyod pa mtha' yas pa'i rjes su 'jug pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das sems can gyi phung po spyod pa mtha' yas pa'i rjes su 'jug pa /
translated: the Bhagavān, who has entered the infinite conduct of the mass of sentient beings,

original: 'gro ba'i bsam pa'i rang bzhin phyin ci ma log par thugs su chud pa /
analyzed: 'gro ba'i bsam pa'i rang bzhin phyin ci ma log par thugs su chud pa /
translated: who has perfectly understood the nature of the thoughts of beings,

original: thugs rje chen po'i gzhan dbang du gyur pas /🔽'jig rten gyi mya ngan las 'das pa thob par mdzad pa'i slad du /
analyzed: thugs rje chen po'i gzhan dbang du gyur pas / 'jig rten gyi mya ngan las 'das pa thob par mdzad pa'i slad du /
translated: and who is under the power of great compassion,🔽teaches the Dharma that is the antidote to conduct in order to cause the attainment of mundane nirvana.

original: spyod pa'i gnyen por rjes su mthun pa'i chos bstan pa gang yin pa de don med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: spyod pa'i gnyen por rjes su mthun pa'i chos bstan pa gang yin pa de don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: That would be pointless.”

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /
translated: We respond:

original: gal te chos zhes bya ba 'ga' zhig gam /
analyzed: gal te chos zhes bya ba 'ga' zhig gam /
translated: If there were some phenomenon called “nirvana,”

original: chos de'i nyan pa po'i sems can 'ga' zhig gam /
analyzed: chos de'i nyan pa po'i sems can 'ga' zhig gam /
translated: If there were some sentient beings who were the listeners of that Dharma,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba ston pa po 'ga' zhig yod na ni de'i tshe 'di de ltar 'gyur na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba ston pa po 'ga' zhig yod na ni de'i tshe 'di de ltar 'gyur na /
translated: or if there were some teacher called the Bhagavat Buddha, then at that time this would be so.

original: gang gi tshe /🔽dmigs pa thams cad nyer zhi zhing /
analyzed: gang gi tshe / dmigs pa thams cad nyer zhi zhing /
translated: But when🔽All objectifications are completely pacified,

original: spros pa nyer zhi zhi ba ste //🔽sangs rgyas kyis ni gang du yang //
analyzed: spros pa nyer zhi zhi ba ste // sangs rgyas kyis ni gang du yang //
translated: And elaborations are completely pacified,🔽The Buddha has not taught

original: su la'ang chos 'ga' ma bstan to //
analyzed: su la'ang chos 'ga' ma bstan to //
translated: Any Dharma to anyone anywhere.

original: ma gsungs pa de'i tshe kho bo cag la ji skad smras pa'i nyes par thal bar gal 'gyur /
analyzed: ma gsungs pa de'i tshe kho bo cag la ji skad smras pa'i nyes par thal bar gal 'gyur /
translated: When he has not taught, how could the fault that you attribute to us follow for us?

original: 'dir spros pa ste mtshan ma rnams gang nye bar zhi ba ste /
analyzed: 'dir spros pa ste mtshan ma rnams gang nye bar zhi ba ste /
translated: Here, the pacification of elaborations, that is, signs,

original: mi 'jug pa gang yin pa de mya ngan las 'das pa yin la /
analyzed: mi 'jug pa gang yin pa de mya ngan las 'das pa yin la /
translated: is nirvana.

original: nye bar zhi ba de nyid ni nye bar zhi ba ste rang bzhin gyis nye bar zhi ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nye bar zhi ba de nyid ni nye bar zhi ba ste rang bzhin gyis nye bar zhi ba'i phyir ro //
translated: That pacification itself is pacified, because it is pacified by nature.

original: yang na tshig mi 'jug pas spros pa nyer zhi yin la /
analyzed: yang na tshig mi 'jug pas spros pa nyer zhi yin la /
translated: Or, since words do not operate, elaborations are pacified.

original: sems mi 'jug pas zhi ba'o //
analyzed: sems mi 'jug pas zhi ba'o //
translated: Since the mind does not operate, it is peace.

original: yang na nyon mongs pa rnams mi 'byung bas spros pa nyer zhi yin la skye ba mi 'byung pas zhi ba'o //
analyzed: yang na nyon mongs pa rnams mi 'byung bas spros pa nyer zhi yin la skye ba mi 'byung pas zhi ba'o //
translated: Or, it is the complete pacification of elaborations because afflictions do not occur and it is peace because birth does not occur.

original: yang na nyon mongs pa spangs pas spros pa nyer zhi yin la /
analyzed: yang na nyon mongs pa spangs pas spros pa nyer zhi yin la /
translated: Or, it is the complete pacification of elaborations because afflictions are abandoned.

original: bag chags ma lus par spangs pas zhi ba'o //
analyzed: bag chags ma lus par spangs pas zhi ba'o //
translated: It is peace because all habitual tendencies are abandoned.

original: yang na shes bya ma dmigs pas spros pa nyer zhi yin la /
analyzed: yang na shes bya ma dmigs pas spros pa nyer zhi yin la /
translated: It is the complete pacification of elaborations because objects of knowledge are not observed.

original: shes pa ma dmigs pas zhi ba'o //
analyzed: shes pa ma dmigs pas zhi ba'o //
translated: It is peace because consciousness is not observed.

original: gang gi tshe de ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams nam mkha' la dang pa'i rgyal po dag rang gi gshog pa brdabs pa'i rlung la gnas pa'am /
analyzed: gang gi tshe de ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams nam mkha' la dang pa'i rgyal po dag rang gi gshog pa brdabs pa'i rlung la gnas pa'am /
translated: When the Bhagavān buddhas abide in nirvāṇa in that way, they abide in the manner of not abiding in the essence of peace, which is the complete pacification of all elaborations and peace.

original: nam mkha' ci yang ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir rlung nam mkha' la gnas pa ltar /🔽mya ngan las 'das pa spros pa thams cad @181b nye par zhi zhing /
analyzed: nam mkha' ci yang ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir rlung nam mkha' la gnas pa ltar / mya ngan las 'das pa spros pa thams cad @181b nye par zhi zhing /
translated: Just as the wind abides in space because space is nothing at all,

original: zhi ba'i ngo bo la mi gnas pa'i tshul gyis gnas pa /
analyzed: zhi ba'i ngo bo la mi gnas pa'i tshul gyis gnas pa /
translated: the buddhas abide in nirvāṇa in the manner of not abiding in the essence of peace, which is the complete pacification of all elaborations and peace.

original: de'i tshe mtshan ma thams cad nye bar ma dmigs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i tshe mtshan ma thams cad nye bar ma dmigs pa'i phyir /
translated: At that time, because all signs are not observed,

analyzed: lha'am mi su la yang kun nas nyon mongs pa'am rnam par byang ba'i chos 'ga' yang ma bstan to zhes bya bar shes par bya'o //

analyzed: zhi ba'i blo gros gang gi nub mo de bzhin gshegs pa bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa dang / gang gi nub mo len pa mi mnga' bar yongs su mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur ba de'i bar du /
translated: Śāntimati, from the night when the Tathāgata fully and completely awakens to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment until the night when he passes into parinirvāṇa without remainder,

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas tha na yi ge 'brug gcig kyang ma gsungs so //
translated: in between, the Tathāgata did not speak even a single syllable.🔽He will not speak.

original: gsung bar mi 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gsung bar mi 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is said.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /

original: thams cad tshig med yi ge med //
analyzed: thams cad tshig med yi ge med //
translated: All are without words, without syllables,

original: gdod nas zhi zhing dri med stong //
analyzed: gdod nas zhi zhing dri med stong //

original: chos rnams de ltar sus shes pa //
analyzed: chos rnams de ltar sus shes pa //

original: de ni gzhon nu sangs rgyas brjod //
analyzed: de ni gzhon nu sangs rgyas brjod //

original: ces gsungs so //
analyzed: ces gsungs so //

analyzed: 'o na ji ltar gsung rab kyi tha snyad shin tu sna tshogs pa de dag mngon par 'gyur zhe na /

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'dis kho bo cag la chos 'di dag bstan to zhes bya ba 'di ni /
translated: The statement “This Blessed One taught this Dharma to me”

original: lus can ma rig pa'i gnyid dang ldan zhing rmi lam rmi bzhin pa rnams kyi rang gi rnam par rtog pa las byung ba yin no //
analyzed: lus can ma rig pa'i gnyid dang ldan zhing rmi lam rmi bzhin pa rnams kyi rang gi rnam par rtog pa las byung ba yin no //

original: ji skad du /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis /
analyzed: ji skad du / bcom ldan 'das kyis /
translated: As it is said:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa zag pa med pa yin //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa zag pa med pa yin //
translated: The Blessed One is the Transcendent Lord,

original: dge ba'i chos kyi gzugs brnyan lta bu yin //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos kyi gzugs brnyan lta bu yin //
translated: The reflection of virtuous qualities,

original: de bzhin nyid dang de bzhin gshegs pa med //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid dang de bzhin gshegs pa med //
translated: There is no suchness and no Transcendent Lord,

analyzed: 'jig rten thams cad kyi ni gzugs brnyan mthong //🔽zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: But the reflection of the whole world is seen.

original: de bzhin du 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsang ba bstan pa'i le'u las rgya cher bstan pa yin te /🔽de'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa'i slad du chos bstan pa med pas chos bstan pa yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsang ba bstan pa'i le'u las rgya cher bstan pa yin te / de'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa'i slad du chos bstan pa med pas chos bstan pa yod pa'i phyir /
translated: Likewise, this is taught extensively in the chapter on the teaching of the secret of the Tathagata.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa yod pa nyid du ga la 'gyur //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa yod pa nyid du ga la 'gyur //
translated: Therefore, since there is no teaching of the Dharma for the sake of nirvana, how could nirvana exist, since the teaching of the Dharma exists?

analyzed: de'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa yang med do zhes bya ba grub po //

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang /🔽mya ngan 'das @182a * //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang / mya ngan 'das @182a * //

original: med myang 'das su /
analyzed: med myang 'das su /
translated: “Nirvana is not nirvana.

original: 'jig rten mgon gyis bstan pa ste //
analyzed: 'jig rten mgon gyis bstan pa ste //
translated: The Protector of the World has taught that

original: nam mkha' mdud pa bor ba ni //
analyzed: nam mkha' mdud pa bor ba ni //

original: nam mkha' nyid kyis bkrol ba yin //🔽zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: nam mkha' nyid kyis bkrol ba yin // zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: is untied by space itself.”

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: And likewise:

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gang dag chos 'ga' zhig skye ba'am 'gag par 'tshal ba de dag la ni sangs rgyas 'byung ba ma lags so //
translated: “Lord, those who know any dharma to arise or cease do not have the Buddha-nature.

original: bcom ldan 'das gang dag 'khor ba dngos por 'tshal ba de dag ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gang dag 'khor ba dngos por 'tshal ba de dag ni /
translated: Lord, those who know samsara as a thing

original: 'khor ba las 'da' ba ma lags so //
analyzed: 'khor ba las 'da' ba ma lags so //
translated: they do not transcend saṃsāra.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /

original: bcom ldan 'das mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bgyi ba ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bgyi ba ni /
translated: Blessed One, nirvāṇa is

original: gang mtshan ma thams cad rab tu zhi ba /
analyzed: gang mtshan ma thams cad rab tu zhi ba /
translated: the pacification of all characteristics

original: rnam par rtog pa thams cad 'gags pa lags na /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa thams cad 'gags pa lags na /
translated: and the cessation of all conceptualization.

original: bcom ldan 'das skyes bu blun po legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la rab tu byung nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das skyes bu blun po legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la rab tu byung nas /

original: mu stegs kyi lta bar lhung ba de dag ni /
analyzed: mu stegs kyi lta bar lhung ba de dag ni /
translated: but fall into the views of the extremists🔽are like

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: this:

analyzed: til las til mar dang / 'o ma las mar gsar ltar mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po las tshol bar bgyid do // bcom ldan 'das gang dag chos thams cad shin tu mya ngan las 'das pa la /
translated: they seek nirvāṇa in things, as if nirvāṇa were something like sesame oil or fresh butter.🔽Blessed One, those conceited people who seek nirvāṇa

original: mya ngan las 'das pa 'tshol ba mngon pa'i nga rgyal can de dag ni /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa 'tshol ba mngon pa'i nga rgyal can de dag ni /
translated: in all phenomena that are utterly beyond suffering🔽are tīrthikas.

original: mu stegs can yin no zhes kho bo gleng ste /
analyzed: mu stegs can yin no zhes kho bo gleng ste /
translated: I say that they are tīrthikas.

original: bcom ldan 'das rnal 'byor spyod pa yang dag par zhugs pa ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rnal 'byor spyod pa yang dag par zhugs pa ni /
translated: Blessed One, those who are engaged in the practice of yoga

original: chos gang yang skye ba'am 'gag par mi bgyid la /
analyzed: chos gang yang skye ba'am 'gag par mi bgyid la /
translated: He does not cause any phenomenon to arise or cease.

original: chos gang yang 'thob pa dang / mngon par rtogs par mi 'tshal lo zhes rgya cher gsungs so //🔽slob dpon zla ba grags pa'i zhal snga nas sbyar ba'i tshig gsal ba las /

analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa brtag pa zhes bya ba rab tu byed pa nyi shu rtsa lnga pa'i 'grel ba'o /
translated: This concludes the commentary on the twenty-fifth chapter, having twenty-two verses, called “the examination of nirvana.”🔽Here, it is said:

original: // /'dir / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba gang //
analyzed: // /'dir / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba gang //
translated: That which is dependent origination

original: de ni stong pa nyid du bshad //
analyzed: de ni stong pa nyid du bshad //
translated: Is explained to be emptiness.

original: de ni brten nas gdags pa ste //
analyzed: de ni brten nas gdags pa ste //
translated: That is dependent imputation.

original: de nyid dbu ma'i lam yin no //
analyzed: de nyid dbu ma'i lam yin no //
translated: That itself is the middle way.

analyzed: zhes gang bshad na gang zhig stong pa nyid ces bya bar brjod pa rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba de gang yin zhes smra'o //
translated: If this is explained, then one should say what is that which is called “emptiness,” that dependent origination.

original: rnam pa gcig tu na /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na /
translated: In one way,

original: gang 'di skad du /
analyzed: gang 'di skad du /
translated: it is said:

original: gang gi rten cing 'brel bar 'byung //
analyzed: gang gi rten cing 'brel bar 'byung //

original: mthong ba des ni sdug bsngal dang // kun 'byung dang ni 'gog pa dang // lam nyid de dag mthong ba yin //
analyzed: mthong ba des ni sdug bsngal dang // kun 'byung dang ni 'gog pa dang // lam nyid de dag mthong ba yin //

original: zhes bshad pa /
analyzed: zhes bshad pa /
translated: This is explained.

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba de go gang yin zhe'o //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba de go gang yin zhe'o //
translated: What is the meaning of dependent origination?

analyzed: de'i phyir @182b de'i yan lag gi rab tu dbye ba brjod par bzhed nas 'di skad du /
translated: Therefore, wishing to explain its members, it is said:

original: ma rig bsgribs pas yang srid phyir //
analyzed: ma rig bsgribs pas yang srid phyir //
translated: Because of being obscured by ignorance,🔽for the sake of renewed existence,

original: 'du byed rnam pa gsum po dag / mngon par 'du byed gang yin pa'i //🔽las de dag gis 'gro bar 'gro //
analyzed: 'du byed rnam pa gsum po dag / mngon par 'du byed gang yin pa'i // las de dag gis 'gro bar 'gro //
translated: the three kinds of volitions

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: are the karma that goes to the realms.

original: de la ma rig pa ni mi shes pa ste /
analyzed: de la ma rig pa ni mi shes pa ste /
translated: Therein, ignorance is non-knowledge.

original: mun pa dang yang dag pa ji lta ba la sgrib par byed pa'o //
analyzed: mun pa dang yang dag pa ji lta ba la sgrib par byed pa'o //
translated: It is darkness that obscures reality just as it is.

original: ma rig pa des bsgribs shing bkab pa'i gang zag gis yang srid pa'i phyir te yang srid pa'i don dang / yang srid pa 'byung bar bya ba'i phyir gang dge ba la sogs pa'i sems pa dag mngon par 'du byed cing skyed par byed do //
analyzed: ma rig pa des bsgribs shing bkab pa'i gang zag gis yang srid pa'i phyir te yang srid pa'i don dang / yang srid pa 'byung bar bya ba'i phyir gang dge ba la sogs pa'i sems pa dag mngon par 'du byed cing skyed par byed do //
translated: The person who is obscured and covered by that ignorance forms and generates volitions for the sake of rebirth, for the purpose of rebirth, in order to bring about rebirth.

analyzed: 'du byed de dag ni yang srid pa mngon par 'du byed pas 'du byed do //
translated: Those volitions are volitions that bring about rebirth.

original: de dag kyang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de dag kyang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: They are also of three kinds:

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba dang mi g-yo ba'o //
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba dang mi g-yo ba'o //
translated: wholesome, unwholesome, and unmoving.

original: yang na lus kyi dang ngag gi dang yid kyi'o //
analyzed: yang na lus kyi dang ngag gi dang yid kyi'o //
translated: Or else, they are bodily, verbal, and mental.

original: gang zag ma rig pas bsgribs pas las kyi mtshan nyid can 'du byed rnam pa gsum byed la /
analyzed: gang zag ma rig pas bsgribs pas las kyi mtshan nyid can 'du byed rnam pa gsum byed la /
translated: The person, obscured by ignorance, performs the three kinds of volitions that have the characteristic of action.

original: mngon par 'du byed pas 'du byed las te las kyi ming can de dag gis ni de'i rgyus byung ba 'gro bar 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed pas 'du byed las te las kyi ming can de dag gis ni de'i rgyus byung ba 'gro bar 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By forming them, he goes to the destinations through those volitions, which have the name of action, by the cause of those volitions.

original: de nas de'i /
analyzed: de nas de'i /
translated: Then, from that,

original: 'du byed rkyen can rnam par shes //
analyzed: 'du byed rkyen can rnam par shes //
translated: Consciousness is conditioned by volitions.

original: 'gro ba rnams su 'jug par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'gro ba rnams su 'jug par 'gyur //
translated: It enters into the destinations.

original: gang zag 'du byed byas shing bsags pa de'i rnam par shes pa 'du byed kyi rgyu can 'khor ba don ma yin pa'i sa bon du gyur pa ni 'gro ba 'du byed dang mthun par lha la sogs pa rnams su 'jug pa ste rab tu 'jug cing skye
analyzed: gang zag 'du byed byas shing bsags pa de'i rnam par shes pa 'du byed kyi rgyu can 'khor ba don ma yin pa'i sa bon du gyur pa ni 'gro ba 'du byed dang mthun par lha la sogs pa rnams su 'jug pa ste rab tu 'jug cing skye
translated: The consciousness of the person who has created and accumulated formative factors, which is the cause of formative factors, and which is the seed of the unfortunate realms of cyclic existence, enters the various realms of gods and so on, in accordance with the formative factors.

original: bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It enters and is born there.

original: de nas dus phyis /
analyzed: de nas dus phyis /
translated: Then, after some time,

original: rnam par shes pa zhugs gyur na //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa zhugs gyur na //
translated: when consciousness has entered,

original: ming dang gzugs ni chags par 'gyur//🔽de las dang nyon mongs pas bsgos pas skye ba'i gnas de dang der bkri bas na ming yin pa'am /
analyzed: ming dang gzugs ni chags par 'gyur// de las dang nyon mongs pas bsgos pas skye ba'i gnas de dang der bkri bas na ming yin pa'am /
translated: name and form will be attached.

original: yang na don dag la ming gi dbang gis rgyug pas na ming ste /
analyzed: yang na don dag la ming gi dbang gis rgyug pas na ming ste /
translated: Name is so called because it leads to the place of birth, since it is colored by karma and affliction, or it is called name because it runs to objects by the power of name.

original: gzugs can ma yin pa'i phung po bzhi la ming zhes bsnyad do //
analyzed: gzugs can ma yin pa'i phung po bzhi la ming zhes bsnyad do //
translated: The four immaterial aggregates are called name.

original: gzhig tu rung pas na gzugs te gnod par byar rung zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzhig tu rung pas na gzugs te gnod par byar rung zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Form is so called because it can be destroyed, which is to say it can be harmed.

original: gzugs 'di dang sngar gyi ming gnyis po 'di dag bsdoms te ming dang gzugs zhes rnam par gzhag go //🔽de la gzugs dang gzugs brnyan gyi tshul gyis tha ma 'chi ba'i phung po rnams 'gags pa na skad cig ma gcig kho na la srang ma ba'i mthon @183a * //
analyzed: gzugs 'di dang sngar gyi ming gnyis po 'di dag bsdoms te ming dang gzugs zhes rnam par gzhag go // de la gzugs dang gzugs brnyan gyi tshul gyis tha ma 'chi ba'i phung po rnams 'gags pa na skad cig ma gcig kho na la srang ma ba'i mthon @183a * //
translated: The name and this form are combined and posited as name-and-form.

original: dman gyi tshul du skye ba'i cha'i phung po rnams las kyis ji ltar 'phangs ba ltar skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dman gyi tshul du skye ba'i cha'i phung po rnams las kyis ji ltar 'phangs ba ltar skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In this regard, just as a reflection of form arises, when the aggregates at death cease, the aggregates of the stage of birth arise in a single moment, in accordance with the projection of karma, like the rising and falling of a scale.

original: de'i phyir de ltar ma'i mngal du rnam par shes pa brgyal bar gyur na /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar ma'i mngal du rnam par shes pa brgyal bar gyur na /
translated: Therefore, when consciousness is stunned in the mother’s womb,

original: rnam par shes pa'i rkyen can gyi ming dang gzugs chags par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i rkyen can gyi ming dang gzugs chags par 'gyur te /
translated: name-and-form conditioned by consciousness develops.

original: red cing 'bru bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: red cing 'bru bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means that it is established and grows.

original: gal te 'gro bar rnam par shes pa brgyal bar mi 'gyur na ni de'i tshe ming dang gzugs 'byung bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te 'gro bar rnam par shes pa brgyal bar mi 'gyur na ni de'i tshe ming dang gzugs 'byung bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: If consciousness is not stunned in the womb, then at that time name-and-form does not arise.

original: dga' bo rnam par shes pa de gal te ma'i mngal du zhugs par ma gyur na ni /
analyzed: dga' bo rnam par shes pa de gal te ma'i mngal du zhugs par ma gyur na ni /
translated: Nanda, if that consciousness does not enter the mother’s womb,

original: de'i tshe nur nur po de nur nur po nyid du 'grub par mi 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe nur nur po de nur nur po nyid du 'grub par mi 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: then at that time, the kalala does not come into existence as a kalala.

original: de'i phyir de ltar na /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar na /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: ming dang gzugs ni chags gyur na //
analyzed: ming dang gzugs ni chags gyur na //
translated: When name-and-form is established,

original: skye mched drug ni 'byung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: skye mched drug ni 'byung bar 'gyur //
translated: the six sense bases arise.

original: sdug bsngal 'byung ba la skyed par byed pa nyid du gyur pa'i phyir //
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'byung ba la skyed par byed pa nyid du gyur pa'i phyir //
translated: The six sense bases arise from name-and-form, because they are the door of entry into suffering and the cause of suffering.

original: skye ba'i sgo'i dngos po nyid kyis na mig dang rna ba dang sna dang lce dang lus dang yid ces bya ba skye mched drug po ming dang gzugs kyi rgyu can skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skye ba'i sgo'i dngos po nyid kyis na mig dang rna ba dang sna dang lce dang lus dang yid ces bya ba skye mched drug po ming dang gzugs kyi rgyu can skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The six sense bases arise from name-and-form, which is their cause. The six sense bases are called the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and thinking-mind sense bases.

original: des mig gis gzugs rnams mthong nas yid bde ba'i gnas su mngon par zhen par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pas na /
analyzed: des mig gis gzugs rnams mthong nas yid bde ba'i gnas su mngon par zhen par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pas na /
translated: When the eye sees forms, it becomes attached to pleasant things.

original: skye mched drug ni sdug bsngal 'byung ba'i skye ba'i sgo nyid yin no de'i phyir de ltar skye mched drug 'byung ba yin dang / dus phyis /🔽skye mched drug la brten nas ni //
analyzed: skye mched drug ni sdug bsngal 'byung ba'i skye ba'i sgo nyid yin no de'i phyir de ltar skye mched drug 'byung ba yin dang / dus phyis / skye mched drug la brten nas ni //
translated: Therefore, the six sense spheres arise in that way.🔽Later,

original: reg pa yang dag 'byung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: reg pa yang dag 'byung bar 'gyur //
translated: Contact arises in dependence on the six sense spheres.

original: reg pa 'di yang gang zhig yin zhing /
analyzed: reg pa 'di yang gang zhig yin zhing /
translated: What is this contact?

original: ji ltar skye bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar skye bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How does it arise?

original: bstan pa'i phyir /🔽mig dang gzugs dang dran byed la //
analyzed: bstan pa'i phyir / mig dang gzugs dang dran byed la //
translated: In order to demonstrate this, it is said:

original: brten nas skye ba kho na ste //🔽de ltar mig gzugs brten nas ni //
analyzed: brten nas skye ba kho na ste // de ltar mig gzugs brten nas ni //
translated: Consciousness arises in dependence on the eye and form.

original: rnam par shes pa skye bar 'gyur //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa skye bar 'gyur //
translated: In this way, visual consciousness arises in dependence on the eye and form.

original: mig dang gzugs dang rnam par shes //
analyzed: mig dang gzugs dang rnam par shes //
translated: The eye, form, and consciousness,

original: gsum po 'dus pa gang yin pa //
analyzed: gsum po 'dus pa gang yin pa //
translated: whatever the three come together,

original: de ni reg pa'o //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de ni reg pa'o // zhes gsungs so //
translated: that is contact.

original: de la mig dang gzugs dag dang dran byed de /
analyzed: de la mig dang gzugs dag dang dran byed de /
translated: Here, the eye and form and the mental factor of recollection

original: yid la byed pa yul la sogs pa dang mi mthun pa rnam par shes pa'i sa bon du gyur pa mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa skye ba yin no //
analyzed: yid la byed pa yul la sogs pa dang mi mthun pa rnam par shes pa'i sa bon du gyur pa mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa skye ba yin no //
translated: The eye consciousness arises in dependence on the immediately preceding condition, which is the mental attention that is the seed of consciousness, and which is not in harmony with the object, etc.

original: de la mig dang gzugs kyi skye mched ni gzugs so //
analyzed: de la mig dang gzugs kyi skye mched ni gzugs so //
translated: Among these, the eye and form bases are form.

original: dran byed phung po bzhi'i mtshan nyid can ni ming ste /
analyzed: dran byed phung po bzhi'i mtshan nyid can ni ming ste /
translated: The mental attention is name, which has the characteristic of the four aggregates.

original: de'i phyir @183b gsum po 'di la brten nas skye ba'i mig gi rnam par shes pa de ni ming dang gzugs la brten nas skye ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir @183b gsum po 'di la brten nas skye ba'i mig gi rnam par shes pa de ni ming dang gzugs la brten nas skye ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, the eye consciousness that arises in dependence on these three is said to arise in dependence on name and form.

original: de'i phyir dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa gsum po 'di dag 'dus pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa gsum po 'di dag 'dus pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: Therefore, the coming together of these three—the faculty, the object, and the consciousness—

original: lhan cig skye zhing phan tshun phan 'dogs pas 'dra bar zhugs pa gang yin pa de ni reg pa'i mtshan nyid kyi reg pa'o //
analyzed: lhan cig skye zhing phan tshun phan 'dogs pas 'dra bar zhugs pa gang yin pa de ni reg pa'i mtshan nyid kyi reg pa'o //
translated: is contact, which has the characteristic of contact. It is contact because it is the coming together of the three, because it is the coming together of the object and the faculty, and because it is the coming together of the faculty and the consciousness.

original: de nas dus phyis /
analyzed: de nas dus phyis /
translated: Then, after that,

original: reg de las /
analyzed: reg de las /
translated: from that contact,

original: tshor ba kun du 'byung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: tshor ba kun du 'byung bar 'gyur //
translated: feeling arises.

original: yul yid du 'ong ba dang yid du mi 'ong ba dang gnyi ga las bzlog pa nyams su myong ba yul gyi myong ba rig pas na /
analyzed: yul yid du 'ong ba dang yid du mi 'ong ba dang gnyi ga las bzlog pa nyams su myong ba yul gyi myong ba rig pas na /
translated: The experience of the agreeable, disagreeable, and neither-agreeable-nor-disagreeable is the experience of the object.

original: tshor ba yin pa ni tshor ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: tshor ba yin pa ni tshor ba zhes bya ste /
translated: Feeling is the experience of the object.

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang / bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang / bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is threefold: agreeable, disagreeable, and neither-agreeable-nor-disagreeable.

original: gzugs dang rnam par shes pa dang / mig dang gsum po 'di dag 'dus pa'i mtshan nyid can reg pa la brten nas tshor ba yin par ji skad du bshad pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: gzugs dang rnam par shes pa dang / mig dang gsum po 'di dag 'dus pa'i mtshan nyid can reg pa la brten nas tshor ba yin par ji skad du bshad pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as it has been said that feeling is based on contact which has the nature of the union of the three, i.e., form, consciousness, and eye,

original: dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa lhag ma dag gsum 'dus pa'i mtshan nyid kyi reg pa'i rgyu can gyi tshor ba yang bshad par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa lhag ma dag gsum 'dus pa'i mtshan nyid kyi reg pa'i rgyu can gyi tshor ba yang bshad par rig par bya'o //
translated: so also should it be understood that feeling has contact for its cause, and that contact has the union of the three, i.e., faculty, object, and consciousness, for its nature.

original: de nas dus phyis /🔽tshor ba'i rkyen gyis sred pa ste //
analyzed: de nas dus phyis / tshor ba'i rkyen gyis sred pa ste //
translated: Then, later,🔽craving arises due to feeling.

original: kun du 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bsnyegs so //
analyzed: kun du 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bsnyegs so //
translated: It is said that craving arises due to feeling.

original: sred pa gang la tshor ba'i rkyen yod pa de ni tsho ba'i rkyen gyis so //
analyzed: sred pa gang la tshor ba'i rkyen yod pa de ni tsho ba'i rkyen gyis so //
translated: Craving that has a feeling as its object is due to the condition of feeling.

original: sred pa de yang ci'i yul can zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: sred pa de yang ci'i yul can zhig yin zhe na /
translated: What is the object of that craving?

original: tshor ba'i yul can nyid do //
analyzed: tshor ba'i yul can nyid do //
translated: It has feeling as its object.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang gi phyir sred pa can de //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sred pa can de //
translated: Because the one who is attached

original: tshor ba'i don du sred par 'gyur //
analyzed: tshor ba'i don du sred par 'gyur //
translated: craves for the sake of feeling.

original: tshor ba'i ched du mngon par 'dod pa skyed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: tshor ba'i ched du mngon par 'dod pa skyed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that he generates desire for the sake of feeling.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: re zhig gal te de la tshor ba bde ba skyes na ni de yang dang yang du de dang mi 'bral bar bya ba'i phyir sred par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: re zhig gal te de la tshor ba bde ba skyes na ni de yang dang yang du de dang mi 'bral bar bya ba'i phyir sred par 'gyur ro //
translated: If a pleasant feeling arises for him, then craving arises in order that he not be separated from that again and again.

original: ci ste sdug bsngal skyes na ni de'i tshe de dang bral bar bya ba'i phyir sred par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ci ste sdug bsngal skyes na ni de'i tshe de dang bral bar bya ba'i phyir sred par 'gyur ro //
translated: But if an unpleasant feeling arises, then craving arises in order to be separated from that.

original: 'on te bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa skyes na ni /
analyzed: 'on te bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa skyes na ni /
translated: But if a feeling that is neither pleasant nor unpleasant arises,

original: de mi nyams par bya ba'i phyir srid par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de mi nyams par bya ba'i phyir srid par 'gyur te /
translated: craving arises in order that it not disappear.

original: de ltar na tshor ba'i don du sred par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na tshor ba'i don du sred par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, there is craving for sensation.

original: de de ltar /
analyzed: de de ltar /
translated: In this way,

original: sred par 'gyur na nye bar len //
analyzed: sred par 'gyur na nye bar len //
translated: when there is craving, there is grasping,

original: rnam pa bzhi bo nyer len 'gyur //
analyzed: rnam pa bzhi bo nyer len 'gyur //
translated: which is of four kinds.

original: de ltar tshor ba dag la mngon par zhe na zhing chags pa de ni sred pa'i rkyen can las 'phel ba'i rgyu 'dod pa dang / lta ba dang @184a * //
analyzed: de ltar tshor ba dag la mngon par zhe na zhing chags pa de ni sred pa'i rkyen can las 'phel ba'i rgyu 'dod pa dang / lta ba dang @184a * //
translated: Thus, when one is attached to sensation and is desirous, there is the grasping of the four kinds of clinging, which are the cause for the increase of craving: clinging to sense-desire, clinging to views,

original: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs dang bdag tu smra ba zhes bya ba rnam pa bzhi po yongs su 'dzin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs dang bdag tu smra ba zhes bya ba rnam pa bzhi po yongs su 'dzin par 'gyur te /
translated: clinging to morality and asceticism, and clinging to a doctrine of self.

original: de ni de'i srid pa'i rkyen gyis len pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni de'i srid pa'i rkyen gyis len pa yin no //
translated: This is the grasping that is conditioned by craving.

original: de nas dus phyis /🔽nyer len yod na len pa po'i //
analyzed: de nas dus phyis / nyer len yod na len pa po'i //
translated: Then, later,🔽when there is grasping, the existence

original: srid pa rab tu 'byung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: srid pa rab tu 'byung bar 'gyur //
translated: of the grasper comes into being.

original: gal te nye bar len med na //
analyzed: gal te nye bar len med na //
translated: If there were no grasping,

original: grol bar 'gyur te srid mi 'gyur //
analyzed: grol bar 'gyur te srid mi 'gyur //
translated: there would be liberation, and no existence.

original: srid pa de yang phung po lnga //🔽nye bar len pa ji skad du bshad pa rnam pa bzhi'i len pa po ste /
analyzed: srid pa de yang phung po lnga // nye bar len pa ji skad du bshad pa rnam pa bzhi'i len pa po ste /
translated: This existence is the five aggregates.🔽The grasper is the one who produces the four kinds of grasping as they have been explained.

original: 'dzin pa po skyed par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'dzin pa po skyed par byed pa'o //
translated: He is the one who clings.

original: nye bar len pa po de'i nye bar len pa'i rkyen gyis srid pa skyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nye bar len pa po de'i nye bar len pa'i rkyen gyis srid pa skyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: Existence arises due to the condition of grasping of that appropriator.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang gi phyir gal te nye bar len pa po gang gis tshor ba la sred pa ma skyed cing /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gal te nye bar len pa po gang gis tshor ba la sred pa ma skyed cing /
translated: Because if the appropriator does not generate craving for feeling,

original: so sor rtog pa'i stobs kyis sred pa bdag gir ma byas par len pa rnam pa bzhi po spangs nas gnyis su med pa'i ye shes dri ma med pa mngon du byas pa las nye bar len pa med par gyur na ni /
analyzed: so sor rtog pa'i stobs kyis sred pa bdag gir ma byas par len pa rnam pa bzhi po spangs nas gnyis su med pa'i ye shes dri ma med pa mngon du byas pa las nye bar len pa med par gyur na ni /
translated: and does not take up craving through the power of discernment, having abandoned the four kinds of grasping, and has realized stainless non-dual wisdom, then grasping would not exist.

original: de grol bar 'gyur zhing de'i tshe de'i srid pa yod par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de grol bar 'gyur zhing de'i tshe de'i srid pa yod par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, he would be liberated, and at that time his existence would not occur.

original: sred pa de yang gang zhig ce na /
analyzed: sred pa de yang gang zhig ce na /
translated: What is that craving?

original: srid pa de yang phung po lnga ste /
analyzed: srid pa de yang phung po lnga ste /
translated: That existence is also the five aggregates.

original: gang zhig nye bar len pa las rab tu 'byung ba de ni phung po lnga'i rang bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gang zhig nye bar len pa las rab tu 'byung ba de ni phung po lnga'i rang bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that the one who goes forth from grasping has the nature of the five aggregates.

original: lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las rnam pa gsum char yang 'di las ma 'ongs pa'i phung po lnga 'byung bas na srid pa zhes bya bar bsnyad do //
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las rnam pa gsum char yang 'di las ma 'ongs pa'i phung po lnga 'byung bas na srid pa zhes bya bar bsnyad do //
translated: The three types of action of body, speech, and mind are called “existence” because the five aggregates of the future arise from them.

original: de la lus dang ngag gi las ni gzugs kyi phung po'i rang bzhin yin la /
analyzed: de la lus dang ngag gi las ni gzugs kyi phung po'i rang bzhin yin la /
translated: Among them, the actions of body and speech have the nature of the aggregate of form.

original: yid kyi las ni phung po lnga'i rang bzhin yin te /
analyzed: yid kyi las ni phung po lnga'i rang bzhin yin te /
translated: The action of mind has the nature of the five aggregates.

original: de ltar na srid pa de phung po lnga yin no zhes shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na srid pa de phung po lnga yin no zhes shes par bya'o //
translated: Thus, it should be understood that existence is the five aggregates.

original: srid pa de las skye ba 'byung ste /
analyzed: srid pa de las skye ba 'byung ste /
translated: Birth arises from that existence.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i phung po 'byung ba ni skye ba yin la /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i phung po 'byung ba ni skye ba yin la /
translated: The arising of the future aggregates is birth.

original: de yang srid pa las rab tu 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de yang srid pa las rab tu 'byung ngo //
translated: And that arises from existence.

original: de nas dus phyis //
analyzed: de nas dus phyis //
translated: Then, later,🔽aging, death, sorrow, lamentation,

original: rga shi dang ni mya ngan dang // smre sngags 'don bcas sdug bsngal dang / yid mi bde dang 'khrug pa rnams //🔽de dag skye las rab tu 'byung /
analyzed: rga shi dang ni mya ngan dang // smre sngags 'don bcas sdug bsngal dang / yid mi bde dang 'khrug pa rnams // de dag skye las rab tu 'byung /
translated: pain, grief, and despair🔽arise from birth.

original: skye ba'i rgyu can rga shi la sogs pa de dag 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skye ba'i rgyu can rga shi la sogs pa de dag 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Those things beginning with aging and death arise with birth as their cause.

original: de dag gi bshad pa ni mdo ji lta ba bzhin rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de dag gi bshad pa ni mdo ji lta ba bzhin rig par bya ste /
translated: The explanation of these should be understood according to the sutra.

original: de la rga ba ni phung po yongs su smin pa'o //🔽'chi ba ni rgas pa'i phung po 'jig pa'o //
analyzed: de la rga ba ni phung po yongs su smin pa'o // 'chi ba ni rgas pa'i phung po 'jig pa'o //
translated: Here, aging is the maturation of the aggregates.🔽Death is the destruction of the aggregates that have aged.

original: mya ngan ni 'gro zhing 'chi bzhin pa'i kun du rmongs pa'i mngon @184b par chags pa dang bcas pa'i snying gi gdung ba'o //
analyzed: mya ngan ni 'gro zhing 'chi bzhin pa'i kun du rmongs pa'i mngon @184b par chags pa dang bcas pa'i snying gi gdung ba'o //
translated: Sorrow is the mental anguish of one who is confused and attached to going and death.

original: smre sngags 'don pa ni mya ngan gyis kun nas bslang pa'i ngag gi brjod pa'o //
analyzed: smre sngags 'don pa ni mya ngan gyis kun nas bslang pa'i ngag gi brjod pa'o //
translated: Lamentation is the expression of sorrow in speech.

original: sdug bsngal ni dbang po lnga la gnod ba'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ni dbang po lnga la gnod ba'o //
translated: Suffering is the harm to the five senses.

original: yid mi bde ba ni yid du mi 'ong ba 'bab pa'o //
analyzed: yid mi bde ba ni yid du mi 'ong ba 'bab pa'o //
translated: Mental unhappiness is the descent of what is unpleasant.

original: 'khrug pa ni sdug bsngal ba dang yid mi bde ba mang po 'byung ba'o zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'khrug pa ni sdug bsngal ba dang yid mi bde ba mang po 'byung ba'o zhes bya'o //
translated: Distress is the occurrence of much suffering and mental unhappiness.

original: de'i phyir de ltar ji skad bshad pa'i tshul gyis //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar ji skad bshad pa'i tshul gyis //
translated: Therefore, in this way, as it has been explained,

original: da ltar sdug bsngal phung po ni //
analyzed: da ltar sdug bsngal phung po ni //
translated: this mass of suffering

original: 'ba' zhig po 'di 'byung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: 'ba' zhig po 'di 'byung bar 'gyur //
translated: will arise.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang rkyen tsam gyi stobs kyis zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang rkyen tsam gyi stobs kyis zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Thus means by the power of mere causes and conditions.

original: sdug bsngal phung po ni zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal gyi tshogs dang khyu ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal phung po ni zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal gyi tshogs dang khyu ste /
translated: The mass of suffering means the collection and heap of suffering.

original: sdug bsngal spungs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sdug bsngal spungs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means the heap of suffering.

original: 'ba' zhig pa zhes bya ba ni bdag dang bdag gi ba'i rang bzhin dang bral ba zhes bya ba'i don dang / byis pa'i skye bos brtags pa tsam sdug bsngal gyi bdag nyid bde ba dang ma 'dres bzhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'ba' zhig pa zhes bya ba ni bdag dang bdag gi ba'i rang bzhin dang bral ba zhes bya ba'i don dang / byis pa'i skye bos brtags pa tsam sdug bsngal gyi bdag nyid bde ba dang ma 'dres bzhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Only means that it is devoid of the nature of self and what belongs to self, and it means that it is the mere imputation of childish beings, the nature of suffering that is not mixed with pleasure.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar ma rig pa la sogs pa las srid pa'i yan lag rnams 'byung ba de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar ma rig pa la sogs pa las srid pa'i yan lag rnams 'byung ba de'i phyir /
translated: Since the limbs of existence arise from ignorance and so on,

original: 'khor ba'i rtsa ba 'du byed de //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i rtsa ba 'du byed de //
translated: the root of samsara is formation.

original: de phyir mkhas rnams 'du mi byed //
analyzed: de phyir mkhas rnams 'du mi byed //
translated: Therefore the wise do not form.

original: de phyir mi mkhas byed po yin //
analyzed: de phyir mi mkhas byed po yin //
translated: Therefore the unwise are agents.

original: mkhas pas de nyid mthong phyir ro //
analyzed: mkhas pas de nyid mthong phyir ro //
translated: Because the wise see reality.

original: de la 'khor ba rnam par shes pa la sogs pa 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi rtsa ba ste /
analyzed: de la 'khor ba rnam par shes pa la sogs pa 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi rtsa ba ste /
translated: The root of samsara is the formative forces,

original: rgyu'i gtso bo ni 'du byed rnams yin te /
analyzed: rgyu'i gtso bo ni 'du byed rnams yin te /
translated: which are the principal cause of the characteristics of the consciousnesses and so on.

original: de'i phyir mi mkhas pa ni 'khor ba'i rtsa ba 'du byed rnams 'du byed de /🔽dge slong dag ma rig pa dang rjes su 'brel bar skyes bu gang zag ni bsod rnams mngon par 'du bya ba yang mngon par 'du byed do //🔽bsod nams ma yin pa mngon par 'du bya ba yang mngon par 'du byed do //
analyzed: de'i phyir mi mkhas pa ni 'khor ba'i rtsa ba 'du byed rnams 'du byed de / dge slong dag ma rig pa dang rjes su 'brel bar skyes bu gang zag ni bsod rnams mngon par 'du bya ba yang mngon par 'du byed do // bsod nams ma yin pa mngon par 'du bya ba yang mngon par 'du byed do //
translated: Thus, the unwise are the formative forces, the root of samsara.🔽The Bhagavan has said, “Monks, the person who is born in connection with ignorance also forms merit,🔽also forms demerit,

original: mi g-yo ba mngon par 'du bya ba yang mngon par 'du byed do zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi g-yo ba mngon par 'du bya ba yang mngon par 'du byed do zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: also forms the stable formative forces.”

original: gang gi phyir de ltar na ;🔽mi mkhas pa byed pa po yin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar na ; mi mkhas pa byed pa po yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: Therefore,🔽the unwise are the agents.

original: ma rig pa dang ldan pa'i gang zag kho na 'du byed rnams kyi byed pa por 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: ma rig pa dang ldan pa'i gang zag kho na 'du byed rnams kyi byed pa por 'gyur gyi /
translated: Thus, only the person who possesses ignorance is the agent of the formative forces.

original: mkhas pa de nyid mthong ba ma rig pa spangs pa de ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mkhas pa de nyid mthong ba ma rig pa spangs pa de ni ma yin no //
translated: The wise one who sees reality does not abandon ignorance.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de nyid mthong phyir ro ste de nyid mthong na ni dngos po @185a * //🔽thams cad mi dmigs pas gang la dmigs nas las byed par 'gyur ba de /
analyzed: de nyid mthong phyir ro ste de nyid mthong na ni dngos po @185a * // thams cad mi dmigs pas gang la dmigs nas las byed par 'gyur ba de /
translated: Because of seeing reality. When reality is seen, all things are not observed.

original: cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, since there is nothing at all that could be the object of action,

original: de'i phyir de nyid mthong ba'i phyir mkhas pa byed pa po ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de nyid mthong ba'i phyir mkhas pa byed pa po ma yin no //
translated: the wise one is not an agent because of seeing reality.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar ma rig pa yod na 'du byed rnams 'byung la med na mi 'byung ba de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar ma rig pa yod na 'du byed rnams 'byung la med na mi 'byung ba de'i phyir /
translated: Since formations occur when ignorance exists and do not occur when it does not exist,

original: ma rig 'gags par gyur na ni //
analyzed: ma rig 'gags par gyur na ni //
translated: when ignorance ceases,

original: 'du byed rnams kun 'byung mi 'gyur te //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams kun 'byung mi 'gyur te //
translated: the origin of formations does not occur.

original: rgyu ma tshang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu ma tshang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the cause is incomplete.

original: ma rig pa de gang las 'gag par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ma rig pa de gang las 'gag par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: From what does that ignorance cease?

original: ma rig 'gags par gyur na ni //
analyzed: ma rig 'gags par gyur na ni //
translated: When ignorance ceases,

original: shes pas de nyid bsgoms pas so //
analyzed: shes pas de nyid bsgoms pas so //
translated: it ceases through the cultivation of wisdom.

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba de nyid phyin ci ma log pa ji lta ba bzhin bsgoms pas ma rig pa rab tu spong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba de nyid phyin ci ma log pa ji lta ba bzhin bsgoms pas ma rig pa rab tu spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By cultivating dependent origination itself, without error, just as it is, ignorance is completely abandoned.

original: 'di ltar gang gis rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yang dag par mthong ba des ni dngos po phra mo'i yang rang gi ngo bo dmigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang gis rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yang dag par mthong ba des ni dngos po phra mo'i yang rang gi ngo bo dmigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Thus, one who sees dependent origination correctly does not observe the nature of even the most subtle thing.

original: gzugs brnyan ltar dngos po rnams rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid du 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan ltar dngos po rnams rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid du 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: Like a reflection, one enters into the emptiness of inherent nature of things.

original: de de ltar dngos po thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid du zhugs pas chos cung zad kyang dmigs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de de ltar dngos po thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid du zhugs pas chos cung zad kyang dmigs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: In that way, one who has entered into the emptiness of inherent nature of all things does not observe even the slightest phenomenon.

original: de ma dmigs pas 'gar yang mi rmongs so //
analyzed: de ma dmigs pas 'gar yang mi rmongs so //
translated: Since one does not observe that, one is not confused about anything.

original: ma rmongs pas las mi byed do //
analyzed: ma rmongs pas las mi byed do //
translated: Since one is not confused, one does not create karma.

original: de ltar na rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba bsgoms pas de kho na nyid la 'jug par 'gyur la /
analyzed: de ltar na rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba bsgoms pas de kho na nyid la 'jug par 'gyur la /
translated: Thus, by cultivating dependent origination, one enters into reality.

original: de nyid mthong ba'i rnal 'byor pa'i ma rig pa nges par spong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid mthong ba'i rnal 'byor pa'i ma rig pa nges par spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The ignorance of the yogi who sees reality is definitely abandoned.

original: ma rig pa spangs pas 'du byed 'gag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma rig pa spangs pas 'du byed 'gag par 'gyur ro //
translated: Through the abandonment of ignorance, the formative forces cease.

original: de ltar ma rig pa 'gags pas 'du byed rnams ji ltar 'gag pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: de ltar ma rig pa 'gags pas 'du byed rnams ji ltar 'gag pa de bzhin du /
translated: In this way, through the cessation of ignorance, the formative forces cease.

original: de dang de ni 'gags gyur pas //
analyzed: de dang de ni 'gags gyur pas //
translated: Through the cessation of that and that,

original: de dang de ni mngon mi 'byung //
analyzed: de dang de ni mngon mi 'byung //
translated: that and that will not manifest.

original: sdug bsngal phung po 'ba' zhig po //
analyzed: sdug bsngal phung po 'ba' zhig po //
translated: The mass of suffering,

original: de ni de ltar yang dag 'gag //
analyzed: de ni de ltar yang dag 'gag //
translated: it ceases in this way.

original: yan lag snga ma snga ma 'gags pas yan lag phyi ma phyi ma 'gag par 'gyur ro zhes shes par bya'o //
analyzed: yan lag snga ma snga ma 'gags pas yan lag phyi ma phyi ma 'gag par 'gyur ro zhes shes par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that through the cessation of the former members, the latter members cease.

original: rim pa 'dis ni rnal 'byor ba'i sdug bsngal gyi phung po sdug bsngal gyi tshogs bdag dang bdag gi ba la sogs pa yang dag pa ma yin par lta ba dang bral ba /
analyzed: rim pa 'dis ni rnal 'byor ba'i sdug bsngal gyi phung po sdug bsngal gyi tshogs bdag dang bdag gi ba la sogs pa yang dag pa ma yin par lta ba dang bral ba /
translated: Through this process, the mass of suffering of the yogi, the mass of suffering, free from the view of the unreal, such as the self and what belongs to the self,

original: byed pa po dang tshor ba po dang bral ba rang bzhin gyis stong pa slar mi 'byung bas yang dag par 'gag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byed pa po dang tshor ba po dang bral ba rang bzhin gyis stong pa slar mi 'byung bas yang dag par 'gag par 'gyur ro //
translated: free from the agent and the experiencer, empty of intrinsic nature, ceases completely, not arising again.

original: ji @185b skad du 'phags pa s'a lu ljang pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: ji @185b skad du 'phags pa s'a lu ljang pa'i mdo las /
translated: As the noble Sūtra on the Wise and the Foolish says,

original: de bzhin du nang gi rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba gnyis kyi phyir 'byung ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du nang gi rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba gnyis kyi phyir 'byung ste /
translated: In the same way, the inner dependent origination occurs in two ways.

original: gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: What are the two?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are

original: rgyu dang 'brel ba dang rkyen dang 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'brel ba dang rkyen dang 'brel pa'o //
translated: the connection with causes and the connection with conditions.

original: de la nang gi rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba rgyu dang 'brel bar 'byung ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la nang gi rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba rgyu dang 'brel bar 'byung ba gang zhe na /
translated: In this case, what is the inner dependent origination that occurs through the connection with causes?

original: gang 'di ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams /
analyzed: gang 'di ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams /
translated: It is this: with ignorance as condition, there are volitions;

original: 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa /
translated: with volitions as condition, consciousness;

original: rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs /
translated: with consciousness as condition, name and form;🔽with name and form as condition, the six sense spheres;

original: ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis skye mched drug / skye mched drug gi rkyen gyis reg pa /🔽reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba /
analyzed: ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis skye mched drug / skye mched drug gi rkyen gyis reg pa / reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba /
translated: with the six sense spheres as condition, contact;🔽with contact as condition, feeling;

original: tshor ba'i rkyen gyis sred pa /
analyzed: tshor ba'i rkyen gyis sred pa /
translated: with feeling as condition, craving;

original: sred pa'i rkyen gyis len pa /
analyzed: sred pa'i rkyen gyis len pa /
translated: with craving as condition, grasping;

original: len pa'i rkyen gyis srid pa /
analyzed: len pa'i rkyen gyis srid pa /
translated: with grasping as condition, existence;

original: srid pa'i rkyen gyis skye ba /
analyzed: srid pa'i rkyen gyis skye ba /
translated: with existence as condition, birth;

original: skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi dang mya ngan dang smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa rnams 'byung ste /
analyzed: skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi dang mya ngan dang smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa rnams 'byung ste /
translated: Due to the condition of birth, aging, death, grief, lamentation, pain, sorrow, and despair

original: de ltar na sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po 'ba' zhig po 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po 'ba' zhig po 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: arise. Thus, the arising of this entire great mass of suffering occurs.

original: gal te ma rig pa ma byung na 'du byed rnams kyang mi mngon pa zhig go //
analyzed: gal te ma rig pa ma byung na 'du byed rnams kyang mi mngon pa zhig go //
translated: If ignorance did not exist, then the formations would not become manifest.

original: de bzhin du skye ba ma byung du zin na rga shi'i bar du mi mngon pa zhig na /
analyzed: de bzhin du skye ba ma byung du zin na rga shi'i bar du mi mngon pa zhig na /
translated: Similarly, if birth did not exist, then aging and so on would not become manifest.

original: 'on kyang ma rig pa yod pa las 'du byed rnams mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ba nas /
analyzed: 'on kyang ma rig pa yod pa las 'du byed rnams mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ba nas /
translated: However, due to the existence of ignorance, the formations become manifest.

original: de bzhin du skye ba yod pa las rga shi'i bar du mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du skye ba yod pa las rga shi'i bar du mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Similarly, due to the existence of birth, aging and so on become manifest.

original: de la yang ma rig pa yang 'di snyam du bdag gis 'du byed rnams mngon par sgrub po snyam du mi sems so //
analyzed: de la yang ma rig pa yang 'di snyam du bdag gis 'du byed rnams mngon par sgrub po snyam du mi sems so //
translated: Moreover, ignorance does not think, “I will bring about the formations.”

original: 'du byed rnams kyang 'di snyam du bdag cag ni ma rig pas mngon par sgrub po snyam du mi sems pa nas de bzhin du skye ba yang 'di snyam du bdag gis rga shi mngon par sgrub po snyam du mi sems shing /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams kyang 'di snyam du bdag cag ni ma rig pas mngon par sgrub po snyam du mi sems pa nas de bzhin du skye ba yang 'di snyam du bdag gis rga shi mngon par sgrub po snyam du mi sems shing /
translated: Formations do not think, “I am actualized by ignorance,” and so on up to birth not thinking, “I actualize aging and death,”

original: rga shi yang 'di snyam du bdag ni skye bas mngon par bsgrubs so snyam du mi sems pa'i bar du ste /
analyzed: rga shi yang 'di snyam du bdag ni skye bas mngon par bsgrubs so snyam du mi sems pa'i bar du ste /
translated: and aging and death not thinking, “I am actualized by birth.”

original: 'on kyang ma rig pa yod pa las 'du byed rnams mngon par sgrub pa'i 'byung bar 'gyur ba nas /
analyzed: 'on kyang ma rig pa yod pa las 'du byed rnams mngon par sgrub pa'i 'byung bar 'gyur ba nas /
translated: However, from the existence of ignorance, the actualization of formations occurs,

original: de bzhin du skye ba yod pa las rga shi'i bar du mngon par sgrub cing 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin du skye ba yod pa las rga shi'i bar du mngon par sgrub cing 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: and similarly, from the existence of birth, aging and so on are actualized and occur.

original: de ltar na nang gi rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba rgyu dang 'brel bar blta'o //🔽nang gi rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba rkyen dang @186a * //
analyzed: de ltar na nang gi rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba rgyu dang 'brel bar blta'o // nang gi rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba rkyen dang @186a * //
translated: Thus one should view internal dependent origination in terms of its relation to causes.

original: 'brel bar ji ltar ba lta zhe na /
analyzed: 'brel bar ji ltar ba lta zhe na /
translated: How should one view internal dependent origination in terms of its relation to conditions?

original: khams drug 'dus pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: khams drug 'dus pa'i phyir te /
translated: It is the coming together of the six elements.

original: khams drug po gang dag 'dus pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: khams drug po gang dag 'dus pa yin zhe na /
translated: What is the union of the six elements?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: sa dang chu dang me dang rlung dang nam mkha' dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams 'dus pa las nang gi rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba rkyen dang 'brel bar blta'o //
analyzed: sa dang chu dang me dang rlung dang nam mkha' dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams 'dus pa las nang gi rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba rkyen dang 'brel bar blta'o //
translated: The union of the earth element, the water element, the fire element, the wind element, the space element, and the consciousness element is to be seen as the internal dependent origination in terms of its connection with conditions.

original: de la nang gi rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i sa'i khams gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la nang gi rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i sa'i khams gang zhe na /
translated: What is the earth element in the internal dependent origination?

original: gang 'di 'dus nas lus kyi sra ba'i dngos po mngon par grub par byed pa 'di ni sa'i khams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang 'di 'dus nas lus kyi sra ba'i dngos po mngon par grub par byed pa 'di ni sa'i khams zhes bya'o //
translated: It is that which, having come together, establishes the solidity of the body. This is called the earth element.

original: gang lus sdud pa'i bya ba byed pa 'di ni chu'i khams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang lus sdud pa'i bya ba byed pa 'di ni chu'i khams zhes bya'o //
translated: It is that which, having come together, establishes the cohesion of the body. This is called the water element.

original: gang lus kyi zos pa dang 'thungs pa dang 'chos pa dang myangs pa rnams 'ju bar byed pa 'di ni me'i khams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang lus kyi zos pa dang 'thungs pa dang 'chos pa dang myangs pa rnams 'ju bar byed pa 'di ni me'i khams zhes bya'o //
translated: It is that which, having come together, establishes the heat in the body. This is called the fire element.

original: gang lus kyi dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba'i bya ba byed pa de ni rlung gi khams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang lus kyi dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba'i bya ba byed pa de ni rlung gi khams zhes bya'o //
translated: It is that which, having come together, establishes the movement in the body. This is called the wind element.

original: gang lus kyi nang sbubs yod par byed pa 'di ni nam mkha'i khams zhes bya'o //
