analyzed: gang lus kyi nang sbubs yod par byed pa 'di ni nam mkha'i khams zhes bya'o //
translated: The one that makes the interior of the body hollow is called the space element.

original: gang mdung khyim gyi tshul du ming dang gzugs mngon par 'grub par byed pa rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga 'dus pa dang / zag pa dang bcas pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'di ni rnam par shes pa'i khams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang mdung khyim gyi tshul du ming dang gzugs mngon par 'grub par byed pa rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga 'dus pa dang / zag pa dang bcas pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'di ni rnam par shes pa'i khams zhes bya'o //
translated: The one that establishes name-and-form in the manner of a spear and shield is the five collections of consciousness together with the defiled mental consciousness. This is called the consciousness element.

original: rkyen de dag med par lus skye bar mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: rkyen de dag med par lus skye bar mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: Without these conditions, the body would not come into being.

original: nang gi sa'i khams tshang zhing /
analyzed: nang gi sa'i khams tshang zhing /
translated: The internal earth element is complete.

original: de bzhin du sa dang chu dang me dang rlung dang nam mkha' dang rnam par shes pa'i khams rnams kyang tshang bar gyur la /
analyzed: de bzhin du sa dang chu dang me dang rlung dang nam mkha' dang rnam par shes pa'i khams rnams kyang tshang bar gyur la /
translated: Likewise, the elements of water, fire, wind, space, and consciousness are complete.

original: thams cad 'dus pa de las lus mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thams cad 'dus pa de las lus mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: From the coming together of all of them, the body comes into being.

original: de la sa'i khams kyang 'di snyam du bdag gis 'dus nas lus kyi sra ba'i dngos po mngon par sgrub po snyam du mi sems so //
analyzed: de la sa'i khams kyang 'di snyam du bdag gis 'dus nas lus kyi sra ba'i dngos po mngon par sgrub po snyam du mi sems so //
translated: The earth element does not think, “I make the body’s solidity manifest by gathering together.”

original: chu'i khams kyang 'di snyam du bdag gis lus kyi sdud pa'i bya ba bya'o snyam du mi dmigs so //
analyzed: chu'i khams kyang 'di snyam du bdag gis lus kyi sdud pa'i bya ba bya'o snyam du mi dmigs so //
translated: The water element does not think, “I condense the body.”

original: me'i khams kyang 'di snyam du bdag gis lus kyi zos pa dang 'thungs pa dang 'chos pa dang myangs ba rnams 'ju bar bya'o snyam du mi sems so //🔽rlung gi khams kyang 'di snyam du bdag gis lus kyi dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba'i bya ba bya'o snyam du mi sems so //
analyzed: me'i khams kyang 'di snyam du bdag gis lus kyi zos pa dang 'thungs pa dang 'chos pa dang myangs ba rnams 'ju bar bya'o snyam du mi sems so // rlung gi khams kyang 'di snyam du bdag gis lus kyi dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba'i bya ba bya'o snyam du mi sems so //
translated: The fire element does not think, “I digest the food and drink of this body.”🔽The wind element does not think, “I make the in- and out-breaths of this body.”

original: nam mkha'i khams kyang 'di snyam du bdag gis lus kyi nang sbubs yod par bya'o snyam du mi sems so //
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams kyang 'di snyam du bdag gis lus kyi nang sbubs yod par bya'o snyam du mi sems so //
translated: The space element does not think, “I make the body hollow inside.”

original: rnam par @186b shes pa'i khams kyang 'di snyam du bdag gis lus kyi ming dang gzugs mngon par sgrub po snyam du mi sems so //
analyzed: rnam par @186b shes pa'i khams kyang 'di snyam du bdag gis lus kyi ming dang gzugs mngon par sgrub po snyam du mi sems so //
translated: The consciousness element does not think, “I establishes the name-and-form of this body.”

original: lus kyang 'di snyam du bdag ni rkyen 'di dag gis bskyed do snyam du mi sems mod kyi /
analyzed: lus kyang 'di snyam du bdag ni rkyen 'di dag gis bskyed do snyam du mi sems mod kyi /
translated: And the body does not think, “I am produced by these conditions.”

original: 'on kyang rkyen 'di dag yod na lus skye bar 'gyur ro //🔽de la sa'i khams ni bdag ma yin sems can ma yin srog ma yin skye ba po ma yin shed las skyes pa ma yin /🔽shed bu ma yin /🔽bud med ma yin /🔽skyes pa ma yin /
analyzed: 'on kyang rkyen 'di dag yod na lus skye bar 'gyur ro // de la sa'i khams ni bdag ma yin sems can ma yin srog ma yin skye ba po ma yin shed las skyes pa ma yin / shed bu ma yin / bud med ma yin / skyes pa ma yin /
translated: But when these conditions are present, the body comes into being.

original: ma ning ma yin /🔽nga'i ma yin /🔽bdag gi ma yin te /🔽gzhan su'i yang ma yin no //🔽de bzhin du chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams dang / nam mkha'i khams dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams kyang bdag ma yin /🔽sems can ma yin /🔽srog ma yin /🔽skye ba po ma yin /
analyzed: ma ning ma yin / nga'i ma yin / bdag gi ma yin te / gzhan su'i yang ma yin no // de bzhin du chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams dang / nam mkha'i khams dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams kyang bdag ma yin / sems can ma yin / srog ma yin / skye ba po ma yin /
translated: “Now, the earth element is not a self, not a sentient being, not a life-force, not a living being, not human, not a person, not female, not male, not neuter, not me, not mine, and not anyone else’s.

original: shed las skyes ma yin /🔽shed bu ma yin /🔽bud med ma yin /🔽skyes pa ma yin /🔽ma ning ma yin /🔽nga ma yin /🔽bdag gi ma yin /🔽gzhan su'i yang ma yin no //
analyzed: shed las skyes ma yin / shed bu ma yin / bud med ma yin / skyes pa ma yin / ma ning ma yin / nga ma yin / bdag gi ma yin / gzhan su'i yang ma yin no //
translated: The water element, the fire element, the wind element, the space element, and the consciousness element are not a self, not a sentient being, not a life-force, not a living being, not human, not a person, not female, not male, not neuter, not me, not mine, and not anyone else’s.

original: de la ma rig pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la ma rig pa gang zhe na /
translated: “Now, what is ignorance?

original: khams drug po 'di dag nyid la gang gcig pur 'du shes pa dang / ril por 'du shes pa dang / rtag par 'du shes pa dang / brtan par 'du shes pa dang / ther zug tu 'du shes pa dang / bde bar 'du shes pa dang /
analyzed: khams drug po 'di dag nyid la gang gcig pur 'du shes pa dang / ril por 'du shes pa dang / rtag par 'du shes pa dang / brtan par 'du shes pa dang / ther zug tu 'du shes pa dang / bde bar 'du shes pa dang /
translated: In these six elements, there is the perception of a single entity, the perception of a whole, the perception of permanence, the perception of stability, the perception of eternalism, the perception of pleasure,

original: bdag tu 'du shes pa dang / sems can du 'du shes pa dang / srog tu 'du shes pa dang / skye ba po dang / gso ba dang / skyes bu dang / gang zag tu 'du shes pa dang / shed las skyes pa dang /
analyzed: bdag tu 'du shes pa dang / sems can du 'du shes pa dang / srog tu 'du shes pa dang / skye ba po dang / gso ba dang / skyes bu dang / gang zag tu 'du shes pa dang / shed las skyes pa dang /
translated: the perception of self, the perception of a sentient being, the perception of a life-force, the perception of a human being, the perception of a person, the perception of a human,

original: shed bur 'du shes pa dang / nga zhes bya ba dang / bdag go zhes bya bar 'du shes pa ste /
analyzed: shed bur 'du shes pa dang / nga zhes bya ba dang / bdag go zhes bya bar 'du shes pa ste /
translated: the perception of a human offspring, the perception of “I am,” and the perception of “mine.”

original: 'di lta bu la sogs pa mi shes pa rnam pa sna tshogs pa 'di ni ma rig pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di lta bu la sogs pa mi shes pa rnam pa sna tshogs pa 'di ni ma rig pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Such various kinds of ignorance are called “ignorance.”

original: de ltar ma rig pa yod pas yul rnams la 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug 'jug ste /
analyzed: de ltar ma rig pa yod pas yul rnams la 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug 'jug ste /
translated: “Thus, because of the existence of ignorance, attachment, aversion, and delusion arise in relation to objects.

original: de la yul rnams la 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gang yin pa 'di ni ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la yul rnams la 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gang yin pa 'di ni ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes bya'o //
translated: The desire, hatred, and delusion with regard to those objects are called “the formations with ignorance as a condition.”

original: dngos po so sor rnam par rig pa ni rnam par shes pa'o //🔽rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig 'byung ba gzugs can ma yin pa nye bar len pa'i phung @187a * //
analyzed: dngos po so sor rnam par rig pa ni rnam par shes pa'o // rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig 'byung ba gzugs can ma yin pa nye bar len pa'i phung @187a * //
translated: The individual cognition of things is consciousness.

original: po bzhi po de dag ni ming yin la /
analyzed: po bzhi po de dag ni ming yin la /
translated: The four formless aggregates that arise simultaneously with consciousness are called “name.”

original: 'byung ba chen po bzhi dang / de dag rgyur byas pa ni gzugs te /
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po bzhi dang / de dag rgyur byas pa ni gzugs te /
translated: The four great elements and the form derived from them are called “form.”

original: ming de dang gzugs de gcig tu bsdus pa de ni ming dang gzugs so //
analyzed: ming de dang gzugs de gcig tu bsdus pa de ni ming dang gzugs so //
translated: Name and form together are called “name-and-form.”

original: ming dang gzugs la brten pa'i dbang po rnams ni skye mched drug go //
analyzed: ming dang gzugs la brten pa'i dbang po rnams ni skye mched drug go //
translated: The faculties that are based on name-and-form are the six sense spheres.

original: gsum 'dus pa ni reg pa'o //
analyzed: gsum 'dus pa ni reg pa'o //
translated: The coming together of the three is contact.

original: reg pa myong ba ni tshor ba'o //
analyzed: reg pa myong ba ni tshor ba'o //
translated: The experience of contact is feeling.

original: tshor ba la zhen pa ni sred pa'o //
analyzed: tshor ba la zhen pa ni sred pa'o //
translated: Craving is attachment to feeling.

original: sred pa'i 'phel ba ni len pa'o //
analyzed: sred pa'i 'phel ba ni len pa'o //
translated: The increase of craving is grasping.

original: len pa las skyes pa yang srid pa skyed pa'i las ni srid pa'o //
analyzed: len pa las skyes pa yang srid pa skyed pa'i las ni srid pa'o //
translated: The action that produces a new existence from grasping is becoming.

original: rgyu de las phung po byung ba ni skye ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu de las phung po byung ba ni skye ba'o //
translated: From that cause, the arising of the aggregates is birth.

original: skyes nas phung po smin pa ni rga ba'o //🔽rgas nas phung po 'jig pa ni 'chi ba'o //
analyzed: skyes nas phung po smin pa ni rga ba'o // rgas nas phung po 'jig pa ni 'chi ba'o //
translated: The ripening of the aggregates that have arisen is aging.🔽The destruction of the aggregates that have aged is death.

original: 'chi zhing myos te mngon par chags pa dang bcas pa'i nang gi yongs su gdung ba ni mya ngan no //
analyzed: 'chi zhing myos te mngon par chags pa dang bcas pa'i nang gi yongs su gdung ba ni mya ngan no //
translated: The inner burning of one who is dying, confused, and attached is sorrow.

original: mya ngan las byung ba'i tshig tu smra ba ni smre sngags 'don pa'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las byung ba'i tshig tu smra ba ni smre sngags 'don pa'o //
translated: The words that arise from sorrow are lamentation.

original: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i yid mi bde ba myong ba ni sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i yid mi bde ba myong ba ni sdug bsngal lo //
translated: The mental dissatisfaction that is associated with the five collections of consciousness is suffering.

original: yid dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i yid kyi sdug bsngal ni yid mi bde ba'o //
analyzed: yid dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i yid kyi sdug bsngal ni yid mi bde ba'o //
translated: The mental suffering that is associated with the mind is sorrow.

original: gzhan yang 'di lta bu la sogs pa nye ba'i nyon mongs pa gang yin pa de dag ni 'khrug pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang 'di lta bu la sogs pa nye ba'i nyon mongs pa gang yin pa de dag ni 'khrug pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Moreover, the secondary mental afflictions that are like these are called “disturbances.”

original: de la mun pa chen po'i phyir ma rig pa'o //
analyzed: de la mun pa chen po'i phyir ma rig pa'o //
translated: Regarding that, there is ignorance because of great darkness.

original: mngon par 'du byed pa'i phyir 'du byed rnams so //
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed pa'i phyir 'du byed rnams so //
translated: There are formations because of activity.

original: rnam par rig pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rig pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: Consciousness is so called because it cognizes.

original: phan tshun brten pa'i phyir ming dang gzugs so //
analyzed: phan tshun brten pa'i phyir ming dang gzugs so //
translated: Name-and-form is so called because they mutually support each other.

original: skye ba'i sgo'i phyir skye mched drug go //
analyzed: skye ba'i sgo'i phyir skye mched drug go //
translated: The six sense bases are so called because they are the doors of entry into rebirth.

original: reg pa'i phyir reg pa'o //
analyzed: reg pa'i phyir reg pa'o //
translated: Contact is so called because it touches.

original: myong ba'i phyir tshor ba'o //
analyzed: myong ba'i phyir tshor ba'o //
translated: Sensation is so called because it is felt.

original: skom pa'i phyir sred pa'o //
analyzed: skom pa'i phyir sred pa'o //
translated: Craving is so called because it thirsts.

original: nye bar len pa'i phyir len pa'o //🔽yang srid pa skyed pa'i phyir srid pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i phyir len pa'o // yang srid pa skyed pa'i phyir srid pa'o //
translated: Grasping is so called because it grasps.🔽Becoming is so called because it generates a new existence.

original: phung po 'byung ba'i phyir skye ba'o //
analyzed: phung po 'byung ba'i phyir skye ba'o //
translated: Birth is so called because it is the origin of the aggregates.

original: phung po smin pa'i phyir rga ba'o //
analyzed: phung po smin pa'i phyir rga ba'o //
translated: Aging is so called because it ripens the aggregates.

original: 'jig pa'i phyir 'chi ba'o //
analyzed: 'jig pa'i phyir 'chi ba'o //
translated: Death is so called because it destroys.

original: mya ngan byed pa'i phyir mya ngan no //
analyzed: mya ngan byed pa'i phyir mya ngan no //
translated: Sorrow is so called because it grieves.

original: tshig gis smra ba'i phyir smre sngags 'don pa'o //
analyzed: tshig gis smra ba'i phyir smre sngags 'don pa'o //
translated: Lamentation is so called because it speaks with words.

original: lus la gnod pa'i phyir sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: lus la gnod pa'i phyir sdug bsngal lo //
translated: Suffering is so called because it harms the body.

original: sems la gnod pa'i phyir yid mi bde ba'o //
analyzed: sems la gnod pa'i phyir yid mi bde ba'o //
translated: Mental dissatisfaction is so called because it harms the mind.

original: nyon mongs pa'i phyir 'khrug pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i phyir 'khrug pa'o //
translated: Distress is so called because it afflicts.

original: yang na de kho na nyid mi rtogs shing log par shes te mi shes pa ni ma rig pa'o //
analyzed: yang na de kho na nyid mi rtogs shing log par shes te mi shes pa ni ma rig pa'o //
translated: Alternatively, not understanding reality, and understanding falsely, ignorance is so called because it is non-knowledge.

original: de ltar ma rig pa yod na 'du byed rnam pa gsum mngon par 'grub ste /
analyzed: de ltar ma rig pa yod na 'du byed rnam pa gsum mngon par 'grub ste /
translated: Thus, when there is ignorance, the three kinds of volitions are actualized.

original: bsod nams su nye bar 'gro ba dang / bsod nams ma yin par nye bar 'gro ba dang / @187b mi g-yo bar nye bar 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: bsod nams su nye bar 'gro ba dang / bsod nams ma yin par nye bar 'gro ba dang / @187b mi g-yo bar nye bar 'gro ba'o //
translated: They are the volitions that lead to merit, the volitions that lead to demerit, and the volitions that lead to immobility.

original: de la bsod nams su nye bar 'gro ba'i 'du byed rnams las bsod nams su nye bar 'gro ba'i rnam par shes pa nyid du 'gyur ba dang / bsod nams ma yin par nye bar 'gro ba'i 'du byed rnams las bsod nams ma yin par nye bar 'gro ba'i rnam par shes pa nyid du 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: de la bsod nams su nye bar 'gro ba'i 'du byed rnams las bsod nams su nye bar 'gro ba'i rnam par shes pa nyid du 'gyur ba dang / bsod nams ma yin par nye bar 'gro ba'i 'du byed rnams las bsod nams ma yin par nye bar 'gro ba'i rnam par shes pa nyid du 'gyur ba dang /
translated: From the volitions that lead to merit, there is the consciousness that leads to merit. From the volitions that lead to demerit, there is the consciousness that leads to demerit.

original: mi g-yo bar nye bar 'gro ba'i 'du byed rnams las mi g-yo bar nye bar 'gro ba'i rnam par shes pa nyid du 'gyur ba 'di ni rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mi g-yo bar nye bar 'gro ba'i 'du byed rnams las mi g-yo bar nye bar 'gro ba'i rnam par shes pa nyid du 'gyur ba 'di ni rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: From the volitions that lead to immobility, there is the consciousness that leads to immobility. This is called consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs zhes bya ba la /
translated: “Conditioned by consciousness is name-and-form.”

original: tshor ba la sogs pa gzugs can ma yin pa'i phung po bzhi ni srid pa de dang de ra gzhol bas na ming yin no //
analyzed: tshor ba la sogs pa gzugs can ma yin pa'i phung po bzhi ni srid pa de dang de ra gzhol bas na ming yin no //
translated: The four aggregates which are not material form, sensation, etc., are called name, because they are the object of the mental faculty, and because they are the support of the notion of name.

original: gzugs kyi phung po dang / lhan cig tu ming dang gzugs zhes bya ba yin pas na ming dang gzugs zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po dang / lhan cig tu ming dang gzugs zhes bya ba yin pas na ming dang gzugs zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The five aggregates, material form and the others, are called name-and-form, because material form and the others are the basis of the notion of name.

original: ming dang gzugs rnam par 'phel bas skye mched drug gi sgo nas bya ba byed pa rnams 'byung ste /
analyzed: ming dang gzugs rnam par 'phel bas skye mched drug gi sgo nas bya ba byed pa rnams 'byung ste /
translated: The six sense-spheres develop from name-and-form.

original: de ni ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis skye mched drug ces bya'o //
analyzed: de ni ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis skye mched drug ces bya'o //
translated: This is why the Sūtra speaks of the six sense-spheres as having name-and-form for their cause.

original: skye mched drug po dag las reg pa'i tshogs drug 'byung ste /
analyzed: skye mched drug po dag las reg pa'i tshogs drug 'byung ste /
translated: From the six sense-spheres there arises the six-fold group of contact.

original: de ni skye mched drug gi rkyen gyis reg pa'i zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni skye mched drug gi rkyen gyis reg pa'i zhes bya'o //
translated: This is why the Sūtra speaks of the six sense-spheres as having the six sense-spheres for their cause.

original: ji lta bur reg pa 'byung ba de lta bur tshor ba 'byung ste /
analyzed: ji lta bur reg pa 'byung ba de lta bur tshor ba 'byung ste /
translated: In accordance with the contact, there arises the sensation.

original: de ni reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba zhes bya'o //
translated: This is why the Sūtra speaks of contact as having sensation for its effect.

original: tshor ba'i bye brag de dag myang ba dang mngon par dga' ba dang / lhag par zhen pa dang / lhag par zhen nas 'jug pa de ni tshor ba'i rkyen gyis sred pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tshor ba'i bye brag de dag myang ba dang mngon par dga' ba dang / lhag par zhen pa dang / lhag par zhen nas 'jug pa de ni tshor ba'i rkyen gyis sred pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The experience of those specific feelings, the delight in them, the intense attachment to them, and the engagement with them out of intense attachment is called “craving with feeling as its condition.”

original: myong ba dang mngon par dga' ba dang / lhag par zhen pa dang / lhag par zhen nas 'dug pa las bdag sdug pa'i ngo bo dang / bde ba'i ngo bo dang bral bar ma gyur cig snyam du mi gtong bar phyir zhing smon pa 'di ni sred pa'i rkyen gyis len pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: myong ba dang mngon par dga' ba dang / lhag par zhen pa dang / lhag par zhen nas 'dug pa las bdag sdug pa'i ngo bo dang / bde ba'i ngo bo dang bral bar ma gyur cig snyam du mi gtong bar phyir zhing smon pa 'di ni sred pa'i rkyen gyis len pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The experience, delight, intense attachment, and engagement with intense attachment lead to the thought, “May I not be separated from the pleasant and delightful things that I am attached to!” The non-abandonment of that intense attachment and the repeated aspiration for those things is called “grasping with craving as its condition.”

original: dngos po gang la sred pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po de bsag cing sgrub pa'i phyir nye bar len pa len zhing /
analyzed: dngos po gang la sred pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po de bsag cing sgrub pa'i phyir nye bar len pa len zhing /
translated: The things that one is attached to are accumulated and accomplished in order to obtain them.

original: de dang de la smon pa'o //
analyzed: de dang de la smon pa'o //
translated: One aspires for them and takes hold of them.

original: de ltar smon zhing yang srid pa bskyed pa'i las lus dang ngag dang yid kyis kun nas slong ba de ni len pa'i rkyen gyis srid pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar smon zhing yang srid pa bskyed pa'i las lus dang ngag dang yid kyis kun nas slong ba de ni len pa'i rkyen gyis srid pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The body, speech, and mind that give rise to rebirth through such aspirations is called “becoming with grasping as its condition.”

original: las de las skyes pa'i phung po rnams mngon par 'grub pa gang yin pa de ni srid pa'i rkyen gyis skye ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: las de las skyes pa'i phung po rnams mngon par 'grub pa gang yin pa de ni srid pa'i rkyen gyis skye ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The actualization of the aggregates that are born from that action is called “birth conditioned by existence.”

original: skye ba mngon @188a * //
analyzed: skye ba mngon @188a * //
translated: The actualization of birth

original: par 'grub pa'i phung po rnams kyi 'phel ba yongs su smin pa dang / 'jig par 'gyur ba de ni skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi zhes bya'o //
analyzed: par 'grub pa'i phung po rnams kyi 'phel ba yongs su smin pa dang / 'jig par 'gyur ba de ni skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi zhes bya'o //
translated: is the growth, maturation, and disintegration of the aggregates. This is called “aging and death conditioned by birth.”

original: de ltar rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i yan lag bcu gnyis po 'di dag ni /🔽rgyu gzhan dang gzhan las byung ba /
analyzed: de ltar rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i yan lag bcu gnyis po 'di dag ni / rgyu gzhan dang gzhan las byung ba /
translated: Thus, these twelve factors of dependent origination

original: rkyen gzhan dang gzhan las byung ba /
analyzed: rkyen gzhan dang gzhan las byung ba /
translated: arise from other causes and other conditions.

original: rtag pa ma yin mi rtag pa ma yin /
analyzed: rtag pa ma yin mi rtag pa ma yin /
translated: They are not permanent, nor are they impermanent.

original: 'dus byas ma yin 'dus ma byas ma yin /
analyzed: 'dus byas ma yin 'dus ma byas ma yin /
translated: They are not conditioned, nor are they unconditioned.

original: rgyu med pa ma yin rkyen med pa ma yin /
analyzed: rgyu med pa ma yin rkyen med pa ma yin /
translated: They are not without causes, nor are they without conditions.

original: myong ba po yod pa ma yin /🔽zad pa'i chos ma yin /🔽'jig pa'i chos ma yin /
analyzed: myong ba po yod pa ma yin / zad pa'i chos ma yin / 'jig pa'i chos ma yin /
translated: They are not experienced.🔽They are not subject to cessation.

original: 'gog pa'i chos ma yin te /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i chos ma yin te /
translated: They are not subject to destruction.🔽They are not subject to cessation.

original: thog ma med pa'i dus nas zhugs pa rgyun ma chad par klung gi rgyun bzhin du rjes su zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i dus nas zhugs pa rgyun ma chad par klung gi rgyun bzhin du rjes su zhugs pa'o //
translated: It has been in operation since beginningless time and continues uninterruptedly, like the current of a river.

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i yan lag bcu gnyis po de dag ni rgyu gzhan dang gzhan las byung ba /🔽rkyen gzhan dang gzhan las byung ba /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i yan lag bcu gnyis po de dag ni rgyu gzhan dang gzhan las byung ba / rkyen gzhan dang gzhan las byung ba /
translated: These twelve members of dependent origination arise from other causes and other conditions.

original: rtag pa ma yin mi rtag pa ma yin /
analyzed: rtag pa ma yin mi rtag pa ma yin /
translated: They are not permanent, nor are they impermanent.

original: 'dus byas ma yin 'dus ma byas ma yin /
analyzed: 'dus byas ma yin 'dus ma byas ma yin /
translated: They are not compounded, nor are they uncompounded.

original: rgyu med pa ma yin rkyen med pa ma yin /
analyzed: rgyu med pa ma yin rkyen med pa ma yin /
translated: They are not without cause, nor are they without conditions.

original: myong ba yod pa ma yin zad pa'i chos ma yin /🔽'jig pa'i chos ma yin /
analyzed: myong ba yod pa ma yin zad pa'i chos ma yin / 'jig pa'i chos ma yin /
translated: They are not experienced, nor are they subject to cessation.

original: 'gog pa'i chos ma yin te /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i chos ma yin te /
translated: They are not subject to destruction, nor are they subject to cessation.

original: thog ma med pa'i dus nas zhugs pa /
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i dus nas zhugs pa /
translated: They have been in operation since beginningless time,

original: rgyun ma chad par klung gi rgyun bzhin du rjes su zhugs mod kyi /
analyzed: rgyun ma chad par klung gi rgyun bzhin du rjes su zhugs mod kyi /
translated: and continue uninterruptedly, like the current of a river.

original: 'on kyang yan lag bzhi po 'di dag ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i yan lag bcu gnyis po de dag bsdu bar bya ba'i phyir rgyur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang yan lag bzhi po 'di dag ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i yan lag bcu gnyis po de dag bsdu bar bya ba'i phyir rgyur 'gyur ro //
translated: Nevertheless, these four members are causes for the twelve members of dependent origination, because they include them.

original: bzhi po gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi po gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: ma rig pa dang sred pa dang // las dang rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa dang sred pa dang // las dang rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: Ignorance, craving, action, and consciousness.

original: de la rnam par shes pa ni sa bon gyi rang bzhin nyid kyi rgyu byed do //
analyzed: de la rnam par shes pa ni sa bon gyi rang bzhin nyid kyi rgyu byed do //
translated: Among them, consciousness acts as the cause through its nature as a seed.

original: las ni zhing gi rang bzhin gyi rgyu byed do //
analyzed: las ni zhing gi rang bzhin gyi rgyu byed do //
translated: Action acts as the cause through its nature as a field.

original: ma rig pa dang / sred pa ni nyon mongs pa'i rang bzhin gyi rgyu byed do //
analyzed: ma rig pa dang / sred pa ni nyon mongs pa'i rang bzhin gyi rgyu byed do //
translated: Ignorance and craving act as the cause through their nature as afflictions.

original: las dang nyon mongs pa dag gis ni sa bon rnam par shes pa bskyed do //
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs pa dag gis ni sa bon rnam par shes pa bskyed do //
translated: Action and the afflictions give rise to the seed, consciousness.

original: de la las ni sa bon rnam par shes pa'i zhing gi bya ba byed do //🔽srid pas ni sa bon rnam par shes pa brlan pa'i bya ba byed do //
analyzed: de la las ni sa bon rnam par shes pa'i zhing gi bya ba byed do // srid pas ni sa bon rnam par shes pa brlan pa'i bya ba byed do //
translated: Among them, action is the field for the seed, consciousness.🔽Craving is the moisture for the seed, consciousness.

original: ma rig pas ni sa bon rnam par shes pa 'debs te /
analyzed: ma rig pas ni sa bon rnam par shes pa 'debs te /
translated: Ignorance plants the seed, consciousness.

original: rkyen 'di dag med na sa bon rnam par shes pa mngon par 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rkyen 'di dag med na sa bon rnam par shes pa mngon par 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If these conditions are absent, the seed, consciousness, will not come into existence.

original: de la las kyang 'di snyam du bdag gis sa bon @188b rnam par shes pa'i zhing gi bya ba bya'o snyam du mi sems so //
analyzed: de la las kyang 'di snyam du bdag gis sa bon @188b rnam par shes pa'i zhing gi bya ba bya'o snyam du mi sems so //
translated: The action does not think, “I will perform the function of the field for the consciousness seed.”

original: sred pa yang 'di snyam du bdag gis sa bon rnam par shes pa brlan par bya'o snyam du mi sems so //
analyzed: sred pa yang 'di snyam du bdag gis sa bon rnam par shes pa brlan par bya'o snyam du mi sems so //
translated: Craving does not think, “I will moisten the consciousness seed.”

original: ma rig pa yang 'di snyam du bdag gis sa bon rnam par shes pa gdab po snyam du mi sems so //
analyzed: ma rig pa yang 'di snyam du bdag gis sa bon rnam par shes pa gdab po snyam du mi sems so //
translated: Ignorance does not think, “I will plant the consciousness seed.”

original: sa bon rnam par shes pa yang 'di snyam du bdag ni rkyen 'di dag gis bskyed do snyam du mi sems so //
analyzed: sa bon rnam par shes pa yang 'di snyam du bdag ni rkyen 'di dag gis bskyed do snyam du mi sems so //
translated: The consciousness seed does not think, “I am produced by these conditions.”

original: 'on kyang sa bon rnam par shes pa las kyi zhing la brten pa /
analyzed: 'on kyang sa bon rnam par shes pa las kyi zhing la brten pa /
translated: Nevertheless, the consciousness seed, in dependence on the field of action,

original: sred ba'i rlan gyis brlan pa ma rig pas legs par btab pa las skye ba na /
analyzed: sred ba'i rlan gyis brlan pa ma rig pas legs par btab pa las skye ba na /
translated: moistened by the moisture of craving, and planted by ignorance, when it arises,

original: skye ba'i gnas de dang der nying mtshams sbyor ba ni ma'i mngal du ming dang gzugs kyi myu gu mngon par 'grub ste /
analyzed: skye ba'i gnas de dang der nying mtshams sbyor ba ni ma'i mngal du ming dang gzugs kyi myu gu mngon par 'grub ste /
translated: in that place of birth, connects with the place of birth, and the sprout of name and form arises in the mother’s womb.

original: ming dang gzugs kyi myu gu de yang bdag gis ma byas gzhan gyis ma byas /🔽gnyi gas ma byas /
analyzed: ming dang gzugs kyi myu gu de yang bdag gis ma byas gzhan gyis ma byas / gnyi gas ma byas /
translated: nor is it created both by itself and something else,

original: dbang phyug gis ma byas /
analyzed: dbang phyug gis ma byas /
translated: nor is it created by Īśvara,

original: dus kyis ma bsgyur /
analyzed: dus kyis ma bsgyur /
translated: nor is it transformed by time,

original: rang bzhin las ma byung /
analyzed: rang bzhin las ma byung /
translated: nor does it arise from the primary nature,

original: rgyu gcig la rag las pa ma yin /
analyzed: rgyu gcig la rag las pa ma yin /
translated: nor is it dependent on a single cause,

original: rgyu med pa las kyang ma skyes te /🔽'on kyang pha dang ma phrad pa dang zla mtshan dang ldan pa dang rkyen gzhan yang 'tshogs na bdag po med pa'i chos bdag gi med pa 'dzin pa med pa nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa /🔽sgyu ma'i mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin dag la rgyu dang rkyen rnams ma tshang ba med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyu med pa las kyang ma skyes te / 'on kyang pha dang ma phrad pa dang zla mtshan dang ldan pa dang rkyen gzhan yang 'tshogs na bdag po med pa'i chos bdag gi med pa 'dzin pa med pa nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa / sgyu ma'i mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin dag la rgyu dang rkyen rnams ma tshang ba med pa'i phyir /
translated: nor is it born without a cause.

original: skye ba'i gnas de dang der nying mtshams sbyor ba na ma'i mngal du ro myang ba dang ldan pa'i sa bon rnam par shes pa ming dang gzugs kyi myu gu mngon par sgrub po //🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: skye ba'i gnas de dang der nying mtshams sbyor ba na ma'i mngal du ro myang ba dang ldan pa'i sa bon rnam par shes pa ming dang gzugs kyi myu gu mngon par sgrub po //🔽'di lta ste /
translated: However, when the father and mother come together, when the mother is ovulating, and when other conditions are present, then in the absence of a self, in the absence of a sentient being, in the absence of a life-force, in the absence of a nourisher, in the absence of an individual, in the absence of a human being, in the absence of a human, in the absence of an owner, in the absence of one who sees, in the absence of one who hears, in the absence of one who smells, in the absence of one who tastes, in the absence of one who touches, in the absence of one who knows, in the absence of one who conceives, in the absence of one who rejects, in the absence of one who abandons, in the absence of one who takes up, in the absence of one who gives, in the absence of one who takes, in the absence of one who is satisfied, in the absence of one who is dissatisfied, in the absence of one who is neutral, in the absence of one who is not neutral, in the absence of one who is happy, in the absence of one who is unhappy, in the absence of one who is frightened, in the absence of one who is not frightened, in the absence of one who is confused, in the absence of one who is not confused, in the absence of one who is wise, in the absence of one who is not wise, in the absence of one who is ignorant, in the absence of one who is not ignorant, in the absence of one who is liberated, in the absence of one who is not liberated, in the absence of one who is bound, in the absence of one who is not bound, in the absence of one who is defiled, in the absence of one who is not defiled, in the absence of one who is pure, in the absence of one who is not pure, in the absence of one who is born, in the absence of one who dies, in the absence of one who is reborn, in the absence of one who is not

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa ni rgyu lnga las 'byung ste /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa ni rgyu lnga las 'byung ste /
translated: Eye consciousness arises from five causes.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: mig la brten pa dang / gzugs dang / snang ba dang / nam mkha' dang / de bskyed pa'i yid la byed pa la yang brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: mig la brten pa dang / gzugs dang / snang ba dang / nam mkha' dang / de bskyed pa'i yid la byed pa la yang brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa 'byung ngo //
translated: Eye consciousness arises in dependence on the eye, form, light, space, and the attention that generates it.

original: de la mig ni mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rten gyi bya ba byed do //
analyzed: de la mig ni mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rten gyi bya ba byed do //
translated: In this regard, the eye performs the action of being the basis of eye consciousness.

original: gzugs ni mig gi rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa'i bya ba byed do //
analyzed: gzugs ni mig gi rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa'i bya ba byed do //
translated: Form performs the action of being the object of eye consciousness.

original: snang ba ni mngon pa'i bya ba byed do //
analyzed: snang ba ni mngon pa'i bya ba byed do //
translated: Light performs the action of illumination.

original: nam mkha' ni mi sgrib pa'i bya ba byed do //
analyzed: nam mkha' ni mi sgrib pa'i bya ba byed do //
translated: Space performs the action of nonobstruction.

original: de skyed pa'i yid la byed pa ni bsam pa'i bya ba byed do //
analyzed: de skyed pa'i yid la byed pa ni bsam pa'i bya ba byed do //
translated: The attention that generates it performs the action of directing.

original: rkyen de dag med na mig gi rnam par shes pa 'byung bar mi 'gyur gyi /🔽gang gi tshe @189a * //
analyzed: rkyen de dag med na mig gi rnam par shes pa 'byung bar mi 'gyur gyi / gang gi tshe @189a * //
translated: If any one of these conditions is absent, eye consciousness will not arise.

original: mig gi nang gi skye mched mig ma tshang bar ma gyur la /
analyzed: mig gi nang gi skye mched mig ma tshang bar ma gyur la /
translated: When the internal sense base of the eye is not damaged,

original: de bzhin du gzugs dang / snang ba dang / nam mkha' dang / de skyed pa'i yid la byed pa dag ma tshang bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs dang / snang ba dang / nam mkha' dang / de skyed pa'i yid la byed pa dag ma tshang bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: Likewise, form, light, space, and the attention that generates it are not incomplete.

original: thams cad 'dus pa de las mig gi rnam par shes pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thams cad 'dus pa de las mig gi rnam par shes pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: From the coming together of all of them, visual consciousness arises.

original: / de la mig ni 'di snyam du bdag gis mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rten gyi bya ba bya'o snyam du mi sems so //🔽gzugs kyang 'di snyam du bdag gis mig gi rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa'i bya ba bya'o snyam du mi sems so //
analyzed: / de la mig ni 'di snyam du bdag gis mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rten gyi bya ba bya'o snyam du mi sems so // gzugs kyang 'di snyam du bdag gis mig gi rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa'i bya ba bya'o snyam du mi sems so //
translated: In this regard, the eye does not think, “I will perform the function of being the basis of visual consciousness.”🔽Form does not think, “I will perform the function of being the object of visual consciousness.”

original: snang ba yang 'di snyam du bdag gis mig gi rnam par shes pa'i mngon pa'i bya ba bya'o snyam du mi sems so //
analyzed: snang ba yang 'di snyam du bdag gis mig gi rnam par shes pa'i mngon pa'i bya ba bya'o snyam du mi sems so //
translated: Light does not think, “I will perform the function of illuminating for visual consciousness.”

original: nam mkha' yang 'di snyam du bdag gis mig gi rnam par shes pa'i mi sgrib pa'i bya ba bya'o snyam du mi sems so //
analyzed: nam mkha' yang 'di snyam du bdag gis mig gi rnam par shes pa'i mi sgrib pa'i bya ba bya'o snyam du mi sems so //
translated: Space does not think, “I will perform the function of not obstructing visual consciousness.”

original: de skyed pa'i yid la byed pa yang 'di snyam du bdag gis mig gi rnam par shes pa'i sems pa'i bya ba bya'o snyam du mi sems so //
analyzed: de skyed pa'i yid la byed pa yang 'di snyam du bdag gis mig gi rnam par shes pa'i sems pa'i bya ba bya'o snyam du mi sems so //
translated: The attention that produces it does not think, “I will produce the activity of the volition of visual consciousness.”

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa yang 'di snyam du //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa yang 'di snyam du //
translated: Visual consciousness does not think,

original: bdag ni rkyen 'di dag gis skyed do snyam du mi sems te /
analyzed: bdag ni rkyen 'di dag gis skyed do snyam du mi sems te /
translated: “I am produced by these conditions.”

original: 'on kyang rkyen 'di dag yod pa las mig gis rnam par shes pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang rkyen 'di dag yod pa las mig gis rnam par shes pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Nevertheless, from the existence of these conditions, visual consciousness arises.

original: de bzhin du dbang po lhag ma dang bcas pa rnams la yang ci rigs su sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du dbang po lhag ma dang bcas pa rnams la yang ci rigs su sbyar ro //
translated: The same is to be applied in the appropriate manner to the remaining faculties.

original: de la chos gang yang 'jig rten 'di nas 'jig rten pha rol du mi 'pho mod kyi rgyu dang rkyen rnams ma tshang ba med pa'i phyir las kyi 'bras bur mngon pa yang yod do //
analyzed: de la chos gang yang 'jig rten 'di nas 'jig rten pha rol du mi 'pho mod kyi rgyu dang rkyen rnams ma tshang ba med pa'i phyir las kyi 'bras bur mngon pa yang yod do //
translated: In this regard, although no dharma at all passes from this world to the next world, still, because the causes and conditions are not incomplete, the result of action is evident.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: dper na rab tu phyis pa'i me long gi dkyil 'khor la bzhin gyi gzugs brnyan snang ba yang bzhin me long gi dkyil 'khor du ma 'phos mod kyi /
analyzed: dper na rab tu phyis pa'i me long gi dkyil 'khor la bzhin gyi gzugs brnyan snang ba yang bzhin me long gi dkyil 'khor du ma 'phos mod kyi /
translated: For example, the reflection of a face appears in a very clean mirror, but the face does not move into the mirror.

original: rgyu dang rkyen ma tshang ba med pa'i phyir bzhin du mngon pa yang yod do //🔽de bzhin du 'di nas kyang su yang shi 'phos pa med la /
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen ma tshang ba med pa'i phyir bzhin du mngon pa yang yod do // de bzhin du 'di nas kyang su yang shi 'phos pa med la /
translated: However, because the causes and conditions are not incomplete, the face is seen.

original: gzhan du yang ma skyes te /🔽rgyu dang rkyen rnams ma tshang ba med pa'i phyir las kyi 'bras bur mngon pa yang med do //
analyzed: gzhan du yang ma skyes te / rgyu dang rkyen rnams ma tshang ba med pa'i phyir las kyi 'bras bur mngon pa yang med do //
translated: In the same way, no one dies in this world and transmigrates to another.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: However, because the causes and conditions are not incomplete, the result of action is seen.

original: dper na zla ba'i dkyil 'khor ni dpag tshad bzhi khri'i steng nas 'gro ste /
analyzed: dper na zla ba'i dkyil 'khor ni dpag tshad bzhi khri'i steng nas 'gro ste /
translated: For example, the orb of the moon moves 40,000 yojanas above us.

original: 'on kyang snod chung ngu chus gang bar zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi gzugs brnyan snang ba yang /
analyzed: 'on kyang snod chung ngu chus gang bar zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi gzugs brnyan snang ba yang /
translated: However, the reflection of the orb of the moon appears in a small vessel filled with water.

original: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor ni gnas de nas ma @189b 'phos te /
analyzed: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor ni gnas de nas ma @189b 'phos te /
translated: The orb of the moon does not move from its place,

original: snod chung ngu chus gang ba'i nang du son pa yang med mod kyi /
analyzed: snod chung ngu chus gang ba'i nang du son pa yang med mod kyi /
translated: and it does not enter the small vessel filled with water.

original: rgyu dang rkyen rnams ma tshang ba med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen rnams ma tshang ba med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the causes and conditions are not incomplete.

original: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor du mngon pa yang yod do //🔽de bzhin du 'di nas kyang su yang shi 'phos pa med la /
analyzed: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor du mngon pa yang yod do // de bzhin du 'di nas kyang su yang shi 'phos pa med la /
translated: And yet, the reflection of the moon appears on the surface of the water.

original: gzhan du ma skyes mod kyi /
analyzed: gzhan du ma skyes mod kyi /
translated: In the same way, here, no one dies in this world and is born in another.

original: rgyu dang rkyen rnams ma tshang ba med pa'i phyir las kyi 'bras bur mngon par yang yod do //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen rnams ma tshang ba med pa'i phyir las kyi 'bras bur mngon par yang yod do //
translated: And yet, because the causes and conditions are not incomplete, the result of action is evident.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: dper na me de rgyu dang rkyen ma tshang na mi 'bar gyi /
analyzed: dper na me de rgyu dang rkyen ma tshang na mi 'bar gyi /
translated: If the causes and conditions of fire are not complete, fire does not blaze up.

original: rgyu dang rkyen tshogs pa las 'bar ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen tshogs pa las 'bar ro //
translated: But when the causes and conditions are complete, fire blazes up.

original: de bzhin du chos rnams ni bdag po med pa'i chos bdag gi med pa 'dzin pa med pa nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du chos rnams ni bdag po med pa'i chos bdag gi med pa 'dzin pa med pa nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa /
translated: In the same way, in phenomena that are without a master, without a self, without a holder, similar to space,

original: sgyu ba'i mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin dag la rgyu dang rkyen rnams ma tshang ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgyu ba'i mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin dag la rgyu dang rkyen rnams ma tshang ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the result of action is evident because the causes and conditions are not incomplete.

original: skye ba'i gnas de dang der nyid mtshams sbyor ba na ma'i mngal du sa bon rnam par shes pa las dang nyon mongs pa rnams kyis bskyed pa'i ming dang gzugs kyi myu gu mngon par grub ste /
analyzed: skye ba'i gnas de dang der nyid mtshams sbyor ba na ma'i mngal du sa bon rnam par shes pa las dang nyon mongs pa rnams kyis bskyed pa'i ming dang gzugs kyi myu gu mngon par grub ste /
translated: When linking with that birth, the seed consciousness produces the sprout of name and form in the mother’s womb, generated by karma and affliction.

original: de la nang gi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba lngar blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: de la nang gi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba lngar blta bar bya ste /
translated: The internal dependent origination should be viewed in five ways.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: rtag par ma yin pa dang / chad par ma yin pa dang / 'pho bar ma yin pa dang / rgyu chung ngu las 'bras bu chen po 'byung ba dang / de dang 'dra ba'i rgyud du'o //
analyzed: rtag par ma yin pa dang / chad par ma yin pa dang / 'pho bar ma yin pa dang / rgyu chung ngu las 'bras bu chen po 'byung ba dang / de dang 'dra ba'i rgyud du'o //
translated: They are non-eternalism, non-annihilationism, non-transference, the arising of a great result from a small cause, and a continuum of the same type.

original: ji ltar rtag par ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar rtag par ma yin zhe na /
translated: How is it non-eternal?

original: gang gi phyir tha ma 'chi ba'i phung po rnams kyang gzhan la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir tha ma 'chi ba'i phung po rnams kyang gzhan la /
translated: Because the aggregates at the end of death are one thing,

original: skye ba'i char gtogs pa'i phung po rnams kyang gzhan te /
analyzed: skye ba'i char gtogs pa'i phung po rnams kyang gzhan te /
translated: and the aggregates belonging to birth are another.

original: tha ma 'chi ba'i phung po gang yin pa de nyid skye ba'i char gtogs pa rnams ma yin gyis /
analyzed: tha ma 'chi ba'i phung po gang yin pa de nyid skye ba'i char gtogs pa rnams ma yin gyis /
translated: The aggregates at the end of death are not the same as those belonging to birth.

original: tha ma 'chi ba'i phung po rnams kyang 'gags la de nyid kyi tshe skye ba'i char gtogs pa'i phung po rnams 'byung bas de'i phyir rtag par ma yin no //
analyzed: tha ma 'chi ba'i phung po rnams kyang 'gags la de nyid kyi tshe skye ba'i char gtogs pa'i phung po rnams 'byung bas de'i phyir rtag par ma yin no //
translated: The aggregates at death cease, and at that time the aggregates pertaining to birth arise. Therefore, it is not permanent.

original: ji ltar chad par ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar chad par ma yin zhe na /
translated: How is it not annihilated?

original: tha ma 'chi ba'i dus kyi phung po rnams sngon 'gags pa las skye ba'i char gtogs pa'i phung po rnams 'byung ba ma yin la /
analyzed: tha ma 'chi ba'i dus kyi phung po rnams sngon 'gags pa las skye ba'i char gtogs pa'i phung po rnams 'byung ba ma yin la /
translated: The aggregates pertaining to birth do not arise from the prior cessation of the aggregates at death.

original: ma 'gags pa las kyang ma yin gyi /
analyzed: ma 'gags pa las kyang ma yin gyi /
translated: Nor do they arise from noncessation.

original: tha ma 'chi ba'i phung po rnams kyang 'gags la /
analyzed: tha ma 'chi ba'i phung po rnams kyang 'gags la /
translated: The aggregates at death cease,

original: de nyid kyi tshe skye ba'i char gtogs pa'i phung po rnams srang mda'i mthon dman bzhin 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi tshe skye ba'i char gtogs pa'i phung po rnams srang mda'i mthon dman bzhin 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: and at that time the aggregates pertaining to birth arise, like the swing of a scale.

original: de'i phyir chad par yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir chad par yang ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not annihilated.

original: ji ltar 'pho ba ma yin zhe na /🔽sems can rigs mi 'dra ba @190a * //
analyzed: ji ltar 'pho ba ma yin zhe na / sems can rigs mi 'dra ba @190a * //
translated: How is it not transferred?

original: rnams skal ba mnyam pa'i skye bar skye ba mngon par 'grub par mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: rnams skal ba mnyam pa'i skye bar skye ba mngon par 'grub par mi byed pa'o //
translated: It does not establish the birth of sentient beings of different species in the same realm.

original: de'i phyir 'pho bar yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'pho bar yang ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not transferred.

original: ji ltar rgyu chung ngu las 'bras bu chen po 'byung zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar rgyu chung ngu las 'bras bu chen po 'byung zhe na /
translated: How does a great result arise from a small cause?

original: las chung ngu byas pa las 'bras bu chen po rnam par smin pa myong ste /
analyzed: las chung ngu byas pa las 'bras bu chen po rnam par smin pa myong ste /
translated: A great result is experienced from the evolution of a small action.

original: de'i phyir rgyu chung ngu las 'bras bu chen por 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu chung ngu las 'bras bu chen por 'byung ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, a great result arises from a small cause.🔽The result is experienced in accordance with the action that was done.

original: ji ltar myong bar 'gyur pa'i las byas pa de ltar myong par 'gyur ba'i rnam par smin pa myong ba de'i phyir /
analyzed: ji ltar myong bar 'gyur pa'i las byas pa de ltar myong par 'gyur ba'i rnam par smin pa myong ba de'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, the result is experienced in a continuum that is similar to the cause.

original: de dang 'dra ba'i rgyud du'o zhes bya bar rgya cher gsungs pa lta bu'o //🔽slob dpon zla ba grags pa'i zhal snga nas sbyar ba'i tshig gsal ba las /
analyzed: de dang 'dra ba'i rgyud du'o zhes bya bar rgya cher gsungs pa lta bu'o // slob dpon zla ba grags pa'i zhal snga nas sbyar ba'i tshig gsal ba las /
translated: This is stated extensively.

original: srid pa'i yan lag bcu gnyis brtag pa zhes bya ba rab tu byed pa nyi shu drug pa'i 'grel pa'o /
analyzed: srid pa'i yan lag bcu gnyis brtag pa zhes bya ba rab tu byed pa nyi shu drug pa'i 'grel pa'o /
translated: This concludes the commentary on the twenty-sixth chapter, having sixteen verses, called “the examination of the twelve factors of dependent origination.🔽”🔽CHAPTER TWENTY-SEVEN🔽Examination of the Four Noble Truths

original: // / gang gis de lta bu'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ji lta bur gyur pa yang dag par mthong ba de ni sngon gyi mtha' la rten par mi byed /
analyzed: // / gang gis de lta bu'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ji lta bur gyur pa yang dag par mthong ba de ni sngon gyi mtha' la rten par mi byed /
translated: Those who see dependent origination as it is do not rely on the prior limit,

original: phyi ma'i mtha' la rten par mi byed do zhes mdo las 'don pa yin na /🔽de la sngon gyi mtha' la rten pa ni gang zhig yin zhing /
analyzed: phyi ma'i mtha' la rten par mi byed do zhes mdo las 'don pa yin na / de la sngon gyi mtha' la rten pa ni gang zhig yin zhing /
translated: nor do they rely on the later limit.🔽What is reliance on the prior limit?

original: phyi ma'i mtha' yang gang zhig yin la /
analyzed: phyi ma'i mtha' yang gang zhig yin la /
translated: What is reliance on the later limit?

original: ji ltar na rten par mi byed pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na rten par mi byed pa yin zhe na /
translated: How do they not rely on them?

original: de dag bstan pa'i phyir 'di brjod do //
analyzed: de dag bstan pa'i phyir 'di brjod do //
translated: This is stated to teach that.

original: de la da ltar gyi bdag gi dngos po la ltos te 'das pa'i dus dag la sngon gyi mtha' zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de la da ltar gyi bdag gi dngos po la ltos te 'das pa'i dus dag la sngon gyi mtha' zhes bya ste /
translated: In relation to the present state of self, past time is called the prior limit.

original: skye ba gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa'i cha snga ma ni sngon gyi mtha'o //
analyzed: skye ba gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa'i cha snga ma ni sngon gyi mtha'o //
translated: The prior limit is the earlier part of the continuum of lives.

original: de la rten par mi byed pa ni lta ba'i rnam pa dag gis dmigs par mi byed pa rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i de nyid ji ltar gnas pa bzhin mthong ba'i phyir rnam pa gzhan du gnas pa'i dngos po la rnam pa gzhan du mngon par zhen🔽par mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: de la rten par mi byed pa ni lta ba'i rnam pa dag gis dmigs par mi byed pa rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i de nyid ji ltar gnas pa bzhin mthong ba'i phyir rnam pa gzhan du gnas pa'i dngos po la rnam pa gzhan du mngon par zhen par mi byed pa'o //
translated: Not taking that as a basis means not taking it as an object through the aspects of views, because one sees the reality of dependent origination just as it is. One does not adhere to things existing in one way and being conceived in another.

original: de la lta ba brgyad ni sngon gyi mtha' la dmigs nas rnam pa gzhan du 'jug ste /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la lta ba brgyad ni sngon gyi mtha' la dmigs nas rnam pa gzhan du 'jug ste / 'di lta ste /
translated: The eight views operate in relation to the prior limit, thinking:🔽Did I exist in the past or not?

original: 'das dus byung ma byung zhes dang // 'jig rten rtag pa la sogs par //🔽lta ba gang yin de dag ni //
analyzed: 'das dus byung ma byung zhes dang // 'jig rten rtag pa la sogs par // lta ba gang yin de dag ni //
translated: Did the world have an end or not?

original: sngon gyi mtha' la brten pa yin //
analyzed: sngon gyi mtha' la brten pa yin //
translated: Is the world finite or infinite?🔽Are the soul and the body the same or different?🔽Does the Tathāgata exist or not exist after death?

analyzed: lta ba 'di dag ni bzhi ste / 'di lta ste / ci bdag 'das pa'i dus na byung ba zhig gam /

analyzed: byung ba yang ma yin la ma byung ba yang ma yin pa zhig ces bya ba lta ba bzhi po 'di dag ni sngon gyi mtha' la brten pa yin no // gzhan yang bzhi ste zhes sngar zhar la bshad la /

original: lta ba gang yin de dag kyang //
analyzed: lta ba gang yin de dag kyang //
translated: The four views that the world is finite, infinite, etc.

original: sngon gyi mtha' la brten pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sngon gyi mtha' la brten pa ma yin no //
