original: de la lta ba bzhi tshan gong ma la mjug thogs kyi lta ba bzhi tshan la tha dad pa cher med mod kyi /
analyzed: de la lta ba bzhi tshan gong ma la mjug thogs kyi lta ba bzhi tshan la tha dad pa cher med mod kyi /
translated: The four views that the world is finite, infinite, etc.

original: de lta na yang khyad par cung zad tsam la brten nas logs shig tu nye bar bkod de /
analyzed: de lta na yang khyad par cung zad tsam la brten nas logs shig tu nye bar bkod de /
translated: are not based on the prior limit.🔽The four views that the world is finite, infinite, etc.

original: de yang phyi nas bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang phyi nas bshad par bya'o //
translated: are not based on the prior limit.🔽The four views that the world is finite, infinite, etc.🔽are not based on the prior limit.🔽The four views that the world is finite, infinite, etc.🔽are not based on the prior limit.

original: de la 'jig rten rtag go zhes bya ba 'di ni 'das pa'i dus na byung ba zhig gam zhes bya ba 'di las tha dad pa cher med do //
analyzed: de la 'jig rten rtag go zhes bya ba 'di ni 'das pa'i dus na byung ba zhig gam zhes bya ba 'di las tha dad pa cher med do //
translated: The four views that the world is finite, infinite, etc.🔽are

original: rnam pa gcig tu na khyad par ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na khyad par ni 'di yin te /
translated: In one way, the difference is as follows:🔽The four views that the world is eternal, etc. are in general based on the prior limit.

original: 'jig rten rtag go zhes bya ba'i lta ba bzhi po gang yin pa de ni spyir sngon gyi mtha' la brten pa yin la /
analyzed: 'jig rten rtag go zhes bya ba'i lta ba bzhi po gang yin pa de ni spyir sngon gyi mtha' la brten pa yin la /
translated: The view that the self existed in the past is based on the prior limit by taking the self as the referent object.🔽The view that the self did not exist in the past is based on the prior limit by taking the aggregates as the referent object.🔽The views that the self will exist in the future and that the self will not exist in the future are based on the prior limit by taking the self as the referent object.🔽The views that the self will exist in the future and that the self will not exist in the future are based on the prior limit by taking the aggregates as the referent object.

original: 'das pa'i dus na byung ba zhig gam zhes bya ba 'di ni bdag kho na la sngon gyi mtha' bzung nas zhugs pa yin gyi /🔽phyir ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'das pa'i dus na byung ba zhig gam zhes bya ba 'di ni bdag kho na la sngon gyi mtha' bzung nas zhugs pa yin gyi / phyir ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The difference is that the views that the world is eternal, etc. are based on the prior limit in general, but the views that the self existed in the past, etc. are based on the prior limit by taking the self as the referent object.

original: de bzhin du lta ba gzhan dag la yang khyad par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du lta ba gzhan dag la yang khyad par brjod par bya'o //
translated: The other views should be explained in terms of their differences in the same way.

original: de ltar na re zhig lta ba brgyad po de dag ni sngon gyi mtha' la brten pa yin no//
analyzed: de ltar na re zhig lta ba brgyad po de dag ni sngon gyi mtha' la brten pa yin no//
translated: In this way, these eight views are based on the prior limit.

original: sngon gyi mtha' de ni de la dmigs par byed pa'i lta ba dag dang lhan cig bshad zin to //
analyzed: sngon gyi mtha' de ni de la dmigs par byed pa'i lta ba dag dang lhan cig bshad zin to //
translated: The prior limit has already been explained together with the views that take it as their object.

original: da ni phyi ma'i mtha' brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni phyi ma'i mtha' brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now the later limit will be explained.

original: de la da ltar ba'i bdag gi dngos po la ltos nas 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i lus la phyi ma'i mtha' zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de la da ltar ba'i bdag gi dngos po la ltos nas 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i lus la phyi ma'i mtha' zhes bya ste /
translated: The body that will arise in dependence on the present state of the self is called the later limit.

original: skye ba gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa'i cha phyi ma ni phyi ma'i mtha'o //
analyzed: skye ba gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa'i cha phyi ma ni phyi ma'i mtha'o //
translated: The subsequent part of the succession of lives is the future.

original: de la rten par mi byed pa ni lta ba'i rnam pa dag gi dmigs par mi byed pa ste /
analyzed: de la rten par mi byed pa ni lta ba'i rnam pa dag gi dmigs par mi byed pa ste /
translated: Not to rely on that means not to take it as an object of the modes of view.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i de nyid ji ltar gnas pa ltar mthong ba'i phyir rnam pa gzhan du gnas pa'i dngos po la rnam pa gzhan du mngon par zhen par mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i de nyid ji ltar gnas pa ltar mthong ba'i phyir rnam pa gzhan du gnas pa'i dngos po la rnam pa gzhan du mngon par zhen par mi byed pa'o //
translated: Because one sees dependent origination just as it is, one does not adhere to the existence of things in any other mode.

original: de la lta ba brgyad ni phyi ma'i mtha' la dmigs pa nas rnam pa gzhan du 'jug ste /
analyzed: de la lta ba brgyad ni phyi ma'i mtha' la dmigs pa nas rnam pa gzhan du 'jug ste /
translated: The eight views are based on the future and operate in other modes.

original: 'di lta ste /🔽ma 'ongs dus gzhan 'byung 'gyur dang // mi 'byung 'jig rten mtha' sogs par //
analyzed: 'di lta ste / ma 'ongs dus gzhan 'byung 'gyur dang // mi 'byung 'jig rten mtha' sogs par //
translated: What are they?🔽The views that in the future🔽there will be non-existence, existence, both existence and non-existence,

original: lta ba gang yin de dag ni //
analyzed: lta ba gang yin de dag ni //
translated: and the views that the world is finite, infinite, both finite and infinite,🔽and neither finite nor infinite.

original: phyi ma'i mtha' la brten pa yin //🔽'dir yang @191a * //
analyzed: phyi ma'i mtha' la brten pa yin // 'dir yang @191a * //
translated: These views are based on the future.

original: lta ba gnyis nye bar bkod pa ni nye bar mtshon pa'i don du yin no //
analyzed: lta ba gnyis nye bar bkod pa ni nye bar mtshon pa'i don du yin no //
translated: Here, the two views are mentioned as an illustration.

original: lta ba 'di dag ni bzhi ste /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: lta ba 'di dag ni bzhi ste /🔽'di lta ste /
translated: These views are fourfold:🔽the view of existence, the view of non-existence, the view of both existence and non-existence, and the view of neither existence nor non-existence.

original: ci bdag ma 'ongs pa'i dus na 'byung bar 'gyur ba zhig gam mi 'byung bar 'gyur ba zhig gam /
analyzed: ci bdag ma 'ongs pa'i dus na 'byung bar 'gyur ba zhig gam mi 'byung bar 'gyur ba zhig gam /
translated: Will I exist in the future? Will I not exist in the future?🔽Will I both exist and not exist in the future?

original: 'byung yang 'byung la mi 'byung yang mi 'byung bar 'gyur ba zhig gam /
analyzed: 'byung yang 'byung la mi 'byung yang mi 'byung bar 'gyur ba zhig gam /
translated: Will I neither exist nor not exist in the future?

original: ma 'ongs pa'i dus na 'byung ba yang ma yin mi 'byung ba yang ma yin pa zhig ces bya ba lta ba bzhi po 'di dag ni phyi ma'i mtha' la brten pa yin no //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i dus na 'byung ba yang ma yin mi 'byung ba yang ma yin pa zhig ces bya ba lta ba bzhi po 'di dag ni phyi ma'i mtha' la brten pa yin no //
translated: These four views are based on the future.

original: ci lta ba bzhi po de dag kho na zhig phyi ma'i mtha' la brten tam zhe na /
analyzed: ci lta ba bzhi po de dag kho na zhig phyi ma'i mtha' la brten tam zhe na /
translated: Are only these four views based on the future?

original: bshad pa / ma yin no //
analyzed: bshad pa / ma yin no //
translated: No, they are not.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /🔽'jig rten mtha' la sogs par lta ba phyi ma'i mtha' la brten pa gzhan bzhi yang yod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na / 'jig rten mtha' la sogs par lta ba phyi ma'i mtha' la brten pa gzhan bzhi yang yod pa yin no //
translated: What are they?🔽There are four other views based on the future, such as the view that the world has an end.

original: de la mtha' yod pa la sogs pa lta ba bzhi ni spyir phyi ma'i mtha' la brten nas 'jug pa yin la /
analyzed: de la mtha' yod pa la sogs pa lta ba bzhi ni spyir phyi ma'i mtha' la brten nas 'jug pa yin la /
translated: The four views that the world has an end, etc., are in general based on the future.

original: ci bdag ma 'ongs pa'i dus na 'byung bar 'gyur ba zhig gam zhes bya ba de dag ni bdag kho na la phyi ma'i mtha' la brten nas zhugs pa yin te /
analyzed: ci bdag ma 'ongs pa'i dus na 'byung bar 'gyur ba zhig gam zhes bya ba de dag ni bdag kho na la phyi ma'i mtha' la brten nas zhugs pa yin te /
translated: are all based on the future and refer to the self.

original: de ni lnga ba bzhi tshan gnyis kyi khyad par yin par khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: de ni lnga ba bzhi tshan gnyis kyi khyad par yin par khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: This is the difference between the two sets of four views.

original: de la re zhig sngon gyi mtha' la dmigs pa'i lta ba bzhi tshan dang po ji ltar mi srid pa de ltar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la re zhig sngon gyi mtha' la dmigs pa'i lta ba bzhi tshan dang po ji ltar mi srid pa de ltar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To show how the first set of four views that focus on the prior limit are impossible, the treatise states:

original: 'das pa'i dus na byung gyur zhe //
analyzed: 'das pa'i dus na byung gyur zhe //
translated: “I existed in the past”

original: bya ba de ni mi 'thad do //
analyzed: bya ba de ni mi 'thad do //
translated: This is untenable.

original: sngon tshe rnams su gang byung ba //
analyzed: sngon tshe rnams su gang byung ba //
translated: The one who appeared in previous lives

original: de nyid 'di ni ma yin no //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de nyid 'di ni ma yin no // zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Is not the same as this one.

original: de la gal te 'das pa'i tshe rabs rnams su gang byung ba de nyid da ltar yod par gyur na ni de'i tshe 'di 'das pa'i dus na bdag byung ba zhig gam zhes bya bar bzung bar rigs pa zhig na /
analyzed: de la gal te 'das pa'i tshe rabs rnams su gang byung ba de nyid da ltar yod par gyur na ni de'i tshe 'di 'das pa'i dus na bdag byung ba zhig gam zhes bya bar bzung bar rigs pa zhig na /
translated: If the one who appeared in previous lives were the same as the one who exists now, it would be logical to hold the view “In the past, I existed as such and such.”

original: de ni de ltar srid pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni de ltar srid pa yang ma yin te /
translated: But that is not possible.

original: rtag par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would follow that it is permanent.

original: rtag pa ni 'khor bar mi rigs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rtag pa ni 'khor bar mi rigs pa'i phyir te /
translated: It is not logical that a permanent self cycles in samsara,

original: 'gro ba gcig la gnas pa yang 'gro ba sna tshogs kyis bzung ba nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gro ba gcig la gnas pa yang 'gro ba sna tshogs kyis bzung ba nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that one being would be grasped by various reincarnating beings.

original: 'dir gal te sngar dmyal ba la sogs pa'i 'gro bar gyur nas da lta mi dag tu skyes pas bdag kho na dmyal ba la sogs par gyur to zhes de ltar rtog par byed na de ni de ltar mi rigs te /
analyzed: 'dir gal te sngar dmyal ba la sogs pa'i 'gro bar gyur nas da lta mi dag tu skyes pas bdag kho na dmyal ba la sogs par gyur to zhes de ltar rtog par byed na de ni de ltar mi rigs te /
translated: Here, if you think that since you previously existed as a hell being and so on, and now you have been born as a human, you yourself were the hell being and so on, that is not logical.

original: ji ltar na /
analyzed: ji ltar na /
translated: How could you

original: mi yin bzhin du dmyal ba la sogs pa yang yin par 'gyur /
analyzed: mi yin bzhin du dmyal ba la sogs pa yang yin par 'gyur /
translated: be a human and also a hell being and so on?

original: 'o na gang mdo las 'di skad du nga nyid de'i tshe de'i dus na 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po mang pos bkur @191b ba zhes bya bar gyur to zhes 'don pa de ji ltar rig par bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na gang mdo las 'di skad du nga nyid de'i tshe de'i dus na 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po mang pos bkur @191b ba zhes bya bar gyur to zhes 'don pa de ji ltar rig par bya zhe na /
translated: Well then, how should we understand the sutra that says, “I myself at that time in that life was the universal monarch named Samati”?

original: bka' 'di ni gzhan nyid yin pa 'gog pa lhur byed pa yin gyi gcig nyid du ston par byed pa ni ma yin no zhes shes par bya'o //
analyzed: bka' 'di ni gzhan nyid yin pa 'gog pa lhur byed pa yin gyi gcig nyid du ston par byed pa ni ma yin no zhes shes par bya'o //
translated: This statement is intended to refute difference, not to teach identity.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de'i tshe de'i dus na de gzhan na ma yin no zhes 'don pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de'i tshe de'i dus na de gzhan na ma yin no zhes 'don pa yin no //
translated: That is why the text reads, “It is not that he was different at that time.”

original: gal te de nyid 'di yin no //
analyzed: gal te de nyid 'di yin no //
translated: If it were the same one,🔽then the past and present would be identical.

original: zhes sngar gyi dang da ltar ba gcig nyid du 'gyur na nyes pa cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: zhes sngar gyi dang da ltar ba gcig nyid du 'gyur na nyes pa cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What would be wrong with that?🔽It would be permanent.

original: rtag pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes de la nyes pa bshad zin to //
analyzed: rtag pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes de la nyes pa bshad zin to //
translated: We have already explained the error in that.

original: de lta mod kyi gzhan yang brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de lta mod kyi gzhan yang brjod par bya ste /
translated: But we will say more.

original: de nyid bdag tu 'gyur snyam na //
analyzed: de nyid bdag tu 'gyur snyam na //
translated: If it were the self,

original: nye bar len pa tha dad 'gyur //
analyzed: nye bar len pa tha dad 'gyur //
translated: the appropriator would be different.

original: gal te sngon gyi de nyid da ltar gyi bdag 'dir 'byung na ni de'i tshe sngar gyi gnas skabs ltar nye bar len pa po tha dad pa med pa'i phyir phung po lnga'i mtshan nyid kyi nye bar len pa tha dad par mi 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: gal te sngon gyi de nyid da ltar gyi bdag 'dir 'byung na ni de'i tshe sngar gyi gnas skabs ltar nye bar len pa po tha dad pa med pa'i phyir phung po lnga'i mtshan nyid kyi nye bar len pa tha dad par mi 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: If the self of this life arose from the self of a former life, then just as in the previous state, the appropriator would not be different, and the appropriated, which is characterized by the five aggregates, would not be different.

original: bdag gi nye bar len pa ni de ltar tha dad pa med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag gi nye bar len pa ni de ltar tha dad pa med pa ma yin te /
translated: But the self’s appropriation is not undifferentiated.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is it then?

original: nye bar len pa ni tha dad pa kho na ste /
analyzed: nye bar len pa ni tha dad pa kho na ste /
translated: It is definitely differentiated.

original: nye bar len pa'i rgyu tha dad pa'i phyir dang / dus tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i rgyu tha dad pa'i phyir dang / dus tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the causes of appropriation are different and because the times of appropriation are different.

original: de'i phyir nye bar len pa tha dad pa'i phyir de nyid bdag 'di yin no zhes mi rigs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir nye bar len pa tha dad pa'i phyir de nyid bdag 'di yin no zhes mi rigs so //
translated: Therefore, because appropriation is different, it is illogical to say, “That is this self.”

original: ci ste nye bar len pa la tha dad pa yod mod bdag ni gcig nyid yin te /
analyzed: ci ste nye bar len pa la tha dad pa yod mod bdag ni gcig nyid yin te /
translated: But if appropriation is different, how could the self be one?

original: de'i phyir bdag la tha dad pa med pa'i phyir 'das pa'i dus na byung ba zhig gam zhes bya ba der yang 'byung ba nyid do snyam na /
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag la tha dad pa med pa'i phyir 'das pa'i dus na byung ba zhig gam zhes bya ba der yang 'byung ba nyid do snyam na /
translated: In response, Aryadeva says:

original: brjod pa / nye bar len pa ma gtogs par //
analyzed: brjod pa / nye bar len pa ma gtogs par //
translated: Apart from the appropriated aggregates,

original: khyod kyi bdag ni gang zhig yin //
analyzed: khyod kyi bdag ni gang zhig yin //
translated: what is your self?

original: gal te nye bar len pa gzhan la bdag kyang gzhan yin na ni de'i tshe nye bar len pa tha dad kyang bdag la tha dad pa med pas de de ltar 'gyur na /🔽'di ni bdag go //
analyzed: gal te nye bar len pa gzhan la bdag kyang gzhan yin na ni de'i tshe nye bar len pa tha dad kyang bdag la tha dad pa med pas de de ltar 'gyur na / 'di ni bdag go //
translated: If the self were different from the appropriated aggregates, then the self would be different even though the appropriated aggregates are different.

original: 'di ni bdag gi nye bar len pa'o zhes de dag ni tha dad par bstan par mi nus te /
analyzed: 'di ni bdag gi nye bar len pa'o zhes de dag ni tha dad par bstan par mi nus te /
translated: But it is not possible to demonstrate that they are different, saying, “This is the self.

original: nye bar len pa las tha dad pa'i rang bzhin yin pa nyid kyis bdag rgyu med par thal pa'i phyir dang / so sor gzung du yod par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nye bar len pa las tha dad pa'i rang bzhin yin pa nyid kyis bdag rgyu med par thal pa'i phyir dang / so sor gzung du yod par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is the appropriation of the self,” because it would follow, absurdly, that the self would be causeless and that it would be apprehended separately, since it would have a nature that is different from the appropriated aggregates.

original: gang gi tshe de ltar nye bar len pa ma gtogs par bdag bstan par mi nus pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe de ltar nye bar len pa ma gtogs par bdag bstan par mi nus pa de'i tshe /
translated: When it is not possible to demonstrate the self apart from the appropriated aggregates,

original: nye bar len pa tha dad kyang bdag la tha dad med do zhes brtag par mi nus so //🔽ci ste yang nye bar len pa ma gtogs par bdag yod pa ma yin pa bden mod @192a * //
analyzed: nye bar len pa tha dad kyang bdag la tha dad med do zhes brtag par mi nus so // ci ste yang nye bar len pa ma gtogs par bdag yod pa ma yin pa bden mod @192a * //
translated: It is not possible to investigate whether the self is different or not different from the appropriated aggregates.🔽Now, suppose someone thought as follows: It is certainly true that the self does not exist apart from the appropriated aggregates.

original: kyi ; 'on kyang nye bar len pa nyid bdag tu brtag go zhes kha cig rtog par byed na /
analyzed: kyi ; 'on kyang nye bar len pa nyid bdag tu brtag go zhes kha cig rtog par byed na /
translated: Nevertheless, the appropriated aggregates themselves are to be regarded as the self.

original: de yang rigs pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de yang rigs pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate that this also is not correct, it says:🔽When you say that the self does not exist

original: nye bar len pa ma gtogs pa'i //🔽bdag yod ma yin byas pa'i tshe //
analyzed: nye bar len pa ma gtogs pa'i // bdag yod ma yin byas pa'i tshe //
translated: apart from the appropriated aggregates,

original: nye bar len nyid bdag yin na //
analyzed: nye bar len nyid bdag yin na //
translated: if the appropriated aggregates themselves are the self,

original: khyod kyi bdag ni med pa yin //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: khyod kyi bdag ni med pa yin // zhes gsungs so //
translated: your self would be nonexistent.

original: re zhig nye bar len pa nyid bdag ji ltar ma yin pa de ltar bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa //
analyzed: re zhig nye bar len pa nyid bdag ji ltar ma yin pa de ltar bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa //
translated: To demonstrate how the appropriated aggregates themselves are not the self, it says:

original: nye bar len nyid bdag ma yin //
analyzed: nye bar len nyid bdag ma yin //
translated: The appropriated aggregates themselves are not the self,

original: de 'byung ba dang 'jig pa yin //🔽nye bar blang ba ji lta bur //
analyzed: de 'byung ba dang 'jig pa yin // nye bar blang ba ji lta bur //
translated: because they arise and disintegrate.🔽How could the appropriated aggregates

original: nye bar len po yin par 'gyur //
analyzed: nye bar len po yin par 'gyur //
translated: be the appropriator?

original: de la nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga zhes bya ba nye bar len pa gang yin pa de ni skad cig re re la 'byung ba dang 'jig pa yin la /
analyzed: de la nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga zhes bya ba nye bar len pa gang yin pa de ni skad cig re re la 'byung ba dang 'jig pa yin la /
translated: The five appropriated aggregates are called appropriated because they are appropriated moment by moment, arising and ceasing.

original: bdag ni de ltar skad cig re re la 'byung ba dang 'jig pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag ni de ltar skad cig re re la 'byung ba dang 'jig pa ma yin no //
translated: But the self is not like that, not arising and ceasing moment by moment.

original: bdag ni phung po dag las de nyid dang gzhan nyid la sogs pa dang / rtag pa dang mi rtag pa nyid du yang brjod par mi nus te /
analyzed: bdag ni phung po dag las de nyid dang gzhan nyid la sogs pa dang / rtag pa dang mi rtag pa nyid du yang brjod par mi nus te /
translated: The self cannot be said to be the same as or different from the aggregates, or to be permanent or impermanent.

original: nyes pa du mar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //🔽bdag rtag pa nyid yin pas ni rtag par smra bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: nyes pa du mar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro // bdag rtag pa nyid yin pas ni rtag par smra bar 'gyur la /
translated: Because many errors would ensue.🔽If the self were permanent, then the doctrine of eternalism would follow.

original: mi rtag pa nyid yin pas ni chad par smra bar thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid yin pas ni chad par smra bar thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: If the self were impermanent, then the doctrine of annihilation would follow.

original: rtag pa dang chad pa zhes bya ba 'di ni gnyi ga yang don ma yi pa chen po byed pa yin pas khas blang bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: rtag pa dang chad pa zhes bya ba 'di ni gnyi ga yang don ma yi pa chen po byed pa yin pas khas blang bar mi bya'o //
translated: Because eternalism and annihilationism are both great obstacles to the goal, they should not be accepted.

original: de'i phyir re zhig nye bar len pa de nyid bdag yin no zhes bya bar mi rigs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir re zhig nye bar len pa de nyid bdag yin no zhes bya bar mi rigs so //
translated: Therefore, it is not reasonable to say that the appropriated aggregates are the self.

original: gzhan yang nye bar blang ba ji lta bur //
analyzed: gzhan yang nye bar blang ba ji lta bur //
translated: Moreover, how could the appropriated

original: nye bar len pa yin par 'gyur te //
analyzed: nye bar len pa yin par 'gyur te //
translated: Be the appropriator?

original: 'dir nye bar blang bar bya ba yin pas ni nye bar blang ba ste las yin la /
analyzed: 'dir nye bar blang bar bya ba yin pas ni nye bar blang ba ste las yin la /
translated: Here, the appropriated is the object, and the appropriator is the agent.

original: de la ni gdon mi za bar nye bar len pa po nye bar sogs pa po yod par 'gyur dgos so //
analyzed: de la ni gdon mi za bar nye bar len pa po nye bar sogs pa po yod par 'gyur dgos so //
translated: In that regard, it is certain that the appropriator, the appropriating one, exists.

original: nye bar len pa de gal te bdag nyid yin par 'dod na ni /
analyzed: nye bar len pa de gal te bdag nyid yin par 'dod na ni /
translated: If the appropriator is asserted to be the appropriated,

original: de'i tshe nye bar blang ba nyid nye bar len pa po yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe nye bar blang ba nyid nye bar len pa po yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: then the appropriated would be the appropriator.

original: de'i phyir las dang byed pa po dag gcig yin pas gcod pa po dang gcad par bya ba dang / bum pa dang rdza mkhan dang / me dang bud shing la sogs pa rnams kyang gcig nyid du 'gyur na /
analyzed: de'i phyir las dang byed pa po dag gcig yin pas gcod pa po dang gcad par bya ba dang / bum pa dang rdza mkhan dang / me dang bud shing la sogs pa rnams kyang gcig nyid du 'gyur na /
translated: Therefore, since the object and agent are the same, the cutter and the cut object, the pot and the potter, and fire and fuel, and so on, would also be the same.

original: de ni mthong ba'am rigs pa'ang ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /🔽nye bar blang ba ji lta bur //
analyzed: de ni mthong ba'am rigs pa'ang ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir / nye bar blang ba ji lta bur //
translated: But that is neither seen nor is it logical.🔽In order to demonstrate this, it is said:🔽How could the appropriated

original: nye bar len po yin par 'gyur //🔽zhes bshad de /
analyzed: nye bar len po yin par 'gyur //🔽zhes bshad de /
translated: Be the appropriator?

original: phyogs de ni gtan mi srid pa nyid do //
analyzed: phyogs de ni gtan mi srid pa nyid do //
translated: This is absolutely impossible.

original: @192b zhes bya bar dgongs pa yin no //
analyzed: @192b zhes bya bar dgongs pa yin no //
translated: This is the intended meaning.

original: 'dir nye bar len pa tsam yang bdag yin par mi rigs pa ni bden mod kyi 'on kyang nye bar len pa po nye bar len pa las tha dad pa nyid yin par 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'dir nye bar len pa tsam yang bdag yin par mi rigs pa ni bden mod kyi 'on kyang nye bar len pa po nye bar len pa las tha dad pa nyid yin par 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
translated: Here, it is certainly not reasonable that the mere appropriated aggregates are the self, but still, the appropriator would be different from the appropriated aggregates.

original: 'di yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: 'di yang mi rung ste /
translated: This also is not correct.

original: gang gi phyir /🔽bdag ni nye bar len pa las //
analyzed: gang gi phyir / bdag ni nye bar len pa las //
translated: Why?

original: gzhan du 'thad pa nyid ma yin //
analyzed: gzhan du 'thad pa nyid ma yin //
translated: The self is not tenable as different🔽from the appropriated aggregates.

original: gal te gzhan na len med par //
analyzed: gal te gzhan na len med par //
translated: If it were different, it would be apprehended without the appropriated aggregates,

original: gzung yod rigs na gzung du med //
analyzed: gzung yod rigs na gzung du med //
translated: but it is not apprehended without them.

original: gal te nye bar len pa las bdag tha dad pa yin na ni bum pa las snam bu ltar de nye bar len pa las tha dad par gzung du yod par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te nye bar len pa las bdag tha dad pa yin na ni bum pa las snam bu ltar de nye bar len pa las tha dad par gzung du yod par 'gyur na /
translated: If the self were different from the appropriated aggregates, like a cloth is different from a pot, it would be apprehended as different from the appropriated aggregates.

original: de ltar gzung du ni med do //
analyzed: de ltar gzung du ni med do //
translated: But it is not apprehended as such.
